Reviews.Title: “A good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: galind
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by the surroundings when you enter this hotel. You will feel like are parking in a loading dock, because that is what you will be facing. However, when you go inside you will find a comfortable, affordable hotel that is a block from Hollywood Boulevard. The Orchid Suites is a small hotel surrounded by tall buildings and the loading dock for a vertical shopping area. The lobby is unpretentious, but the rooms are large and comfortable, the staff pleasant and helpful. Breakfast and parking are included in the the room rate. There is a small heated pool, which my grandchildren loved. Every room has a full kitchen. If you want a large fancy hotel with a gym, large pool and several restaurants, this is not for you. If you want comfortable place to sleep and relax when you come to L. A. to visit the tourist sites, Orchid Suites will be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “This is the Heart of Hollywood.”
Reviews.Author: Jackie D
Reviews.Content: You can't get any better accommodations at afffordable prices in the heart of Hollywood, then here. The Hollywood Orchid Suites hotel lies just around the corner from Gramin's Chinese Theater, Madame Trousseau's House of Wax, Ripley's Believe It Or Not, and the famous walk of fame. There are five and a half miles of film, TV, radio and music Stars surrounding this hotel so you won't be bored if you just walk the streets for a couple days, which is exactly what my husband did while I was busy in seminars and meetings March 2012. I highly recommend a stay at this hotel but don't expect the pool to be heated. It was not the whole four days we were there. Other than that, the staff was nice, the suites included a full kitchen with pots and pans, so you could cook a full meal. A Fresh and Easy grocery store is walking distance away so we ate a number of meals in our room. Otherwise expect to pay at least $25 for lunch and more for dinner in neighboring restaurants like California Pizza Kitchen and the Hard Rock Cafe. Also, each suite has either a balcony or spacious patio deck. We had a patio deck and it was wonderful for smaller, informal meetings. Bring your camera and extra batteries because you'll take a lot of pictures. Oh, one last thing, make sure you check out the size of John Wayne's feet at the Chinese Theater. It really surprised me!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient, great service”
Reviews.Author: Atiekay
Reviews.Content: This place was perfect for two nights in LA. My husband and I and our two kids (5 and 7) stayed in a deluxe king/king suite. It was so roomy and a great value. Everything is very clean and comfortable. The staff are very friendly. The breakfast is light but just fine. It was great to be so close to the Chinese Theater and Walk of Fame, and it was an easy drive to both Griffith Observatory and the La Brea Tar Pits. The pool is heated and my kids swam three times during our two days here. We will stay here again and will recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, so handy to everything”
Reviews.Author: Kylie M
Reviews.Content: This place is supreme, a little outdated but hey we were only there to sleep,Room was massive,and the staff were exceptional, light breakfast in the morning was enough to keep you going cereals and muffins, Price was awesome, Location what can I say, so close to WALK OF FAME, just walk through alley of shopping centre and you are smack bang in the middle of Hollywood Blvd, felt safe walking through alley at night.Will definately stay here again if I come back

Reviews.Title: “Big Room, Good Service and EXCELLENT Location!”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadagain201011
Reviews.Content: Look no further. This is the place in THE PLACE! Right in the heart of Hollywood. Everyone is friendly and nice. The room is clean. Even by my standards. Since I am a bit too picky, that means room is REALLY clean. I liked it overall. Will definitely stay there again. The only criticism is the outdated furniture, interior, and exterior. But I really do not care. For this price for this size for this location. It is just PERFECT! Do yourself a favor, go watch sunset at the Griffith.

Reviews.Title: “WOW. Massive rooms and amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: Dollie91
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed here for 8 nights. The room sizes are huge. Full kitchen and everything! We had free wifi which was great! The location couldn't be better. Literally a 1 minute walk away from everything. The staff were lovely and they had a great taxi service with such a helpful driver named Harry! Would definatly go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good value & Location--Outdated--Questionable Security”
Reviews.Author: WildFan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times over the last 10 years and they haven't really updated anything in those years. Location is great and convenient and it's a good value, but could definitely use updating. Also, I had a room with a bedroom, living room which was very dark when I came in so when I left for the day that day I put out the do not disturb sign and left lights on so that it wasn't dark when I got home later that day. Someone was in my room. They didn't clean it at all, but someone came in as all the lights were turned off. I reported this to the front desk, but never heard anything from them about it. Just be careful with your stuff if you stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: dkgunte
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in July 2011 and it was wonderful. It was in an ideal location just behind the Kodak Theatre, and within walking distance of everything we needed. I liked the fact that they provided free underground parking in a secure garage. Like most others have said the decor is a little outdated, but for the price and size we did not mind at all. This was much better than being cramped in a small hotel room. We are actually planning on heading back to LA in October and stay here again. The front desk was wonderful for our trip, and they provided excellent advice on things to do in the area outside the normal activities. Would recommend this place to anyone traveling to Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic size and location”
Reviews.Author: exploringaussie
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here after a week at Anaheim doing the Disney thing! We loved having a kitchen to make our own food after a week of eating out. The hotel rooms are apartment style and really spacious.. Granted, they are older style and the kitchens are dated but they were very clean, safe and the location for what we wanted, was perfect.. We used the buses and railways that were literally a 2 min walk through the Hollywood & Highland shopping centre. The pool was a great size too, although we never used it. For Aussies making the trek to do the sights with kids I would definitely stay here.. Our room was a one bedroom & had 2 king sized beds, 2 massive flatscreen tv's and a full sized fridge.. It has good security and a laundry (coin op) which helped a lot! Breakfasts were ok too.. We took ours back to our room, is just toast, cereal & pastries, fruit etc.. But plenty to start the day.. It's not grand, but it's safe, clean and oh so central with lovely helpful staff!

Reviews.Title: “A Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mustangwitha302
Reviews.Content: We were a little apprehensive about staying here after reading some of the reviews. However, This is a great palce to stay, The room was large, it was clean and had a comfy bed. What more could you want ? Freindly staff ? You got it, Simple continental breakfast, You got it. Conveniant to Kodak Theatre and other attractions, restaurants You got it. No this is not a posh hotel with over the top everything, It is simply a clean comfy place to rest your head which is exactly what you will want to do after sightseeing all day. I will be staying here again this year. Nice hotel with a nice price. The only bad thing I have to say was the location of my room was near the service alley to the Highland Center. So the 6:00 am rude awakening by the garbage truck was the one dissapointment, but that just happened to be garbage day.

Reviews.Title: “Best position in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Tracy G
Reviews.Content: What an awesome well priced hotel to stay in. Right on the back door step of the Kodak Theatre and only steps away from Madame Tussauds, Hooters, Ripleys Believe it or Not, the Stars in the pavement and all things Hollywood, loved my time staying there, fully self contained, great hosts.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Cathyg25
Reviews.Content: We were a bit dubious after reading about decor being dated etc, as we are usually quite choosy about where we stay. However, we were amazed at the location - behind the Kodak Theatre, easy walking distance to everything on Hollywood Boulevard - we really felt we were in the heart of everything Hollywood has to offer! Although the suites are slightly dated, the rooms are so spacious, with heaps of storage and hanging space and 2 large bathrooms, our family of 6 (parents and 4 adult 'children') felt we could spread out without encroaching on one another's space. The breakfast was basic, but a good, quick start to the day, and great to have space in our suite to all sit together and plan our day. The free wi-fi was just perfect for our young adults, and free parking was awesome. Will definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Not flash but super friendly & location plus :o)”
Reviews.Author: ukkird
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orchid Suites on a stopover on our way back to NZ in mid January this year. Booked it based upon glowing recommendations on TA and am very pleased we did. We got a family suite with a super king bed in the lounge area plus a separate bedroom with another super king bed. I shared with my daughter and my husband with our son; we were concerned about being squished in the bed but to be honest we could almost all have shared one. THEY ARE ENORMOUS!! As other reviewers have said, this place is not palatial by any stretch. The rooms are very well used and are as clean as you could reasonably get a place which has painted kitchen cupboards. Housekeeping were great, the rooms were made up every day. The lady in the breakfast room was just lovely; she sliced my kids' croissants for them and couldn't do enough to help. All of the front desk staff were lovely too; couldn't have been better really. I take my hat off to them for storing our mountains of luggage on our last day between checking out & leaving for LAX. Definitely ask them for one of their bus / metro info sheets; they tell you where to catch buses for different destinations which really took some of the stress out of a trip to The Grove shopping centre (well worth a visit, esp to the farmer's market - fab pizza and doughnuts to die for!!!). Apparently when we were there we missed Jack Black filming... we were 100m away having lunch, so google it before you go as we were told that they advertise what's going to be happening there. Universal Studios is one stop away on the Metro... easy peasy.... there's a huge supermarket just further up Hollywood Boulevard - can't miss it... walk a couple of blocks and then it's down a flight of stairs on the right. We ate at the California Pizza Kitchen in the Hollywood/Highland centre (fabulous Skecher shop there - great prices for us kiwis)... which is right on your doorstep. Great service, great food and great prices. Also walked down N Highland Ave to Inn and Out Burger (yummo) on W Sunset Blvd. Just across the rd is a huge discount shoe shop (Off Broadway) where the kids got some well priced Adidas trainers & Nike hi-tops. I don't think we'd stay in this area if we were planning a longer trip around LA as it's not the most relaxing place to be (it is after all tourist central!!) but certainly can't fault The Orchid Suites :o)

Reviews.Title: “Great spot - bargain for the location!”
Reviews.Author: Margyg
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviewers of this property - the location is fantastic. The property is a bit dated but I don't stay at hotels to cook my own food (heck, I'm on holiday!) so didn't use the kitchen - though imagine this would be a real positive for people travelling with a family etc. Breakfast very good, great bonus to find a guest laundry (the one thing you can't escape on an extended trip is the washing!), and of course parking and free wi-fi. I also agree with comments about noise from above floors in particular - the friends we were travelling with said it sounded like the people above them were rearranging the furniture until around 1am - so try for a high floor. Great, friendly staff too!

Reviews.Title: “A Top Value Hollywood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladyjadegd
Reviews.Content: Hollywood Orchid Suites is not fancy, so as long as you understand this, you're good. This was once an apartment complex that has been converted into a hotel. It's old and it is outdated. What they say is true, but the rooms are HUGE. Last weekend was my second stay and I have to say it is a great value and an awesome location for visiting Hollywood. Did I mention the rooms are huge? They have standard hotel rooms, but also huge suites. The rooms come with full sized kitchens and they have upgraded the furniture and televisions since my last stay. They also have secure parking. There is a heated pool and a rooftop garden. In the morning, they serve a pretty decent continental breakfast with juices, bagels, fruit, cereal, etc. They also have both a computer you can use in the breakfast area and free wi-fi. You have to understand that this is an old property, so it is quite dated, but it is clean. The only thing I found to be not as clean as I thought it should be was the shower curtain. I think it might have gotten missed as it was a little dirty on the inside. Otherwise, I feel comfortable staying here. I didn't give it 5 stars, because it's not a five star hotel. There are Marriotts I don't even give a five star to, but for what you get for the price, this is an amazing place to stay. Oh, the price! This visit I stayed in a one bedroom (king bed) suite with a living room sofa bed and of course, a full kitchen. It's was $140 out the door. That's an average cost for a hotel, but if you want something decent in this area of Hollywood, this is the only thing you will find at this price that isn't grungy. It's just a little piece of affordable Hollywood. If only they would nix the bedspreads and go to duvets! That's really my only complaint! Have I mentioned the location? Oh, it's right behind the Hollywood & Highland mall. Yes, that is where the Kodak Theater is (think Oscars) and the El Capitan is across the street, and Grauman's Chinese Theater is a couple blocks away. You are literally steps away from the Hollywood Walk of Fame. We walked to the Palladium for a concert, but there is also a metro station right around the corner so you can literally get around LA and Hollywood very easily even if you don't have a vehicle or don't want to have to drive and park! Definitely check this out when you're looking for a place to lay your head in Hollywood. I think you'll find it a value, too.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated”
Reviews.Author: Bioko
Reviews.Content: As others have mentioned already, the rooms in this hotel are pretty outdated but ok. We had a good time here however prices were relatively high for what we got. Good points to mention: breakfast is very nice and fresh and there is free parking in the hotel's private garage.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and great location, very helpful service - but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: NewportMania
Reviews.Content: Literally right behind the Kodak -- what the picture doesn't show is that the huge 5 story wall of the Kodak is what you see when you are out on your patio! The room walls seemed thin -- and the floors too! You could hear everything above and beside you, and the noise level went on into the night. That being said: I liked the Hollywood Orchid. It was quaint and you can't beat the price for location, free parking, free internet, free breakfast. The rooms are big and it is great to have a kitchen if you plan to stay for a few days. Many good restaurants are within walking distance. I've stayed at the Magic Castle a block away in the past, which is quieter and has more character, and I like it better ... but they are now about $50 a night more than Hollywood Orchid.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: AliBO2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and the location was awesome! The room was had was massive with a separate kitchen/dining room, large patio area and living space. Staff are really friendly and helpful, heaps of advice to give. Free parking if you hire a car, right near the subway/bus stops. Be right in the action without having all the noise! Awesome stay, wish we were there for longer!

Reviews.Title: “So friendly and PERFECT location”
Reviews.Author: Joe P
Reviews.Content: This place was an absolutely great find!! The staff are just wonderful, the lady at front desk is so lovely and the breakfast lady was one of the nicest people we have met on our trip. The location is what makes this the best. 30 second walk from hotel to Hollywood Boulevard through shopping plaza. And the Plaza is the best spot in LA to see the Hollywood Sign. Rooms are a little old but we got upgraded and had a huge 2 bedroom suite, with kitchen, dining, and bathroom for the 2 of us. Free wireless internet and secure underground parking as well. Will go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: 10Lynn
Reviews.Content: Pros - Right behind Walk of fame, free internet, free breakfast and free parking. 1 station away from Universal Studio, you could save the $ by taking the train. Breakfast is simple but they have a very helpful and friendly tea lady :) Cons - You could probably hear your neighbours upstairs opening the balcony door/cupboard. I was given level 1 room and probably a little noisy in the morning but if you are those who wake up early then is ok. During my stay in early feb, I could smell the paint smell in my room :( The heater is kinda noisy, therefore, I off it during the night but the room turns cold no choice I have to turn on again however, the heater do not seems to be that strong. Just a little rundown but room is big with kitchen if you are not too messy abt the condition. If you plan to drive out to elsewhere and not stay most of ur time in the Hollywood area probably you can consider another hotel unless you really spend most of your time in Hollywood. Overall if you are looking for hollywood location, free breakfast/Internet/Parking this is the hotel. Price reasonable. Take note they charge for local calls...

Reviews.Title: “Big room, Big noise”
Reviews.Author: mitch s
Reviews.Content: Checked onto hotel yesterday. Big room has two seperate bedrooms. The hotel ispretty old, looks like converted old apartment building.Rooms are outdated but clean. Has kitchen with fridge, stove, micro coffee maker. the floors are thin and listened all noght the the sounds of people walking around in the rooms above me. This morning awoke to the sounds of ammer drillsing in the parking garage. Working on the plumbing is what I understand. The parking garage is low clearance, only 6'4" so if you have an SUV, check the height before you book. The hotel is convienient to the mall, starbucks, several resturaunts, California Pizza Kitchen and my favorite, The Grill. Never had a bad meal there. Staff is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: whitney mae m
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 3 night wish we were there more. the location is great right behind kodak theater and a lovely little shopping center but in a kind of cul de sac street, so nice and quite. We go in before check in time but staff had our room ready and a lovely lady checked us in think she was called mia? The rooms were such a surprise they were more like a flat massive bed big wardrobe nice bathroom and a big kitchen. the hotel is super clean when they make your room up they really go at it you can even smell how clean it is ( if that makes sense ). the staff were all very helpful with directions taxis trips etc. Also we didnt use the pool but our friends did and they said it was lovely and warm and very clean!

Reviews.Title: “Still our first choice at Hollywood.”
Reviews.Author: LeonKay
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Hollywood Orchid Suites and again we experienced it as an excellent choice. This hotel is very well situated right behind the Kodak Theatre, and also provides a security entrance. Although the hotel is centrally situated only one block away from all the happenings at Hollywood Boulevard, it is in a quiet cul-de-sac road. We experienced the reception staff quick and efficient and our room was also found to be very spacious, neat and tidy. The kitchen is fully equipped with crockery and utensils. A complimentary breakfast is provided although the breakfast area is a bit crowded. There is not enough seating provided for all the guests unless you arrive very early. The best solution was to dish up your breakfast and enjoy it in your own spacious dining room. We found the reception staff very friendly and helpful when we made enquiries and in assisting us when requesting for transport. They also reacted promptly when we complained one evening after midnight about noisy tenants. They immediately went to their room and requested them to quieten down. Complimentary Internet is provided and the hotel also has a nice well maintained swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honest Staff”
Reviews.Author: Rosie063
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 days at the end of December 2011. The first morning we were there we went down for their continental breakfast. I was tired from travelling and forgot my purse, which had our passports and much of our holiday cash, hanging on the back of a chair. The hotel staff saved my purse and put it in their office. It was approx. 1.5 hours later when I realized it was missing. I went to the office, and they said they knew who it belonged to, however they did not know which room I was in. Nothing was missing! This could have been a really bad start to our holiday. Thanks for being honest :) The location was great. Many people told me that Holllywood was a bad place to stay, but the hotel location and that section of Hollywood Bouvelard was great. My thirteen year old son and I even went for a walk on Hollywood Bouvelard at 10:00 PM on New Years Eve, and I felt fine. The extra security of the hotel was appreciated including the locking underground parking. It was also very handy to have access to a washer and dryer to do a few loads of laundry. There was a grocery store approx. 4 blocks away that we could walk to that had everything we needed. I had read the reviews on Trip Advisor and although the decor was not cutting edge, the quality of the bedding and pillows was good. The towels were even better quality than the ones we got on our Disney Cruise following. The staff was very friendly and helpful no matter who we were speaking to. It was great to have a spacious and comfortable suite to make as our home base. The subway station was also very close. The pool was not heated at this time of year, and we were busy sightseeing so we did not use it. We also went up to the roof top garden to see what was there. There was no one up there, but it appears a good place for smokers to relax. I did seem to lose the internet signal a couple of times, however it does it appear they have a few routers, so I would refresh and connect to a different one. I would not hesitate to stay here again. Thanks again so much for saving my purse!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Loved this place and location!”
Reviews.Author: LLPProsper_Tx
Reviews.Content: When traveling to LA in the past with my daughters, I always opted to stay near Beverly Hills out of saftey reasons, but this time I was with my husband and I thought he would like the energy and nightlife of staying near Hollywood Blvd. I found this hotel and read many wonderful reviews about it and decided to give it a try since it is VERY close to Kodak Theater, Graumann's, Walk of Fame, etc. A little hard to find at night but once we did and realized we had the safety of parking our car in a locked, underground garage, we were impressed. Lots of security getting into it but the front desk people were very friendly, helpful, and kind. Went up to our room...yes, it is an old apartment complex, but the room was huge! Large sitting area with attached kitchen, hallway to bedroom, and then bath area. Lots of storage area. The next best part after LOCATION is that it was very clean...especially the sheets...nice and crisp. Ok, the carpet is old and the linoleum in the bathroom is stained, but the tub, sink, toilet were clean. Couches in living room were plush and not seedy looking. They do ask you to clean the dishes you use but that's ok, especially since the dishes were nice and clean and new looking. I read reviews about it being noisy...yes, at times, it was but you are in the heart of Hollywood, not Beverly Hills....there are going to be some sirens and noise. Unfortunately, while we were there we had the flu (had it before we arrived) but I have to admit that, if I had to be sick, this was a nice place to be in. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Traval2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in early January. After reading reviews on TA was aware of what to expect of the hotel. It was as it had been reported, a little dated but very clean and well kept. We stayed in a one bedroom apartment with a full kitchen which was much appreciated after staying in hotels. The apartment had a sofa bed and we requested a rollaway as we had 2 children with us. The bed in the main bedroom was very comfortable, however the sofa bed and roll away were very uncomfortable. I would suggest trying to book a two bedroom apartment to avoid this. The price of $465 including tax for 3 nights was very good considering there were four of us and it included breakfast. The breakfast was very good with choice of cereals, fresh fruit, bagels to toast, croissants, coffee, tea, juice etc and as much you wanted. There was always a very helpful staff member there to assist and even toast your bagel for you. All members of the staff were friendly and helpful, booking taxis,giving directions etc. The location was excellent right near Hollywood Blvd with the Hollywood and Highland Centre with shops and places to eat, Kodak Theatre and Metro a few steps away. Grauman's Chinese Theatre was a short walk up the street. On the day we visited Universal Studios it was good having the Metro so close and it was only one stop to get there. The cost was $1.50 each way. The only small complaint was that being on the ground floor we could hear some noise from upstairs on one of the afternoons when a child was running around but did not disturb us at night. I would ask for an upstairs unit to avoid this. If you are looking for somewhere to stay that is close to attractions, clean and reasonably priced I would recommend the Orchid Suites Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Place in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: purpletravler
Reviews.Content: This is our third times check in to this hotel, the main reason is the great location, so close to Kodak Center, Metro station, Magic Castle. We also enjoyed the free breakfast, locked parking lot - feel very secure in Hollywood. The staff and management were very friendly and helpful to offer us another room when we complaint about noises from upstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AL85
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great price and in a really great location. Right off Hollywood boulevard and all you need to do is walk down a path at the front of the hotel and your in the Hollywood highland shopping centre. The rooms are a little dated but are really clean and the beds were so comfy! There is also a continental breakfast included which they don't really tell u about on their website, but it is great. Bagels, muffins, fruit, cereal etc. the staff are so nice and friendly. The walls are a little thin so if people are noisy next door it is a little annoying if trying to sleep but a lot of hotels in the US are like that I found! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “What a spot!”
Reviews.Author: packmeup
Reviews.Content: Loved the location of this hotel. RIght in the middle of it all and everything you need in a location for a three day tour of LA. Tourist buses just a minute walk from the hotel which take you to Beverly Hills, Muscle Beach, The VIper Room etc and shopping on your doorstep. The hotel breakfast was not anything to write home about but the room clean. Will stay here again if I return to LA, which I hope I do.

Reviews.Title: “great location, service, and large room”
Reviews.Author: NewPlaceFan
Reviews.Content: This property is essentially a renovated apartment building. The room was large with a full kitchen. Our friends had a room with a separate bedroom and sofabed in the living room. It isn't a luxury property, but the location is great - just a block from the main street in Hollywood. Breakfast is provided - simple rolls and such. Desk attendants wever VERY friendly, and parking worked fine. We would stay here or the Celebrity (down the street) again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Emma071
Reviews.Content: I was really amazed by the great location. Directly behind the Kodak theatre. So much in walking distance - hop on hop off bus, Kodak theatre, shops, Chinese theatre, hotel Roosevelt. There is a supermarket really close so you can easily cook in your room. The rooms were really spacious and had great tvs. It is a little dated but this didn't bother us. It had everything we needed. The breakfast was basic but fine. I would go back. Hollywood is a good base for seeing LA!!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Pink_bear19
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Orchid Suites in January 2012 in a Junior Suite and and Executive Room. Both were more than adequate - like others have said, the whole complex is dated but clean, tidy and very spacious. The kitchens were sufficiently stocked and the basic continental breakfast served in the morning could be brought back and eaten in our room. Highlight - location. There is no better located property - walk through the tunnel into Hollywood Highland Center and you're in the action with a great range of food, shopping and entertainment right there. The only real downside is that, because of the property's age and lack of soundproofing, it sounded like a herd of elephants were staying in the room upstairs and their relatives were int he pool until it closed for the evening. Having said that, we had a quiet night's sleep. Perhaps, if you were particularly sensitive to noise, a top floor room might be a better option. Staff were all friendly and accommodating and I'd definitely recommend this property to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good for families & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Nudgee_1983
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in Dec 2011. While it is a little dated at the price it is great value and it is clean. No cost for parking a car in a locked garage. The location was great so as a non-USA person not used to driving I could leave the car in the garage and walk and catch the red bus tours or the metro. It is so close to the Chinese Theatre etc it is not funny so you don't have to walk with the family through some of the more seedy areas. Having cooking facilities is very useful and breakfast was great.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: alan42Brisbane
Reviews.Content: yep, for where it is Orchid Suites provides low priced accommodation for the budget conscious. We ended up with 2 rooms next to each other. The rooms were a good size, ageing for sure but clean and quiet. Comp breakfast was fine, the staff friendly, free use of internet in the lobby. We'd driven up from Anaheim on our way to SF so the included secure parking was a bonus. An awesome find!

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood orchid Suites Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: DeborahWALL
Reviews.Content: I booked accommodation at the Hollywood Orchid Suites because of the review on trip advisor and I'm mighty pleased I did. We are a family of four, two adults and two teenagers and the room dwe had was perfect. It had two king size beds in separate rooms. The rooms were clean and the shower was hot, fluffy towels and a stove and microwave if you are inclined to cook. The breakfast had something for all of us. Fresh fruit, cereal, bagels and pastries - a perfect start to the day. Location was spot on for us as we only had three days. Quick walk to the Hollywood strip, train to Universal Studios and tourist bus tours around the city. Plenty of food joints in the area. Lastly the staff were helpful, especially the breakfast crew who couldn't have been nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Can't ask for a better location”
Reviews.Author: kerpsi
Reviews.Content: We took 2 rooms at the hollywood orchid suites for 3 nights. The hotel is located in a very central place. Very close to the highland mall, taxis are always available as soon as you walk out of the hotel, the supermarket is within 5 minutes walking distance. The rooms were very clean, very spacious and the hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. Our room didn't have and cooking tools or pots and pans. I just had to mention this to the staff and within half hour they brought me new pots, pans and cooking tools. The breakfast contains croissants, breads, muffins, apple sauce, cereals, fruit, coffee, tea and hot chocolate. The lady who serves the breakfast is very obliging and did bring us hot milk for our cereal. We could take our breakfast to Our rooms which we did and we made scrambled eggs in our room kitchens. The washing machine and dryer in the basement are really large machines and was helpful in getting our laundry done before we went to the next city. The hotel staff gave us leaflets of nearby places from wheRe we could order food which was good. We ordered food from the oriental bistro a chines take away which was very tasty food. Overall an excellent place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in LA”
Reviews.Author: DenialRiver
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at Hollywood Orchid Suites and could not be happier with the value and location. Situated just behind the Chinese Theatre, Kodak Theatre, Madame Tussauds and the Hard Rock Cafe the location cannot be beaten. You can access the apartments through the spectacular Hollywood & Highland Shopping Centre which gives you direct access to Hollywood Blvd and all it's attractions which span this block and the next couple of blocks. There is a subway station in the same block which was great because we caught the well run and beautifully clean trains everywhere - one stop from Universal Studios - and only $21 for a 7 day Tap & Go pass. Also the Hop on Hop Off Bus stops just out the front in Hollywood Blvd which is great for orientation. The staff at Orchid Suites are extremely helpful and friendly. A special thanks to Marlo who came to our rescue when we got lost, well over and above the call of duty. Orchid Suites is an old apartment building so don't expect brand new 5 star rooms, they are a bit dated. However, they are spacious, very well appointed with excellent heating and cooling and are very kept very clean. We stayed in a deluxe suite which had a separate bedroom and a full kitchen with oven, fridge, coffee machine and microwave as well as crockery and cutlery all in very good condition. The lounge room had a large LCD TV and the bedroom LCD was not much smaller. The free breakfast is an absolute bonus. It's a continental breakfast, meaning of course, no hot stuff, but a great selection - muffins, bagels, croissant, cereal, toast, fruit and juice (see pics). The kitchen area is a bit tight and there are only three tables, but you can load up a tray and take it back to your room, which we preferred anyway.There is free secure parking which we didn't need but is yet another bonus if you do have a car. We paid $129 (before tax of course - never quite got used to that!) which we felt was amazing value for what we got. We did have one night of thoughtless girls giggling quite late into the night but that's not the hotels fault, I have stayed in much more expensive and newer hotels where the noise tends to travel. I would definitely stay there again if we ever go back to LA and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for great value in a top location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, location, staff”
Reviews.Author: SFbmore
Reviews.Content: We stayed here, in a room for three. It is great for budget travelers. The location is perfect...just behind the Chinese Theater, but quiet. The room was great, spacious with a handy kitchenette and a normal bathroom (nothing to rave about). The room was clean and they gave us an extra bed. The staff is very nice and while the breakfast isn't great, it is free, as is use of the lobby computer. We will definitely stay here again. There is on site parking and you can't beat the cost, convenience, and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - will come again”
Reviews.Author: TanyaZ182
Reviews.Content: I think this is the best hotel we stayed at during our February'11 2-week holidays in USA. It's not fancy like some other hotels in Hollywood area, but for money payed we really got more then we expected. The night before we've stayed in a tiny room in a fancy historical hotel for double value, so we were more than happy to move to the spacious and inexpensive place where we had kitchenette, living-room, bedroom and bathroom. The suite was really big! It's really close to main Hollywood attractions: Kodak theater and Hollywood blvd are just couple of minutes away, very close to metro station, Hertz car rent is in next building, LA city tours across the street, which is very helpful. Plus, there are a lot of stores and restaurants in the area. Very friendly staff helped us to book our next hotel in Grand Canyon, and give all directions on how to get to Disneyland. In fact, we could even go on a bus right from our hotel, but we asked too late when that bus already left. If I ever come to Hollywood again, I have no doubts I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugged2008
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hollywood Orchid Suites and it's a terrific hotel. Firstly, the position is A1 for Hollywood - just metres from the main bit of Hollywood Blvd and a couple of miles from Universal Studios. The front desk is very organised and had us checked in with tons of info within minutes. Secure underground parking is all part of the price. The rooms are a little dated, but bright, clean and well serviced. We had a very spacious apartment, with comfortable beds, safe, cooking facilities and more. Throw in free WIFI, free breakfast (bagels, pastry, coffee, OJ and lots more), pool and a very professional front office team and you're on a winner with terrific value.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: lg13865
Reviews.Content: We have just spent one night at the Hollywood Orchid suites. We hired a car at LAX and drove, it wasn't difficult to find but glad we took the satnav option! the free parking was great and it's right next to a shopping mall for a quick feed. The room was clean and just about big enough for the 5 of us, but my 17 year old slept on a rollaway and I have to say it was the most uncomfortable mattress I have ever seen in a hotel - like sleeping on the wire fence around a tennis court!! The breakfast is really just a few bagels and croissant, but it was fine for an early start. All in all a perfectly good place for a one or two night stop but I wouldn't want to be there for any longer than that and I would definitely avoid the rollaway beds!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, free parking and excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: james_is_now
Reviews.Content: Hollywood Orchid Suites is the perfect location to visit the main tourist areas on Hollywood Blvd. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the wax museum, walk of fame, the Kodak theater and the hand prints at the Chinese theater. You can also visit the El Capitan theatre and many other attractions from here. The hotel staff are very helpful and there is free secure parking available. We have a room at the front of the hotel near reception and it was fine...slightly dated but fine. The room was very clean and the bed comfortable, we were concerned about noise in the foyer, but there was none for the 2 nights we stayed. There is also a free continental breakfast available and free WiFi. Overall value for money here is exceptional. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SteMur
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in December. The location is fantastic in that it is located directly behind the Kodak Grauman's Chinese Theater on Hollywood Boulevard and beside many restaurants and shops. The suite I was in was a little dated, but it had everything I needed including a large LCD TV, 2 x Queen beds, kitchen with Fridge, Cooker, Microwave and sink. There was also a dining area with a table and four chairs. A separate bathroom and dressing area with loads of storage for clothes along with a small balcony really made this a little bit of luxury in the center of Hollywood. Parking is free and is in a secure underground car park accessed via an automatic opening gate. There is also an elevator from the car park to the main reception and the rooms. The staff in the hotel are very friendly and very helpful, every time I walked through reception I was always greeted with a smile and a chat. Every question I had was never a problem and the local knowledge was brilliant. If I was to return to LA, I would definitely stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff - perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: Ingrid K
Reviews.Content: The staff here were fantastic and helpful, and were able to assist us with an issue created by our travel agent The two-bedroom apartment was fantastic for our family, huge rooms, comfortable beds and clean kitchen and bathroom. Great value for money in the location!!! Free parking was an added bonus. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DEEBS57
Reviews.Content: Hollywood Orchid Suites was such a good find after looking for accommodation for weeks. the staff are super friendly and helpful with tips for places to see and things to do and how to get there. The location was brilliant, close to the main part of Hollywood, with just a small walk( and I mean very small) to walk of fame, subways, bus stops, tour stops, Lux bus stop, Kodak theatre, Madame Trussads, Gruaman's Theatre, another wax museum, and shops to buy fresh food to take back to your room. The rooms are big and clean the only problem I had was that there is no overhead lights, they only have lamps in the living area.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: JensogSetta
Reviews.Content: Location is what sells this place. Our room (202) was outdated and the floor was a little wonky(creeked alot). It was clean but everything was a little old and it could do with some updating. It faced the street and it got a little noisy. Our car was in a locked garage which was really good and the hotel was always locked so itÂ´s safe. The location is the best thing about this hotel, only 2 minute walk to Hollywood Blvd. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “U can't beat the price or location and size of room”
Reviews.Author: stplogan
Reviews.Content: Super friendly front desk my husband enjoyed them so much he decided to book an extra night for us. We stayed nov 28 and 29th went swimming in the barely heated pool but it was very clean. Enjoyed a 1 bedroom suite w 2 beds and 2 chairs and a outdoor patio overlooking the pool and full size sliding doors for a great view. We checked out the rooftop garden it looked like a good spot to suntan but was in desperate need of spending a few bucks to plant som flowers and put a little color up there. The shower and bath were old but fine as were the kitchen everything u need to cook and eat a meal. Our kitchen had a view of the kodak theater and the deliveries were constant but it didn't bother us. They have a cute lil parking gargae locked for your safety and each spot was named after a current celebrity. We parked in bead pitt and gweneth paltrow. The breakfast was great bagels and cream cheese every morning and juice and coffee and cereals and muffins. Plenty to get ur day started. There was a awesome tunnel footsteps away that lead u into the kodak theater and took u out to the walk of fame. We enjoyed the grill stekhouse happy hour and also hooters happy hr was great. We went in the roosevelt hotel for drinks at the 25 degrees bar and they were great drink we had a great time but they were definetly pricey for 2 beers and 4 cocktails ran us 70 bucks. Was worth it for a one timer and we enjoyed the lobby our daughter lounged and relaxed while looking at the neat ceiling. Very beautiful older hotel but way to pricey for me. We will be happy to return to the Hollywood Orchid suites in the future if they give us the great deal they did on night 2. I won't lit the price but both nights we were given a excellent deal. Full size kitchen was great. Make sure u wash and put away all dishes clean or they charge 25 bucks lucky my husband saw that even thoughwe always leave our rooms clean upon exit no matter where we stay. Thanks hollywood orchid u r a totally aweome hotel and I cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very nice room”
Reviews.Author: Rachel C
Reviews.Content: The location is close to the mall (few steps away), hollywood walk of fame and subway train. All within walking distance. They also offer free breakfast. Its a good room for families and very clean.Staff are all friendly and very helpful. I would absolutely recommend this place and will stay again when we visit LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: flossygirl
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice at this Hotel. The first was when we were passing through coming on a road trip from San Francisco towards Phoenix via Las Vegas and Grand Canyon. The second was when we returned to LA getting ready to fly home to Australia. We were so impressed with the value that we decided to rebook. By the end of our holiday we were almost broke so the fact that it is great value for money was what sealed it for us! The location is second to none if you want to be in the thick of the action in Hollywood. It is right behind Grauman's Chinese Theatre and connected by a short walkway. It is a real find. The parking is free and the continental breakfast is complimentary and was sufficient for us although our friends preferred to walk down the road for a breakfast of eggs and bacon - they are big breakfast eaters but we are quite happy with cereal, toast, muffins, fruit and juice. The place is spotless although a little dated. We had a one bedroom suite where the lounge had been removed and replaced with another double bed. To share accommodations proved to save us money just about everywhere we travelled. The loungeroom was very large so to have a bed in it wasn't a problem. The suite also had a full kitchen. It was also very quiet. If there was any complaint I could make it is the fact that the bedroom didn't have a door on it so there was little privacy. If you are going to book this type of suite to share you had better know the other people you are staying with well as you have to pass the bedroom to get to the bathroom ;) If you are interested, we paid US$135 per night so if you split this between two couples it was extremely cheap. The staff are very helpful and the free internet is also a big plus. It is not the Ritz but the value for money cannot be beaten. I'd stay here again, most definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Prasan D
Reviews.Content: Orchid Suites is one of the best value hotels in Hollywood. The location is just amazing. It is connected to the Hollywood and highland mall and the metro station. It is just behind the Kodak theater and chinese theater where all the premieres occur. We were lucky the day we reached it was a premiere of Happy Feet 2 and we met tons of celebrities due to the location of the hotel. The hollywood blvd is very lively at night. The rooms are very spacious, a bit old but very clean and confortable. The hotel staff was very helpful. We bought universal studios tickets from the reception which is even cheaper than the Universal ticket counter and we dint have to wait for any lines to enter. The breakfast was very good and gave us a good start for the day. All in all a very good experience and no hotels can beat the location of Orchid Suites.

Reviews.Title: “We're Back!”
Reviews.Author: Meredith5001
Reviews.Content: My husband's convention was in a fancy-schmancy downtown hotel, but because of our positive experience at Orchid last spring, we decided to return. I like having my own apartment, free parking, and quick access to the subway. The staff at Orchid Suites is the best. The next to last day of our trip, I told the desk clerk that my mattress was unbearably hard. She chided me for not alerting them before, and within hours somebody was at my door, offering to switch us out. (I declined, since this was our last night.) The owner provides little touches that don't go unnoticed. For example, the towels are better quality than in some Hilton properties we generally stay in. Breakfast is certainly more than the basic continental one might expect in a relatively inexpensive inn. Even the namebrand shampoo and soap: nice touch! Yes, the carpet is a bit ragged, and the rooms are somewhat musty -- but the place is clean, the water pressure is great, and the rates can't be beat. As I've said before, Orchid Suites isn't for everyone ... but it's real good for us!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service & price”
Reviews.Author: shamway
Reviews.Content: Hollywood Orchid Suites is a fantastic hotel right in the middle of Hollywood. Its not fancy (nor does it pretend to be), but it is clean, tidy and the service is excellent. I have stayed here over 5 times now!

Reviews.Title: “Apartment Hotel for 5 ladies. Walking distance to everything”
Reviews.Author: CINDERELLASTRUNK
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for walking distance to Magic Castle, Kodak theater, El Capitan, Shopping, Dining, Movies, We had 5 ladies, Young and old. Ages, 17,23,24,50,72. Felt safe. No Frill's, Small pool, Old hollywood building. Felt like apartments. Kitchen, Dining table. 3 beds. Plus one rollaway bed. 1 bathroom. Looked like apartment building with a check in area. Had a normal Blah, Continental breakfast. But for the money. We all loved it. Clean enough. Just very dated. Needs updating in the curtain, bedding and carpet department. Then I would rave about it. Bathroom had some new tile. .

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: susaninboston
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights on my first trip to LA. The price was reasonable and the location was perfect for seeing Hollywood. The hotel is right next to the Hollywood and Highland complex, with lots of shops and restaurants. I was traveling alone, so it was good to be near a big complex with lots of people around. It was clean and comfortable. It's not luxurious by any means, but the location can't be beat. Loved the free parking too!

Reviews.Title: “Apartment style in the heart of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Clare C
Reviews.Content: The main reason I booked this hotel is because of its convenient location. Although not your 5 star hotel, this hotel has everything I need: - 5 mins walk to all the main Hollywood attractions: Chinese Theater, Kodak Theatre, Mdm Taussuds, Hollywood Museum, tour companies which takes you to tours likes the movie star home tours and the Metro Red line which takes you to Universal Studio and Warner Bros in 1 stop at $1.50. - Free parking, free wifi, free breakfast. Parking is gated and secure. Wifi is at reasonable speed because there are not many rooms hence not many guests are using the internet at the same time. Breakfast is simple and light but there are trays for you to have your breakfast in the comfort and privacy of your room. - A well equipped kitchen in every room with fridge (not bar fridge), toaster, microwave, gas cooktop, oven, sink and utensils. - Room is huge. Decor is a bit old and tired but clean. Bathroom is a little small but I find the heater fan useful in November. All in all, not your typical luxury hotel but convenient, clean and has everything I need. After all, you go to Hollywood not to spend time in your hotel room but outside! Enjoy! I did!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, unbeatable location and great value.”
Reviews.Author: travel43_11
Reviews.Content: My husband, children and I stayed here for 3 nights in August. We were very happy with our experience. First of all, the front desk staff were all so helpful and friendly. We were particularly impressed with the woman who was on duty when we checked in on 8/18 (sorry, I can't recall her name) Every time we came in or went out, she asked where we going and whether we needed any help (but not in a nosy way). The location of this hotel can't be beat. We were right behind Hollywood and Highland. We were able to easily walk around the Hollywood attractions. We even walked to the Hollywood Bowl one night for a show - an easy 1/2 - 3/4 mile walk. The hotel was a little worn and dated but very clean. This is not a luxurious hotel - it felt more like staying in a friends apartment. The rooms were huge. We were near the back of the hotel and had our own patio. We also had 2 queen beds, a full kitchen and a table/chairs for 4. We took advantage of the kitchen to save money on dining and ate in 2 nights. There is a small supermarket that is only a 3-4 blocks away so we could easily buy food and bring it back. The parking was great. You used a key to get in and out so it felt like the car was safe and you could go in/out as much as you wanted. Breakfast was fine for a free, continental breakfast. The breakfast area was small but they provided trays to bring the food back to your room. And, with such a big room with a table to eat at, this worked out very well. I don't think that you could beat the value that this hotel provided - outstanding location, full kitchen and large room. And, great staff. We would recommend this to anyone traveling to LA who is looking for a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: 19nat89
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the Orchid Suites, and just like the first time we we're not disappointed. If you are after luxury then this is not the place for you, but if you are after fantastic location and value then this is perfect! I think it is better than any standard hotel because it is like a home away from home. We had the executive suite and paid around $119 per night. We had two queen beds, large flatscreen t.v, 4 seater dining table and a full kitchen. It is fantastic, escpecially if you want to save money by not eating out every night. It backs on to the Hollywood Highland mall and is about a 50 metre walk from Hollwood Boulevard. All in all, would definatly reccommend.

Reviews.Title: “Back again!”
Reviews.Author: Aggie_Z
Reviews.Content: It was our second visit to the Hollywood Orchid Suites in two years and we were not disappointed! Got a room at the back of the complex with it's own balcony, a perfect spot to dine, relax with a book/iPad, and soak up the beautiful LA sunshine, with clear views of the hills behind. Positives: - Spotless rooms and efficient housekeeping service - Friendly service from the staff on the front desk - Plentiful continental breakfast - Location central to local attractions, public transport, restaurants, supermarkets, pharmacy, retail outlets, departure points for tours/day trips - Free wi-fi - In-room safe - Large, comfortable beds - We found the other guests to be reasonably quiet throughout our stay - Basement parking garage - Coin-operated laundry with washing powder/softener vending machine - Ice machine and vending machines on basement level Drawbacks: - Delivery trucks arriving from 6am at the back of Hollywood & Highland and Renaissance Hotel, however this cannot be helped and is NOT a fault of the hotel. Ear plugs work well to block the noise caused by the trucks. We will ALWAYS consult the Hollywood Orchid Suites on any future stays in LA, a stay here is very well worth the price paid!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but paper thin walls/floors...”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamLisa
Reviews.Content: I wanted to give this hotel 3 and a half out of 5, but since that isn't allowed I went for 3 out of 5. 3 seems a little too mean as there are so many positives about the hotel, it's just that the negatives really did make a difference to our stay. First let me start by saying my husband and I are in our late 30's. Hardly party animals, not noisy people by nature. We arrived in LA from the UK late afternoon and tried to get straight on LA time, but inevitably we were wide awake at 3am the following morning. We got up, took showers and dressed - all done quietly, no TV turned on or anything. Yet the front desk found it necessary to call us around 4.30am to say that someone had complained about the "noise"!!!! What, the noise of us walking to the bathroom and back and having showers??! I explained to the person who called that we had simply arisen early, showered & dressed and they said yes.....it was probably the sound of the shower! That night when the people upstairs above us arrived back after their day out and we could hear every single footstep, every creak of the floorboards, hear when they flushed the toilet and when the shower ran, we understood how our everyday living sounds could have been heard. Still, a bit rich to complain and worse still that the hotel then called us - as if it's our fault the walls and floors are so thin your neighbours can hear you? Clearly it's an ongoing issue - so the hotel need to deal with it, not put the onus on paying guests! I have read MANY other reviews saying the same - so if you are okay walking on eggshells out of fear of offending people, this is the hotel for you. To my mind though, a hotel should be used to dealing with international travellers from different time zones and making sure that the hotel can handle this. I can honestly say - hand on heart - that we did not make any excessive noise, or much noise at all. We felt very awkward after the complaint, and more than a little upset. The bathroom was very small and quite shabby - dirty tiles, grouting etc. The taps in the sink area were old, dirty and need replacing. The suite itself (room 210) is spacious, with a new flat screen TV and dresser but the whole place has a feel of being old and basic, but we are fine with that - after all, it was also on the whole clean, safe and roomy. The positives are the location - you cannot get closer to Hollywood Blvd, the Metro, Hollywood & Highland shopping centre and The Kodak Theatre without paying twice, three times the price. This is the trade off you make - you get a very reasonable price of $109 per night if you book through the hotel website. Breakfast was very good, the communal areas (pool, roof terrace, lobby, computer area etc) are all clean and well maintained. The staff here are simply wonderful. Every single person we interacted with was polite, attentive and helpful; they are a credit to the hotel. The housekeeping is spot on. I wanted to love this hotel. By the end of the holiday I was feeling better about it all. Would I return? Probably, just for the price and the location. The Wifi is very sketchy. We often could not pick up the hotel wifi and ended up being connected to another network which worked better! With some updating, replacements made to basic things such as faucets and some replacement carpeting/walls/soundproofing, this hotel could be a 5 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “my home away from home in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: sistinas138
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my most recent trip and spent 5 nights at the Hollywood Orchid suites. It was my 2nd visit to the Hollywood Orchid - my friend and I stayed there a couple of years ago and really liked it, the only reason we hadn't stayed there on our last trip that it was already booked! It is a small hotel & apparently rather popular so my advice is book well in advance to get your room :) If you book directly through the hotel's own website you will get the best rate, we booked a room with 2 double beds and a kitchenette (fridge & mini stove with 2 burners, a cabinet of pans & dishes & silverware but no microwave) It is nothing lavish andt the furnishings and rooms look a bit dated but the Hollywood Orchid Suites has lots going for it - #1 is LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION. It is immediately hidden behind the big Hollywood and Highland complex, I mean immediately as in walk outside the loading docks & cross the street and there it is. From the pool area you see the back wall of the Kodak Theater a few feet away. We went to see the Cirque Du Soliel Iris show in that complex as well as a Jimmy Kimmel taping across the street and it was wonderful to have such a short walk and not worry about parking and traffic.You can also catch the subway from there up to Universal Studios. Parking is free (great value!) and quite adequate for the hotel. I got a chuckle out of the fact that every parking space is named for a celebrity, I had enough trouble remembering what my nondescript silver rental car looked like but I could remember if it was "Brad Pitt" or "Angelina Jolie" very easily : ) the staff are all very friendly and helpful and glad to recommend things in the neighborhood and post helpful ideas of what to do in the elevators. A very nice continental breakfast is provided and they have a computer set up with a printer in the 2nd floor breakfast area that was very handy for printing out tickets. My only (very) minor complaint is that their wifi isn't very strong and connecting is a bit spotty in the rooms but worked better in the hall and breakfast area, at least we were able to do what we needed to do and didn't spend that much time awake hanging in the hotel as we kept very busy! It is definitely nothing fancy and if you 1st class accomodations and la-ded-ah decorating then pay 3x as much and stay at the Renaissance next door but I find the Hollywood Orchid Suites to be a great value and nothing could be more convenient! Will definitely be returning to our hidden gem - I have to admit I initially found it through TripAdvisor reviews and am grateful for the recommendations I have used!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: MooreAdvisor
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here on a visit to see Cirque du Soleil at the Kokak and also to visit the Getty. This hotel is RIGHT NEXT to the theater, literally. Great if you are visiting all the typical Hollywood spots. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Don't miss the Farmer's Market on Sunday. The Cirque du Soleil performance was great and also the trip to the Getty. The Orchid Suites were a great deal, very roomy, private parking, ... we were out and about, not hanging out at the hotel. I would stay again if in the area. Very good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but needs refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Golethepole
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really well-located being close to Hollywood (the Kodak Theatre / Universal Studios) but the place is old and needs refurbishment. The staff was friendly and helpful and the breakfast selection was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Was almost turned away from some of the negative reviews...don't be!”
Reviews.Author: AndyfromFL
Reviews.Content: We just vacationed in the Kings Canyon area ( vrbo Bunny Hill house ) and I wanted the kids to be able to see Hollywood so we needed somewhere to stay for 3 nights. This place looked great but some of the negative reviews had me extremely concerned. I'm SO glad I didn't let them cause me to change plans. Adam was great as was everyone else. The location was unbeatable and we felt very safe the entire time. You park underneath and a gate lifts up to let you drive in the garage...we were driving a Suburban and we JUST were able to squeak underneath but made it okay. The elevators were fairly quick and clean. The pool looked nice but we didn't use it. There is a top terrace where they have some chairs and tables, very nice. If you decide to visit the Griffith Observatory (which I highly suggest) the Orchid is situated right off Franklin which makes the trip to and back a breeze. If we ever go back to the area I would not hesitate staying there again. We were in room 308 which had the separate bedroom and full kitchen. Please do NOT let the negative reviews bother you, I guess you just can't please some people. To the management and staff of the Orchid, thanks for making our stay a great one and thanks again to Adam for going above and beyond the call of duty.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great service!”
Reviews.Author: crazy_rachie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the first place we stayed on a tour round the US in August and it was a great start to our trip! The hotel is tucked close behind the Hollywood Walk of Fame you come out of the hotel doors, through a walkway and you're there right in the heart of it all, the location was amazing! The room was nice, like alot of places in LA it's a bit noisy but we had our earplugs!! ;) The room was a little dated but it was very clean with a comfy, large bed, a little balcony and best of all a fully equipped bathroom, also a slightly older style of hotel room meaning it was very spacious with loads of room in the mirrored wardrobes for our suitcases etc. They had washing/drying facilities on site too which were cheap. The breakfast was very nice too, choice of bagels, cereals, fruit, muffins, tea and coffee, this type of breakfast is standard in the US and the Orchid had a really good choice every morning. The pool is also a nice addition and came in really handy during our stay. Free parking for our hire car was also fantastic and free which helped! The staff here are lovely, very pleasant and helpful. The lady on reception had our keys out as soon as we came through the door they seemed very organised! Overall, all positive, great location and great value, would stay here again! :)

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home and fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: clare g
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We are a family of 5 with grown-up children and we had a family room for $139 (2 queens and a roll away) for three nights in October. The room was not cramped even with the extra bed and there is a very spacious kitchen. You could not wish for a better location in Hollywood, right next to the Walk of Fame, Kodak theatre and Highland Centre. It took us about 35 minutes to get to the airport even with early morning traffic. The heated pool was spotless and my sons enjoyed swimming there. Use of the laundry facilities was cheap and convenient. I noticed that it was one of the only hotels with secure parking. Breakfast is satisfying, various bagels, cereals, juices. Even the price of drinks from the vending machine was very reasonable. Yes the carpet in the room is a bit worn and so is the decor. If this bothers you, then pay $300+ for a fancier hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful, including all the people at the reception which is manned 24/7 and especially the lady who supplies the breakfast. We were sad to leave and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: ozziemale1964
Reviews.Content: The location was brilliant â€“ 1 min walk to Hollywood Blvd & Highland Center http://www.hollywoodandhighland.com/ which includes the famous Grauman's Chinese Theatre, Kodak Theatre and plenty of places to eat and shop.. Of course it was also on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. Metro station 1 min away for a quick trip to downtown LA or to Universal studios. Rooms are well decked out. We had a family room which had a separate bedroom. Walls were a bit thin but not a big deal. Reasonable continental breakfast included but the location of this place is what stands out. The staff were very friendly and overall the experience was fantastic. This place is great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and a comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Mlinci
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Orchid Suites for four nights in October 2011. We both thought the Orchid Suites were an excellent choice and a very good value for money. We paid about Â£90 per night including tax. We'll definitely stay there again if we come to LA again. If you are in LA for a couple of days, and like us you don't feel like driving, there is no better location to stay. The location is just PERFECT. Orchid Suits are a one minute walk to a red Metro line (should you want to go to Universal Studios or downtown), and a one minute walk to where the city sightseeing buses start from. There is a nice Fresh & Easy supermarket less than five minutes walk away, and a shopping centre with restaurants, cinemas, clothes stores etc. literally at the hotel's doorstep. Yes, the decor of the rooms is a bit old, and the corridors are plain and undecorated, but I am perfectly aware that I can't expect a five star hotel for the price I paid. What I got for the price I paid, apart from the perfect location, was a spacious room with a large kitchen with a table for four, huge fridge, microwave, full gas cooker (which I didn't use), and a filter coffee maker (this was regularly used and much appreciated). We had a spacious and comfortable bed, a balcony overlooking the street towards Hollywood hills, a huge wardrobe and a bathroom with a separate wash basin. Breakfast was served on the first floor - choice of bagels, Philadelphia cheese, muffins, fresh fruit and cereal. You can eat the breakfast there, or take it to your room, which is not a problem as the room had a proper dining table. There was a nice swimming pool on the ground floor, and I went for a swim - I had it all to myself, and the water temperature was just right - I guess they know a thing or two about swimming pools in LA! Overall, we had a great stay, we felt like being at home, and I hope we will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: yulliel
Reviews.Content: These suites are well located. The service was average, like employees did not care you were around. On the first night I found a flee in the bed, other than that, didn't have any inconvenient at the room. From the street to the lobby there is no elevator, so be prepare if you are carrying big luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Fish096
Reviews.Content: This is an all round fabulous (aged but well maintained) home away from home. From the moment we walked in to the welcoming recpetion area (where our 5 family room bookings were happily changed around for us), happy staff, clean spacious rooms, neat and not crowded pool area and easy access to Hollywoodand Highland Shopping Centre, which leads straight to the areas tourist highlights. For what we paid, which was reasonable and a surprise for the location, this hotel exceeded all our expectations. Thank you all for having us 12 Aussies, we loved the place and will spread the good word of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “hollywood ochid suites hotel”
Reviews.Author: graron
Reviews.Content: we have just spent three nights at this hotel it was in an excellent place for getting out and about in hollywood We arrived from Australia early in the morning to be told our room was ready for us and to leave our luggage there and go and get breakfast which I might add we had not paid for .When we said this the lady was lovely and said that did not matter.It was continental breakfast has much has you wanted and they even left bags for you to take with you if you wished it was not posh but everything you need and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: sydneylizzy_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked 4 nights here following reviews on Tripadvisor. What a great find. Much better than a hotel room - great, clean, spacious unit right on the doorstep of the Hollywood attractions. Staff were all friendly and helpful. Would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ozzieoioioi
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four from Australia who stayed here in September 2011. You're never sure what you've booked and sometimes maps are hard to read on the Internet (or maybe after 4 weeks travel we were just delerious). But wow! We were so close to many things! The Chinese Theatre, Stars on Hollywood Boulevard etc, the Train (Hollywood and Highland) so we could get to Universal Studios quickly and easily (one stop!) and the bus which we took to Venice Beach and also Rodeo Drive. The staff were great. We were impressed when we arrived in a taxi from Anaheim and the staff member was expecting us and then held the garage door open for us so we could wheel our bags to the lift rather than lug them up the stairs. Bliss. Breakfasts were a simple continental affair on the second floor - cereals, pastries, fruit, coffee , tea - but adequate. Not much space to eat there but trays were availbale and so we took ours to our room which was a great option with the kids. Our room was great. So spacious for the rate we paid. I thought they got our booking wrong! There was a separate bedroom in the rear which we gave to the kids,a and we took the bed in the main combined kitchen//dining area but did not lose out on space. (we wanted to access the fridge at night so it suited us ;-) The kitchen itself was basic and I couldn't imagine cooking much else than cheese on toast but who wants to cook on holidays in Hollywood anyway? Our bed turned out to be a little less comfortable than the kids. All it needed was a thicker mattress protector, which it seemed the kids room had. My only gripe was the smokers. The room was non-smoking but smokers were able to smoke on balconies, so we still encountered the smell as we wlake dor if we wanted to open our windows for fresh air -especially as our room was near the executive rooms which have their own private balconies and mostly has smokers in them :(

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: VS0718
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 3 nights and loved it. You cannot beat it in terms of value and location. Friends who had visited California had warned us about staying in downtown LA and suggested Hollywood would be better and they were right. Literally a 2 minute walk to the kodak theathre, chinese graumans theatre and so many other sights. The hollywood highlands shopping centre also very close. Bus stops walking distance as well as the metro station. It was easy to get to to warner brothers studio where we did a tour. The staff were really helpful and nice. Breakfast and wifi were included in the price which is always appreciated. The rooms werent 5 star but if you're not fussed with that then they were absolutely fine. Clean and comfortable. If I was to return to Hollywood I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Safe, clean and quiet with friendly services!”
Reviews.Author: PakdeGaBi
Reviews.Content: checked in on Aug.31 and stayed for six nights, me, my wife and 14YO son. Nothing special when we arrived in front of the hotel, as the building looked a bit weary but clean. I found this hotel from TA (TripAdvisor) with good reviews stretched back to year 2009, and when I called, the front desk staff (Amalia) responded warmly including suggesting the room that may fit to the three of us. I brought her a small gift for her appreciating her valuable assistance through the phone. Okay, before the hotel itself, the location. Couldn't be more perfect. It's located at the heart of Hollywood itself. It's just behind the Kodak Theatre. We went to all major Hollywood attractions just by walking (Kodak Theater for Cirque du Soleil:Iris, you've just got to see this!, visited the MaxFactor Hollywood Museum, Hollywood Walk of Fame, Mann's Chinese Theatre, Hard Rock Cafe, Madame Tussauds, and others). There is also a shortcut to Hollywood Highland Mall (and Hollywood Boulevard) where you can shop and also have lots of choices for dining, further more, next to the mall is the Hollywood Highland Metro Station where we easily boarded the train for Universal Studios, just the next station away. There is also Budget Rent-a-Car across the street where then we rented a car (3-days) for trip to Disneyland, Santa Monica Beach, Griffith Park, Farmer's Market and other places. I found that returning the car very easy early in the morning and then walked back to the Hotel. Please be mindful that this is not a 5 star hotel but it fulfills your requirement of a safe, clean and quiet accomodaions with lots of extras. The room it self (Deluxe Suite) was very nice and spacious. More like an apartment. It has a living room with sofa bed, there is akitchen (complete with necessary utensils, pots and pans). A bed room with ample closet (another two at bathroom hallway). We took the advantage of having this kitchen and went to a grocery shop located in the neighborhood when we returned to the hotel late in the evening. There were two plasma TVs (one in the living room and another in the bedroom), really nice treat for myself and my son with our own favorite TV channels. Bathroom (with heater) were spotlessly clean with fine working hot/cold shower and decent water pressure. The housekeeping also great, they cleaned the room around 10-11 AM. Breakfast is included, although the breakfast corner is fairly small, you can always take them to your room where it has small dining table for 4. A paper bag is provided for this. A choices of croissants, muffins, frootloops/applejacks with fruits (bananas, apples) and coffee, tea and juices. These were more than enough to start your day. Another thing is the WiFi, I stayed in room 304 (or 305? I forgot) and it's fast. I chose 3rd floor as I was expecting no one will be stomping around above us but only expecting moderate WiFi reception, but turned out to be better. There is also a secured parking facility at no additional cost, located in the basement. Every guest will be given a key to open the automated door. Still at the parking level, there is coin laundry facility complete with ironing station and snack vending machine. There is also a pool but we didn't use it but on a warm-sunny day, this will be very inviting. Front staffs are always happy to assist you in giving directions and tips for the attractions. They even lightheartedly phoned a cab for us while we were having our breakfast before we checked out. I feel that I'd like to keep this as a secret, knowing this hotel, but when you're travelling with family surely you would've wanted this for the best value of your money can get.
