We'd love to stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Vij77
Reviews.Content: Great Location for Hollywood - a five minute walk from Hollywood Blwd, the Tube Station, Kodak & the Chinese Theater. We couldn't fault the rooms - even though they were simple & basic. Great Staff - specially this guy called Adam who went above & beyond to advise us on planning our sightseeing in LA & further travel to Vegas, the Canyon & SF. Breka is light but good enough to launch your day. Just 1 shortcoming which hold me back from giving a 5 bubble rating - Bad wifi in our room (# 101) throughout our stay - pointed this out to the staff but they couldn't fix it, had to use my laptop in the public areas. Overall very satisfactory experience.

Reviews.Title: “Everything a traveller needs”
Reviews.Author: SalnSalt
Reviews.Content: This place is a such a gem. A bit like staying at grandma's where it might be a bit daggy, but it's a comforting place to visit. Our room was huge with a separate kitchen/dining and a small balcony. In-room wifi is free and a light breakfast is laid on, also for free. They seem to have thought of everything here, such as a laundry room, change machines, ice, vending machines, etc. The location could not be better for the walk of fame, chinese theatre and Universal Studios. Would definitely return if visiting Hollywood again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean & excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: darkscreamz
Reviews.Content: Again this was a trip advisor based booking and it was really good! We stayed for four nights, the rooms are basic, but the location is great, close to Metro buses (straight forward to reach Santa Monica/Venice beach) & subway (one stop to Universal Studios) and right next to the Hollywood Blvd/Chinese theatre etc. Also for the low price the free extras of wifi Internet & breakfasts were great. But above all the customer service while checking in and answering any queries we had during our stay was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vmvivian04
Reviews.Content: Hollywood Orchid Suites was very friendly, clean and had everything that we needed in the suite. My husband is gluten free so we had to cook most of our meals. It is in a perfect location, right behind the Kodak Theatre. We were walking distance to most attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: chriskoh7770
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend and another couple during our Summer holiday three months ago for four nights. I booked a deluxe 2 bed suite and am disappointed to be given a one bed suite with another bed located at the living room (sofa bed). Seeing how busy the front desk was, I didn't want to question them and so we just decided to leave things as it is. This is the only hiccup we have with the hotel. There is a pool and it's never crowded. Good for a nice dip. They serve breakfast too, nothing fanciful, just some bananas, muffins and fruits. Good enough to start your day right. The Location is awesome! It's just a few steps away from the main action of Hollywood area. Hollywood & Highland Centre is less than 5mins walk away. The train station located in that area brings you to Universal Studio! You don't need a car if you live there. We even took bus to Santa Monica and came back in taxi with a fare of around $60 (for 4 pax). Overall it's a nice place to stay if you want to stay in Hollywood, as a first timer. For myself, if we return to LA again, i'll choose to stay in Santa Monica as the ambience is so much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: rrgitar
Reviews.Content: We were not sure what to expect of this place as it looked like an old rental complex in the online pictures. The hotel is situated In the perfect location. You can walk a few hundred feet and be in the midst of all the action. There is even a large, very Nice mall in the same complex. The suite we stayed in did cry out for some updating but the big screen tv and kitchen area were great. Nice breakfast and a very friendly staff mAke this place a winner. The parking was easy too but the spaces are small. Folks, make sure to do your homework and plan your trip well. LA is very spread out with lot's of fun stuff to do. I was amazed that so many people that were staying there knew little about the attractions except for the obvious ones. Check out the Getty museum and the aquarium in long beach beach, must see's.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean,includes breakie has good wifi in rooms”
Reviews.Author: softus
Reviews.Content: The short review says all ! This hotel is well priced for the great location. Right next to a big shopping mall and in the centre of all the action.(1minute walk) Older style place but well looked after and very clean. Basic typical breakie. The room we are in now has a full kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room and will only stay here!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoGuy
Reviews.Content: This is my third time at Hollywood Orchid Suites and it get better each time. On this most recent trip, I reserved a Deluxe Suite. Talk about spacious! I could easily live in this place on a permanent basis! The location is perfectly situated off Hollywood Boulevard. Mann's Chinese Theater is practically around the corner. Plenty of places to eat and drink as well as the shops on the street. The underground parking was great! The pool was nice. I won't stay anywhere else when I come back to Los Angeles!

Reviews.Title: “Truly Hollywood's Best-kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: LAWRENCE H B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here many times in the past. This year we are staying for ten days. (I wish it could be longer.) Each year the hotel's amenities improve significantly. This year our room, # 304, has brand-new air-conditioners (2 of them), brand-new televisions (2 of them also), a brand-new stove in the full kitchen and a brand-new refrigerator. The old appliances were perfectly fine last year but the new ones are even better. The staff could not be more friendly and helpful. The housekeeping service is superb. It is obvious that all employees take a great deal of pride in their work and are extremely proud of this hotel. And, for all one gets (if you select a third-floor suite, you get, in effect, a full apartment with more storage space than you can possibly fill, and all rooms include free, secure, underground parking - where else in Hollywood can you get that?), the price charged is nothing short of amazing. Could I make any suggestions for improvement? Only one: I wish the hotel offered Turner Classic Movies as one of their television channels. We highly recommend this hotel. Of all the hotels in which we have stayed, this one is our absolute favorite. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Value and Location, friendly staff, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: MumTraveller
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 visiting LA for the first time - we drove in from the Grand Canyon (with some trepidation, having heard of the LA traffic) and found the hotel no problem. Secure underground parking included in the price - excellent idea. We had a 2 bedrooms-suite (one of their suites and a room opened together) which also had a massive sofa bed in the main room. Huge TV, much appreciated by the teenagers. Checked in by friendly and very knowledgeable manageress - really made us feel welcome. Pool area seemed nice - well used by other families but we didn't. Roof garden seemed pleasant for a sit down with a book. I used the clean and well equipped laundry room - always useful. Breakfast was fine, we took it back to our room, everything we needed (after 3 weeks in the US by that time we were glad not to have pancakes every morning). Location is brilliant - you can catch the metro from the mall just through the tunnel, and one stop to Universal. For an excellent meal, go up to Franklin, cross over behind the Magic Castle and walk up to the top of the hill - modern Japanese Asian fusion restaurant, spectacular views, superb food (pricey, but worth it, and heck, you are getting a free breakfast . . ). Strongly recommended stay in LA/Hollywood - thanks to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Convenient, Safe, Clean, and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: pandtheb
Reviews.Content: The apartment style rooms were much larger and cleaner then I had expected. It opened up to the small, clean pool area. Had a nice size living room area, small dining room table with galley style kitchen, good size sleeping area with a comfortable king size bed. The vanity is separate from the flush, tub/shower. A couple large closets and a small safe. The location is absolutely perfect. It is just behind the Chinese Theater, accessible by walking through a short mall hallway. The parking is in a gated locked garage just below the hotel. The breakfast is not huge but we brought our muffins and pastries back down to our room. The employees are extremely helpful and friendly. I would and have suggested this hotel to anyone who wants an affordable, clean hotel near Grauman's Chinese Theater.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in an expensive town”
Reviews.Author: KFDG
Reviews.Content: I've been to Hollywood many times and have stayed in the most expensive rooms. This was an exceptional value. I would stay again. Some of the people that stay here not top quality though :/

Reviews.Title: “Great convenient location and spotlessly clean accommodation”
Reviews.Author: EMV63
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights as a family of 2 adults and 2 children - it really was a one bedroom flat with a generous sofa bed and rollaway bed in the lounge. We could easily have stayed for a week as there really was a full kitchen - full sized cooker, fridge, microwave and a cupboard full of crockery, cutlery, pans and cooking utensils. It was nice to have the choice to eat out or cook at home. The location is great - in a little quiet cul de sac at the back of the Chinese Theatre, with free underground secure parking too. The breakfast area is a little small but it's just as easy to take your food back to your flat. There is also a small pool which we didn't have time to use. Staff are on hand 24/7 and were very helpful and suggested a tour for us as we had limited time in LA. Would definately return there and recommend - much nicer than a bland hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay- great location”
Reviews.Author: DM85
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend in June. We stayed for just under a week and wanted a good base to see the sights of LA as we did not have a car. The location of the hotel was great. 2 Minutes away from the Walk of Fame and Hollywood Highland shopping centre and the metro station. We managed to see all of the sights in Hollywood, Universal Studios, Disney (if doing over i would probably miss this one out) and Beverly Hills whilst we were there. We also had a trip to San Diego. The area around the hotel felt very safe (for two 25 year old women) and despite the great location, was always quiet at night when we were wanting to sleep. The room was large and had all that we needed. Comfortable beds, lots of storage space for clothes, a kitchenette (which we didn't actually use), full length mirrors, the bathroom was clean and free wifi (get the password at reception). The safe was also free. We could have maybe done with an extra plug by the beds, to charge phones at night. The decor seemed a little outdated but was very clean, which is all that mattered to us. The staff were very friendly and helpful if you need to ask for any advice. The breakfast in the morning was a nice inclusion also. It was generally juice, coffee (my friend missed her British tea though haha), bagels, muffins, cereal and fruit. Considering this was free, i thought it was great. Many people came down and took the food up to their rooms. I would definetly recommend this hotel. It was clean, the price was very reasonable and the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “All about the location!”
Reviews.Author: snoopy79
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to LA and we really had no idea where to stay. This was ideal location because it was literally a minute to the walk of fame, Hollywood Blvd etc. It was tucked away so that it was in a quiet area but within a minute you were right in the middle of everything! Just what you want! The hotel itself was nice enough, just your standard hotel. The lady who checked us in was so helpful, really lovely. I was really impressed by her and she really gave us lots of helpful information. The staff put up a poster in the lift with all the news so that you know if there is a film premiere in the area etc. They also include cinema times and what's on at the theatre. It's little touches like that that fill you with confidence. As I said standard hotel but staff really gave that bit extra. If you do go to LA then consider hiring a car. Although my husband did most of the driving it was the easiest way to see Santa Monica - which is a gorgeous area! You can also drive to Beverley Hills, Venice Beach, Disney etc. It's really handy. If you don't drive then the hop on hop off bus is your best bet. It just takes a bit longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: gecko24
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 stayed for 2 nights in early July. The room included a fully equipped kitchen with table and chairs, bathroom and 2 double beds. The pool was very inviting in the LA heat and the included breakfast (more unusual where you have a kitchen) was quite adequate including cereal, juice, bagels and croissants. There was limited seating but trays were provided to carry it back to your own unit. The location is superb-a short walk through the back entrance to the Hollywood and Highland Centre with its shops and restaurants and attractions, the red line metro and buses like the 217 that goes direct to The Grove shopping centre/Farmers Market and LACMA. We found our room very quiet (it overlooked the street but we didn't experience the truck noise some have reported). The room was an older style and worn but very clean and staff were friendly. The doors were all security access only. We just found it difficult to find a grocery store within walking distance as we had no car with us-we ended up carrying stuff back from Wholefoods near the Farmers Market to last us the few days we were there. Having stayed in this area once we probably would not do so again but for those wishing to be in the "thick" of it we strongly recommend this hotel as very good value and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location but olde world”
Reviews.Author: irishtourerIreland
Reviews.Content: You could not get better location with good parking and safe place, its a quick walk across a street into kodak theatre! However be prepared for oldish place but it is clean and well presented and quiet. You do get a comfy bed and lcd tv but kitchen does smell a bit like a rented flat. Having said that, for the price its well worth it and highly recommend it compared to other places nearby

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: Paw_paw1979
Reviews.Content: I truly enjoyed my stay here. Very close to everything on Hollywood Blvd. The pool was great, complimentary breakfast was good too! The bed was comfortable, room was clean. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location! Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: kevinblakeman2004
Reviews.Content: After reading several LA hotel reviews I was struggling where to stay because of all the negatives. In the end we opted for this one as it had the least bedbug reviews! The location to begin with was amazing for a hollywood visit! it was a literal 20 second walk from the main part of hollywood blvd and is situated directly behind the kodak theatre. Breakfast was substatial and our room was well located with more facilities you could imagine. We had a full on house kitchen! the one negative is the deliveries to kodak theatre from trucks start at 6am and im a light sleeper but you could avoid this by not having a ground floor or front facin room. Staff where helpful and excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Almost on the Walk of Fame”
Reviews.Author: TheDutchOne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. This hotel has got quite big rooms! We got a room on the 2nd floor on the front (Orchid Street). We liked it immediately. The door is on the inside of the building, next to the breakfast area (noisy in the morning) and in the same space as the reception. The trouble began at midnight, my girlfriend couldn't sleep because of some ticking noise from the A/C. I had my earplugs in, but when she told me, I heard it too and couldn't figure out what it was. I thought expanding metal parts because of a cold-warm effect. Next to that, we could hear the phone at the reception ring every time and you could hear people talk quite easily. Because of the clicking noise and not be able to sleep I went downstairs to the reception to ask if there was another room available. They didn't have one right away (I can understand that), but if I came back the following morning, they would see which rooms would be available. The problem with the ticking A/C was because of condenswater from the A/C on the floor above us, which dripped on our A/C. Could be solved by placing a towel on the A/C outside, but that's a workaround... The nice lady at the reception offered us two rooms. One just above us, and the other one on the back of the building with a patio. We gladly took the one on the back. Maybe the room was a little bit smaller (don't know for sure), but the in-room safe was even bigger and the patio was great! As long as I can have a good night sleep, I'm happy. Problem solved. For light sleepers I would recommend not to sleep on the front side of the building. Request a room on the side (pool) or back, in the morning there are a lot of trucks unloading in the shoppingmall. Now some facts; Room is big and clean, I like the in-room safe, fully equiped kitchen. The only downside and which is mentioned earlier, are the matresses, they are quite hard on your back, but I still managed to get a good night sleep out of it. Large gated underground parkingspace. Light breakfast, with quite fast refilling of items. The building is next to the Highland mall, so within one minute you are in the mall, within two minutes you are on the Walk of Fame. The metro to Universal Studios is one block away, a ticket costs $ 1,50 one way and after a couple of minutes you are at your destination. I don't know if Universal Studios has a parking fee (in Florida they do), but if you use the underground, you can save some money on that. Would I go to this hotel in the future? Sure! As long as I don't get a room on the frontside.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but rooms were old”
Reviews.Author: hahaheehee
Reviews.Content: Great great location, Hollywood Orchid Suites is strategically located behind the Kodak Theatre. With just a 3 min walk away, you can access the Kodak Theatre mall where there are lots of shops and food outlets. Very convenient. Universal Studios is also a short drive away. This was more of an apartment than a hotel. The rooms came with an attached kitchen area, a living room, and a bedroom. There is also a laundry room at the basement of the hotel. The interior of the rooms were rather old and dusty, we had 3 people staying in a room and the sofa which doubled up as a queen sized sofa bed had a very thin and uncomfortable mattress. Other furnishings also looked rather old and dated. There is free parking and breakfast and a small swimming pool which I did not have the time to use. I guess the major plus point for this place is the location!

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers!”
Reviews.Author: Travellinglolly
Reviews.Content: For anyone who has watched Fawlty Towers you know exactly what I'm talking about. If not then YouTube it! Rooms are very average, however you can't beat the location. If you expect the worst then you will be pleasantly surprised. The lady on the front desk is Marlo and she's just the best. So friendly and helpful. My mum and I just Adored her. If your used to staying in 4 and 5 star hotels (like my mum and I) it will be a culture shock, make sure you bring along your sense of humor.... Our toilet got blocked with feoces floating in it (neither of us had done a number two) we were told by front desk to come collect the plunger and attend to it ourselves. Mum was disgusted however I thought this was just hilarious. They finally sent a plain clothed man to fix it who looked like someone they pulled off the street. On our second last day here the front desk man got drunk on the job. Some guests weren't impressed but mum and I were so used to the abnormalities of the hotel by then. This really made our stay at orchid suites, I've never laughed so hard in my life. Overall I highly reccommend this hotel and have friends who can't wait to stay here to have this experience. Do yourself a favor and only stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, great spot”
Reviews.Author: AnaikWM
Reviews.Content: If you're spending a few days in LA, that's a good hotel stay in. Walking distance to Hollywood's main restaurants, bars and clubs so that you dont need to worry about drinking&driving or else parking, but still in a quiet little street behind the Kodak Theater. The rooms are pretty big, so you'll have space for the shopping bags and clothes, they have free parking, vending machines, laundry room and a very nice staff 24/7. And it has a good price too! Just a little headsup though: the wifi wont work in macs or iPads! Maybe they'll fix it, but we had that inconvinience. Great tip we got from TripAdvisor, I'd be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Kruzein
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from reviews regarding the location and the inclusions of free wifi. The accomodation was clean however very basic, worn and tired looking and needs a makeover. We had paid for internet however couldnt get it and after going to the front counter on 3 occassions to enquire i finally got an answer that it didnt work and they had to contact an IT person to have it fixed. So if you have paid for it make sure you get what you pay for. The office staff were helpful and there are a lot of restaurants and shops around the area. The room itself was comfortable and clean. We didnt use the kitchen at all. The location of the hotel is really what would encourage us to return to this hotel as It is located the street behind Hollywood Boulevarde.

Reviews.Title: “Few problems but I liked the place”
Reviews.Author: wifeshagger
Reviews.Content: Cant get a better position next door to the chinese theatre. We had 1 king, seperate bedroom,+lounge with sofa bed. Kitchen Good garage parking. Nice big suites, with real kitchen. Usual continental breakfast, croisant, bagels, philly cheese, jams, juice, coffee...took everything up to room......just right to start the day. The problems we had were broken bedsofa, no sheets for bedsofa, dripping tap and roof renovations that started before 9am. All hotels have problems at some time but I think what makes a good hotel is how they address these problems. The staff at Orchid were great. All problems were fixed in a happy manner. Grace, the manager even took off one nights fee to compensate. Thankyou for this and will definately stay here again. We came to visit Universal studios and Holly wood Bld. We made the right choice by staying close to H.Bld, and driving the 10 minutes to Universal, than by staying in Universal City and driving over to H.Bld.

Reviews.Title: “Location location”
Reviews.Author: Kate4578
Reviews.Content: As mentioned by others this is an old apartment block converted into a hotel. Overall I would stay here again as the location is FANTASTIC. The Good: location (right behind Kodak Theatre), very close to red metro line stop, good basic breakfast included in price (cereal, bagels, croissants, fruit, juice, muffins), laundry facilities, good pool, reasonably priced vending machine (eg. 1$ water), 24hr reception, friendly staff. The Bad: the hotel is older (60s maybe) which is fine for the price, however the air conditioner was older and very loud and positioned 3 feet from the bed at the same height as the bed so I either had to chose between no air conditioning (a bit hot and stuffy with 3 people in the room) or near arctic conditions blowing on my back all night. There was a strong smell of air freshener which was overpowering when we arrived. The carpet felt dampish, and I thought it must have been cleaned prior to our arrival, however I noticed that after walking on the carpet in bare feet there was a black film all over the soles of my feet-a little off-putting. We also had to keep asking for an extra towel as we had booked the room for 3 and only 2 were replaced each day, which was not a big deal but a bit annoying. Overall, I would return based on the great location and other positive points I noted above.

Reviews.Title: “lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: ejdejd
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for our family holiday. Easy walk to all Hollywood attractions and met station 5 mins away. Room was spacious and clean with microwave, stove and coffee maker. The continental breakfast had a selection of cereals and pastries with enough variety to satisfy all family members. Swimming pool was clean and warn and there is a nice area to sit. Most impressive thing about this hotel is the friendly staff who can't do enough for you. If you want great value on a budget then highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location (is great!)”
Reviews.Author: abitofbs
Reviews.Content: Just like the old saying about real estate, the location is the big selling point for the Hollywood Orchid Suites. You're just steps away from an entrance to the Hollywood-Highland Mall that fronts Hollywood Boulevard, so all the great Hollywood attractions are within easy walking distance. The free underground garage is a convenient bonus in a city where "free parking" is largely unheard of. This establishment looks like it was once an apartment building. Imagine a one-bedroom apartment with a queen sofa bed (or a king-size bed) in the living room and you'll get the picture. With an apartment-sized full kitchen and dining area, you can make all of your own meals, although the complimentary breakfast is fine if you like cereal, muffins, bagels, donuts and fruit. If you're serious about cooking for yourself, stop by the Ralph's on N. LaBrea Ave. near Fountain for groceries. Or check out the 99-Cent Only Store at N. LaBrea and Willoughby that has a large Grocery Department including baked goods, frozen food and fresh produce. The front desk staff was very friendly and the common areas are quite clean. There's an outdoor pool and a roof garden for relaxation after a long day of touring. Because the Kodak Theatre building is between you and Hollywood Boulevard, it's pretty quiet too. For what you'd pay for a simple hotel room nearby, here you get a fully-equipped oasis for your Hollywood adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Best bargain ever and will be back”
Reviews.Author: josmatt
Reviews.Content: Not 5 star but great hotel,friendly staff ,good location and free breakfast. room was large with full kitchen and everything was very clean and we would certainly stay here again This Hotel was recommended to us and it lived up to all our expectations

Reviews.Title: “Good Value would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Nutytart
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in May as part of a USA road trip...we booked it because of the reviews on Trip Advisor as we didnt want to pay $25 a night for parking. The location is excellent literally 2 mins from Hollywood Boulevard and the walk of fame with easy access to the Metro. its only 1 stop from Universal studios too. The staff were very friendly the breakfast was good and there was free internet usage (which you can pay for in other hotels). I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a good value, central hotel to use as a base to explore LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel best location”
Reviews.Author: nicolamcdo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for 5 days in May over memorial weekend. I found the location perfect for seeing all the sights right next to the metro station and bus stops and walk of fame and close to all the nightlife so could walk home after the clubs. The rooms were spacious and comfortable lots of wardrobe space and a kitchen. The breakfast was included in the price and was very good and all the staff were friendly and helpful with directions and sorting out tickets for us. We only used the pool one afternoon and had it all to our self. Would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Hollywood on a great location and a nice room for a decent price when other hotels in the area are charging 3 times the price. Also the free internet was great and always worked and was fast didnt have a car bu the free parking is good for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent with Terrific Value!”
Reviews.Author: afg2001
Reviews.Content: We stayed in West Hollywood for 5 days and nights and heard this place is the best kept secret in town. The rooms were a dated with 80s furniture but they were sparkling clean. I even noticed that the carpet was very clean too so they must have it steamed every so often. The bedding was new except the comforter but we took that right off. The room has a little kitchenette and flat screen tv. I was impressed at how clean the bathroom was too. Not one speck of mold and the toilet seat had a sanitized cover on it when we first got there. The free continental breakfast was good, it did the job and saved us on having to buy breakfast. I recommend the croissant with cream cheese and fruit jelly, with coffee or tea and a piece of fresh fruit. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is amazing. We were within a short walking distance to Highland and Hollywood where the famous Chinese Theater is located. The included free secure parking was excellent and the free high speed internet really came in handy. We were only one subway stop away from Universal Studios so we took advantage of that and had a terrific time. We went to Whiskey A Go-Go too where we saw Wild Child, an excellent Doors tribute band, and we had such a great time! Robby Krieger the original Doors guitarist and song writer even showed up and played!!! We got there early so we ended up eating there and the cheese burger & fries were really good. We also hit Barney's Beanery off Route 66 and had dinner there... it was so yummy! We also did a $20 Hollywood 2 hour star and it was fun. Brace yourself when the go over Mulholland Drive after the scenic stop lol Venice Beach was a great time but we did get a lot of venders asking us if we wanted to buy their music or needed a 4:20 prescription. We declined both a few times but they didn't hassle you after that. Even in San Diego you get asked a lot to go on their buggy rides. They are more persistent and you have to say no at least twice. We also went to the Griffith Observatory where the view alone is worth the drive up there! The huge telescopes were not open to the public during the afternoon so we didn't get a chance to view anything but the rest of the building was open and the exhibits were very interesting. We toured the Hollywood Bowl after that and learned a lot of history about the place. Both the Griffith and Bowl were free entry! We went to Chinatown in downtown L.A. for dinner and it was okay. We also went to San Diego and had lunch in Little Italy at Zucherros and the Tortellini with Fungi (mushrooms) , peas and pancetta was incredible. My husband ordered the chicken and veggies but didn't like it as much and ended up eating over a third of my pasta! I still was full and enjoyed the rest of our day trip to San Diego. We did the full Doors tour and even stopped at his old hotel room where we got to look inside and take pictures because the guest was leaving and gave us permission to look around. All in all we had an amazing time in California. It's a real dream and I would definitely go back and if we are returning to West Hollywood we would surely stay at the Orchid again.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: jenspen1975
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an average hotel. There were some bad reviews on here but we only had one issue, a night clerk after checking in was a little harsh to tired travelers. Other than that, the staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is enough to start a busy day. The linen, rooms and kitchen area were all clean. We stayed in the 2 room suite. FYI, If your expecting to be completely secluded from the living area, its not possible. I wish someone would have posted that here. The bedroom is seperate from the from area, true. But if the people staying in the front room need to use the restroom, they have to come into the bedroom. Price is a little high for an "average" hotel, yes. But you cannot beat its location. Behind well in front of the hotel depending on how your looking at it, a mall area with shopping and food, walk of fame, chinese theatre, in and out and I hop are the next street over, and its minutes from the hollywood sign, studios and the highway. Parking is free so if your looking to stay in the area you dont have to hassel with parking. The pool is smaller than it looks but Im sure it would do the job on a hot day. I would stay here again and recommend it to a friend if they were heading that direction

Reviews.Title: “Great location, basic but acceptable rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Oztandl
Reviews.Content: Located just behind the kodak theatre this hotel is in a central location. Breakfast was included and fairly basic. Overall experience fairly good and would concider this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Lillpion
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2008 and were very pleased with the hotel. The rooms are moderate, but the location - WOW! Close to everything! A few steps and you reach the Walk of fame. Definitely worth its price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Mysteryjam
Reviews.Content: We received a warm welcome at this hotel. The free parking is fantastic. Free internet - sit up and take note, 4 and 5 star hotels elsewhere! A huge gold star for this hotel! As mentioned in previous reviews, the location of this hotel is great for the Hollywood sights. We had a car and really relied on it to get to the other great sights in the area - don't miss the Getty Centre or the Griffith Obsesrvatory, a closer view of the Hollywood sign or the people-watching on Venice beach! We also travelled up the Pacific Coast Highway as far as Oxnard (a fairly short drive to Malibu etc) - I'm not sure how you'd get around easily to these places from this hotel without a car, but then we never tried the public transport! It certainly is a basic no-frills hotel, but comfortable, and met all of our needs. We had an executive suite with a full kitchen. There was a shop a short walk away for groceries. We were on the ground floor, and had a small private patio area outside. The staff were great, we enjoyed the pool, and the free breakfast was perfect - muffins, bagels, croissants, fruit, cereal and coffee/juice. There is a washer and dryer in the private underground parking area, where a very kind fellow guest gave me his laundry detergent as he was going home (thanks again!) The only one minor snag to this hotel is not really the hotel's fault - the walls are thin, so if you are unlucky enough to have loud and rowdy neighbours then your sleep may be disturbed. Everybody needs good neighbours! Especially ones that know how to speak instead of shout...! I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel as a value for money place to stay. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Erwie-Dude
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel in Tripadvisor and found an amazing gem. The location in itself is well worth you staying here. It is so close to the action of Hollywood. For my wife and I it was a fantastic base to go exploring Hollywood on foot. So many restaurants and shops are nearby you'll find anything you need within a short walk. The room we had was a Deluxe Suite. The size was fantastic, so much room and the cupboard space was amazing. We had a full size fridge, oven, microwave, coffee maker (with complimentary coffee/tea), cooking utensils, plates etc. not that we wanted to cook but if you did you would be good to go. The shower was great, particularly the height of the shower head. I'm 6'4" and could easily fit underneath. We had a large LCD in the living room and a smaller LCD in the bedroom, how good is that. I've stayed in 4/5 star hotels that didn't provide that. And the TV reception was spot on. The air conditioner did the job easily. Overall we were very happy with our room. As for the staff/service, simply impeccable! Everyone we dealt with was polite, smiling, professional and extremely helpful. Whenever we had a question they were only to happy to assist. In one instance we wanted the best bus to catch to go to a museum. They rang the museum to find out because they weren't 100% sure. This might sound simplistic but we've stayed in many hotels where we didn't receive this level of service. Breakfast is included, every morning they put out a spread of tea/coffee, muffins, fruit, juices, cereal. It gave us a nice start to the day. Undercover parking space is also included, although we didn't have a car. They also have a laundromat which we did utilize. The machines did a great job. We would easily and highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in Hollywood.The value for money is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: LondonKaytee
Reviews.Content: We selected for location and price at the start of our holiday and found it even better value than expected. Suite large, included kitchenette so you could have avoided eating out if needed. BAthroom a little dated but clean adn functional. Good continental breakfast inlcuded in price and also has secure underground parking. Adjacent to shopping centre so some noise from vehicle movements but very convenient for wide choice of restaurants, shops etc. On subway line to downtown. Would have stayed at end of holiday too but was fully booked two weeks ahead due to awards ceremony.

Reviews.Title: “Location is unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: FeistyKel
Reviews.Content: Great spot so central and walking distance from Graumans, Madame Tussauds, Hollywood walk of fame and Hollywood & Highland mall. The rooms are aged but clean and serviced daily. The service is friendly and helpful. Continental breakfast is complimentary and ample. The noise of cleaning trolleys rolling by windows and footsteps above impeded sleep some, but it was still worth it. The wifi was slow and erratic, but free. Having a full kitchen saved dollars on eating out, too. Free parking was fab. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood location great- rooms drab, uninspiring, jaded,”
Reviews.Author: RuaDublinIreland
Reviews.Content: The location is very convenient to Hollywood Blvd. The price was reasonable. Our room was very dated and although the service and staff were lovely, on balance, I think I would book somewhere else next time. When fittings, linen, cutlery, carpets are that old, it is difficult to be completely confident using them.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: writewaysusan
Reviews.Content: While this isn't the Ritz Carlton, it is a fabulous find. Bed room huge along with full kitchen and bath. Beautiful rooftop garden where we had our cocktails. Location, Location, Location. You just walk out the door and go 1/4 block into the entrance to the Kodak Theater Mall, which has some great restaurants or walk out the mall and you are on Hollywood Blvd. Great place to people watch as they gaze at the Grahman Chinese Theater or the Hollywood walk of fame.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & convenient”
Reviews.Author: NandPOxford
Reviews.Content: This is really very convenient for all the attractions of Hollywood. It is just a few yards to Hollywood Boulevard, yet is in a fairly quiet side street. The suite was quite a surprise as whilst not new was very clean & tidy & so big that you could easily live in it without adding any more facilities! The only minor gripe is that there is a commercial loading bay not far away that got a little noisy from about 6am but unless you are a particularly light sleeper is not a problem. We had a huge television in the lounge & another very reasonable one in the bedroom. The kitchen is fully fitted so you could easily cook a full meal if you were so inclined whilst on holiday. There is a reasonable continantal breakfast included in the room rate. Free wifi is available and also a pc if you dont have a laptop with you. There is a nice outdoor swimming pool and a rooftop garden with loungers etc. The staff were all cheerful & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Room 311”
Reviews.Author: whitenm
Reviews.Content: I was visiting LA to see my newly married friend and didn't want to imposed by staying at her place so I went looking for a reasonably priced hotel in LA not to far away from Silver Lake. After exhaustive searching by myself and my friend we decided the Hollywood Orchid Suites would be just the ticket! Happily I booked, with no issue. I arrived in LA on 3/12/11 and called the hotel to find out if it would be okay to check-in must later than the usual check in time. No problem, your room will be waiting for you. Excellent! Fast forward to later that night. After I am buzzed into the hotel (yes, buzzed in like an apartment building) I am met by the "receptionist" who appears to be the only one around trying to do everything (including informing a guest, who while trying to do laundry had the machine turn off on her, to push the electric cord in all the way and the machine will start again). I was checked in and handed a key with a large chunk of plastic attached which can only be likened to old fashioned computer punch cards. The key was for the garage gate, the hunk of plastic, the room key to 311. I make my way into the garage, park my car and proceed to the wide OPEN door to the hotel to a hallway that is pitch black. Now, the only way you can get into the garage is if you are a guest with a key for the gate. However, as a woman by herself, I found this to not be best circumstance to be in. Upon arriving on the third floor, I see a very long open hallway. Wondering where room 311 is I start down the hallway and low and behold, 311 is way down at the end. The issue with this? This section is almost separated from the rest of the rooms in the floor sharing space with a staircase, slop closet and another unidentifiable padlocked room. After several tries and a heavy shoulder I get the room door open. I enter a musty, dank room with the bed barely 5 ft from the door, sagging chairs, water stained ceiling, peeling paint, a rusty aged heater, filthy curtains, AC not on (when turned on not pumping anything out), a circuit breaker box, a cigarette burn on the bathroom counter, a bathroom fan that appears to not have been cleaned for years and the shower pipe separating from the wall. But the kitchen was spotless. Oh, and the reason the door was so hard to open as my friend discovered? The frame of the door looked like the door had been kicked in and then rehung. I immediately went downstairs to check out. I received a full refund as the hotel was fully booked but was also told that room 311 has often been requested and that the hotel has never received complaints about it. Maybe I am picky (as the "receptionist" tried to insinuate) but I don't think it is too much to think that my room be clean and in good condition. Be warned, the pictures online looked very different than what I received and perhaps it was because it was the last room due to my late check-in, but there should never be that much of a discrepancy in standards between rooms in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: WeHateFlying
Reviews.Content: 2 night stay (in different rooms- 209, 213, due to late booking), early May. Not the best looking hotel from the outside but, found both rooms very clean and very spacious. OK, not contemporary decoration but you are not stopping in Beverley Hill's, with Beverley Hill prices. Quiet, but located on same block as Chinese Theatre, directly behind the new shopping centre. Literally 20 seconds and you're in the centre. Free secure underground parking and complimentary breakfast, you may not find a better deal anywhere near the WOF. One final point; I could not find any evidence of BED BUGS, which I know is a concern when choosing a hotel. Would we recommend? Yes, without a doubt. (if on a road trip we would also recommend Burton (Cambria), Baldwin (SF), Super 8 Boardwalk (SC), Howard Johnson (SFO), Seashore (SM))

Reviews.Title: “A Gem Amongst Tinsel”
Reviews.Author: FyingKiwi
Reviews.Content: It looks very plain and inexpensive from the outside, but definitely one you do not judge by its cover. Whilst perhaps a little simpler than ultra modern hotels, the rooms are very spacious with all of the amenities you would expect from a higher rated hotel. Its location is right in the centre of all the attractions, but a quiet retreat from it all at the same time. Absolutely superb. All the staff were both friendly and extremely helpful. Secure free parking and a complimentary breakfast made this a real gem amongst the tinsel hype of Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Don't tell anyone”
Reviews.Author: dsikula
Reviews.Content: This place is the best-kept secret in Hollywood. Immaculately clean, great, friendly staff, unparalleled location. I've stayed here twice and will happily do so again. Absolutely unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “great location, old rooms”
Reviews.Author: mattabessett
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orchid suites in April with spouse and 2 children. Good points: The hotel is located on a side street behind the Highland mall and kodak theatre. Within 100 feet of the front door is a passage into the mall, and 2 minutes later you are right on the walk of fame. Very close to the hollywood Blvd sights, location is really good. We had an executive suite, which had two separate sleeping areas and a full kitchen; certainly a lot of space. The free breakfast was better than expected, with good quality croissants, muffins, and fresh fruit, plus the standard bread and cereal. parking is free and secure behind a locked fence. They have an ok-looking pool but we didn't use it. Bad points: The rooms and furniture are really old and worn out. The whole place has a kind of shabby appearance, although they keep it reasonably clean. Only one person at the front desk, service can be slow and sometimes a bit brusque.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value!”
Reviews.Author: djaaay
Reviews.Content: The perfect spot for us. I found the area pretty pricey and took a bet on the Orchid Suites and it so paid off. We had a huge room with a kitchen dining area and 4 closets. Not luxury but just fine. The entire staff was very pleasant and helpful. Parking and light breakfast included. The location was da bomb! I am very glad we went the value route since it was as nice as this.

Reviews.Title: “Not for everyone ... but great for us!”
Reviews.Author: Meredith5001
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for shiny and new, Hollywood Orchid Suites is not for you -- but I would certainly return! Here's why: for the same price that you'd pay for a room in a Hampton Inn, you can get an entire apartment, with two king-sized beds (which pleased my teenager to no end.) The apartments are somewhat musty -- but clean, and bed-bug-free. The location can't be beat, and underground parking is free. The owner is a really nice man and everyone on staff is helpful and accommodating. It was kind of cold when we visited, but the pool was open -- and it looked great. There's also a rooftop terrace, which is a lovely place to relax with a book and a glass of wine. When they said they provide a continental b'fast, I assumed it would be coffee and donuts -- but it's much better: bagels, muffins, fresh fruit, cereal. Yes, the mattresses are somewhat hard, and the carpet is dingy -- but the water pressure in the shower is great, our apt. had two large televisions and the kitchen was fully equipped. We were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: teamfyr
Reviews.Content: Staff at the Hollywood Orchid suites are helpful and friendly. Always a cheery face. Good selection offered for breakfast. Can walk to Hollywood blvd, wax museums, Hardrock cafe. Pool is decent.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin, great location as well”
Reviews.Author: PilotBoy72
Reviews.Content: Stayed here based on the reviews on Tripadvisor. Pretty much exactly as expected. Rooms are a little rundown with a bit of a musty smell but very clean which is most important for us and perfectly functional as everything worked. Fantastic value overall, especially given free parking, wi-fi and breakfast. Breakfast was basic but sufficient with a range of cereals, bagels, muffins and fruit. We ate here some mornings and went to local diners on others. Location is the most amazing part. Walk through the shopping centre and you are right on the walk of the Stars within 200yds. Plenty of restaurants as well around although all a bit touristy and we travelled to West Hollywood to eat most nights. All in all a great stay and fantastic value. You could say the rooms need updating but then I'm sure the price would have to be updated as well so perfectly happy the way it was. Not pretentious or pretending to be something it is not and that is fine with us!

Reviews.Title: “great location, great staff, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: pizza1492
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and our room was ready. The rooms are older but very clean. The kitchen meets basic needs. The morning continental breakfast was adequate. The bed was comfortable. Their location is right in the middle of heart of Hollywood. The staff were wonderful- they can connect you with tours and transportation at good prices, provided good ideas for exploring LA. Overall, Hollywood Orchid Suites is an exceptionally good value.

Reviews.Title: “great location with no frills”
Reviews.Author: georgeybaby
Reviews.Content: my husband and i just stayed here. i laughed when i saw the room as it is quite retro in appearance and the bathroom is tiny - i think the cupboard is bigger! it was perfectly acceptable for our 2 nite visit to hollywood, when we were out most of the day and only needed a bed. great for a short stay and the best location! i wouldn't stay for a long time or if i planned on staying in my room alot (but hello - who does that?!). it has free internet, free parking, free b'fast (which we never had cos we were either running late to something or leaving too early (b'fast doesn't start til 8am). we met nice people also staying here. if location and no frills but great value is for you, definetely stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “a good location!!”
Reviews.Author: daisymiami
Reviews.Content: +++: very good location (close to Hollywood Bulevard),10 minutes from Universal, very quiet , a secure parking (in the basement), friendly staff, comfortable queen beds, full equiped kitchen ( junior suite) , free wifi internet (with acceptable speed) ----: the cleanliness is not a plus, very old ( at least 80's) furniture and kitchen appliances. An hotel to sleep and take a rest after a busy day, very close to Hollywood Bulevard.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: iAussie
Reviews.Content: This place is great and the staff are fantastic!! As we had a car the Orchard Suites is one of very few places in the area that have free secure parking. The location is right behind the Kodak Theatre, so only minutes walk to Hollywood boulevard. When we checked into our room there was a problem with the plumbing, straight away we were upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite. The staff were so welcoming and friendly, always providing fantastic service! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't find a better location if you tried”
Reviews.Author: mattysears
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights on my first trip to the USA. If you want to see Hollywood this place is perfect. It's right at the kodak theatre and walk of fame. Easy access to train line and freeways Free wi-fi breakfast and parking were a great inclusion The hotel is a bit old, but can't really complain about that, it was clean and spacious, Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location! Great staff and kitchen facilities greatly appreciated.”
Reviews.Author: trell0v04
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly a hidden gem. Doesn't look like much from the outside but the rooms are large and comfortable. Full kitchen a great bonus. Breakfast was included and fantastic - muffins/bagels/croissants/cereal/toast/fruit. Staff extremely friendly and helpful. Free wifi and free computer in the breakfast area. Best thing is the location. Literally walk out the door and down an alley and you are at the Kodak theatre and hollywood walk of fame/madame tussauds/graumanns chinese theatre. Close to shops and grocery store.

Reviews.Title: “Safe choice with drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: SneakerGeeker
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel near Hollywood and its sights, this is the place. Very good location and handy for those using public transportation. Metrorail is appr. one block away (station Hollywood/Highland) and there are also several bus lines taking you to the city center. The hotel is situated just behind Renaissance Hotel on a quiet dead end -type street. Our room was rather large and clean. The bed was really wide (king size/180 cm) but the pillows were not that comfortable. Bedroom was all right too. Breakfast was served at 08:00-10:00 every morning. It contained coffee/tea+juices, bagels, muffins, croissants, fruits and cereals. The selection was ok, but it would have been nice to see a slice of ham or eggs too. The drawbacks came from the ventilation system and sound insulation. A couple of times there was rather strong smell of tobacco smoke in the room. It felt as if a chain smoker was sharing the room with us. Once we fell asleep, our Hollywood dreams were rudely interrupted by some fellow guests who stayed upstairs or in an apartment next to ours. They were not actually shouting or jumping in the room, but mere walking sounded very loud and kept us awake. So the insulation surely could use some improvements. All in all, this is an ok place. No frills, good service. If you are lucky enough to get nicely-behaving neighbours, you should have a good time here.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: travelingsabrosa
Reviews.Content: Great location, you get more for your money, clean, friendly staff, the kitchenettes are equipied, I would definitly stay again. I just would improve the pillow quality, but everything else is great.

Reviews.Title: “Value, convenience, safe, clean, extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelExploreSeek
Reviews.Content: I was travelling Hollywood and surrounds for the first time and this place was perfect for my needs and really exceeded my expectations. Number one I felt very safe as a single female. The staff were helpful at all hours, during my whole stay of 5 days. The rooms were more than generous space wise and very well cleaned. Free breakfast with lots to choose from. The service all round and value for money was absolutely stand out. Free convenient extras like internet and parking made it the best deal I have had in a long time. If your out and about most of the day and just need a safe home away from home with all the conveniences in a central location, without paying a fortune for glamour, this is your lucky find.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location”
Reviews.Author: LA066
Reviews.Content: This is an unpretentious hotel in the heart of Hollywood. It's fairly basic, clean, comfortable accommodation, but that's all you need. You will be out doing stuffduring the day, so you don't need to spend more money just to sleep somewhere better. Look at the things in its favour: located at the Hollywood/Highland intersection, Metro station next door, Highland Shopping Mall next door, Hertz office at the Renaissance Hotel opposite, Budget office across the road, right behind the Kodak Theatre, right behind the Walk of Fame, bus line on Hollywood Boulevard, Sunset Boulevard is one block down, grocery store is 1/2 mile away. There are literally 100s of restaurants within walking distance. You can cook in your room so if you are sick of eating out, there is an option here. Breakfast is included in the price - just bagels, crossaints, cereal and cofffee, but that's enough. There is also free wifi in the rooms and a computer if you don't have a laptop. Free printing is also provided. There is a coin laundry and vending machines downstairs. Parking is free. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. You can buy Universal Studio tickets from the hotel and they will save you money.

Reviews.Title: “great locale, good breakfast, clean, sagging beds, noisy maids.”
Reviews.Author: 58dc
Reviews.Content: The only bad things I have to say about this place is that the beds sag in the middle and the maids made a lot of noise just outside our door early in the morning. On the plus side the room was spacious and clean. Excellent shower pressure and the water was nice and hot. Terrific location on a quiet street. Nice price. Very good continental breakfast with juice, bagels, croissants, cereal, muffins. And there's a computer in the breakfast area that you can use to check email and the web.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rainy0
Reviews.Content: The people are so helpful and friendly. The location is the best. The breakfast was really really good. Would stay here again and would recomend to anyone wanting to stay in the hollywood area.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean accomadation”
Reviews.Author: Scotty_Aus
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December on our way around the world. Suite was good had a full kitchen and was clean when we arrived. It is a little old feeling, reminded me of the 80's but everything was in good working order. As for location it was perfect just behind the kodak theater and next to a metro station making it easy to get to from the airport and also for travelling through out LA . Was good for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money”
Reviews.Author: mumma2154
Reviews.Content: This location cannot be beaten. As others have said, we arrived early (11am) and our room was waiting for us. As well -we requested a late check out on our arrival, and were able to stay until our airport transport picked us up at 4.30pm! The hotel is older, but has every facility, and the staff cannot be faulted. Breakfast room is small, but they are happy for you to take a tray back to your room. Walk straight out of your hotel to the Highland Shopping Mall, the Star Walk, Kodak Theatre - right in the thick of Hollywood. Catch the Metro one station to Universal or downtown - it was all so easy and we had a great stay. Perfect for families and budget conscious travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, besides the smoke...”
Reviews.Author: TripTrip83
Reviews.Content: So, I was overwhelmed with the number of hotels in Los Angeles, so we went with this one since it was a sister hotel to a place we had stayed in Eugene, OR. When we checked in, at around 8pm, the front door was locked. We needed to get buzzed in. If I hadn't been to this area of LA before, that probably would have scared me a bit...not really sure why they find the need to lock themselves in at 8pm. Especially since, when we went to our room, our sliding door was ajar and unlocked... Anyway, the hotel is a renovated apartment building. Our room was large, but could have used some updating or at least some lights. It was a bit dreary and dark in there. Free wifi & free parking where great though, as is the location! I probably would have given in a 4 had it not been the smoking. They let people smoke on the porch and alllll the smoke seep into our room under the door. I woke up in the morning thinking the room was on fire. We went to breakfast and came back to find our room reeked of smoke. I'm still scared they're are going to slap us with a fine for smoking in our nonsmoking room. The other weird thing was our check out. The checkout time was noon. We decided, around 10, to pack up our car then wander around a bit before we checked out. The hotel had assumed we ran away with the keys. Weird since, 1. Why are they cleaning our room on the day we are checking out before check-out time? 2. They know our car, what didn't they just look for it? 3. Do people really do that?!?!?

Reviews.Title: “Right in the midst of all that Hollywood offers”
Reviews.Author: Lavoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchid Suites from the 25th Dec to 29th Dec 2010. Our suite was huge with a separate full kitchen and dining area. There is also a safe in the room for your valuables. The hotel is older however spotlessly clean and is right out side a shopping mall which spills out to Graumans Chinese Theatre on Hollywood Blvd. There is no need for a car as the underground metro (Universal Studios is one stop away for USD1.50) and buses all leave from Hollywood Blvd, although there is free parking should you drive there. The hotel offers free wi-fi although we found it to be slow. Should you not have your own with you, they also offer free access to a computer and printer which is great value. Breakfast is cereal, fruit and bagels and is adequate for the price of the room - should you want something more substantial there are plenty of places that offer breakfast in and around the shopping mall. There is a pool however we did not use it, being winter. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay there and would gladly stay again should we be visiting LA again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Fendaz
Reviews.Content: The Hollywood Orchid suites were great! We were able to check in at about 9am after a long flight from Australia so we were very happy about that. We had a room with a kitchen and it was a good size. The room was quite large as well. The internet was great and worked the whole time we were there - it was extremely fast as well. The breakfast was fine - bagels, bread, cereals, muffins, juice and fruit - a good way to start the day. The location is also excellent! It is so close to the Hollywood strip and also to Universal Studios. So easy to get anywhere from this hotel. The service and security was good as well - you needed a key to get in the door or the car park. We were recommended this place by a friend and were glad we stayed here - overall a great place and we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: caddybear
Reviews.Content: Awesome location, great staff, big rooms I loved my stay here - If I ever get back to Hollywood - I def chose this place :)

Reviews.Title: “JUST AS THEIR WEBSITE DESCRIBES - NICE PLACE”
Reviews.Author: LATARSHAK
Reviews.Content: Good location just like their website advertises. They are in the middle of everything. A few steps from the Hollywood/Highland Mall. The mall has a little bit of everything. The strip is ok. It takes about one day to view everything - Walk of Fame, Kodak Theatre, Ripley's Believe It or Not Musuem, Wax Musuem, Guinness Musuem, a couple of shops. Also right behind the hotel is a trail where you can take your own walk to the stars house. Don't pay for it. Also you are right at the metro station. I also felt safe in the area and at hotel. The hotel service was good. Marlo was very helpful even extended my stay without any hassle. The housekeeping was consistent and efficient. The continental breakfast was nice - bagels, cereal, muffins, croissants, juice, milk, and coffee. The cable is not nothing to die for. I didn't use the parking area, but nice and secure. It's right under the hotel. They did provide a courtesy computer & printer if you did not bring a lap top I had a non smoking back corner room 110 with a big patio & furniture. The room was nice. It was like being away from home. Nothing was up to date except for flat screen tv. A full kitchen with accessories - stove, microwave, coffee pot, etc, utensil and cookware. The bed wasn't as comfortable, but ok. The bathroom had a heater in it. It had good water pressure. The room had huge closet space. I was comfortable with my stay at the hotel. It wasn't the Ritz, but good for the price and love the location. There are other hotels on the same block, but I don't know if you will get same quality service.

Reviews.Title: “Budget accommodation in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Rocht
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. Orginally was suppose to be onger but we had to shorten our stay. The hotel were fantastic about this. The service is great and very friendly and helpful. Internet access is free and a guest computer with a printer is available. Unfortunately our room was smelly like damp wetness and our floor was damp too. It has been raining and this seemed to carry into the room. My husband found it hard to sleep for our stay as he found the bed lumpy but I did not have the same issue. Overall this hotel is great for travellers wanting convienence and a great location at a cheap rate but not a high standard of room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Spot”
Reviews.Author: mitchell0417
Reviews.Content: After much deliberation and conversation with people via Trip Advisor we decided to stay at the Hollywood Orchid Suites on the first 2 nights of our family holiday in US and it was one of the best decisions of our trip. The location meant that although tired and jetlagged after our long trip to LA we were in the thick of it from the get go. The kids loved being able to stand in the stars footprints at the Chinese Theatre (less than a 2 minute walk from our room). Additionally for us having a suite with two rooms (for considerably less than many others in the area charge for a twin) was fantastic. Despite being in the thick of it there was no noise that we noticed as its at the back of the Kodak Theatre and mall and down a side street so the noise was really non existant. The staff were great (saved us a fortune with their advice on tickets for Universal) and the trip to the Studios was less than a 10 min drive. The free parking was also a real bonus in that part of town. I would recommend this place (and have) to all - its not the Beverly Wiltshire but nor is it pretending to be and if you don't like the breakfast (cereal and muffins) then at the price of this place you can easily walk out to the mall and get something else.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Janice81
Reviews.Content: The biggest plus about this hotel is its location - right in the heart of Hollywood, next door to a huge shopping mall (Hollywood & Highland) where there are tons of shops and also a train station underneath. It is also literally a 2 minute walk to Hollywood Blvd where there are more shops, eateries and tourist attractions like Madamme Tussauds etc. Also, the hotel has free internet (although only one computer available) for guests which was extremely handy - you can even use the printer available to print out maps, tickets etc. Staff was pretty friendly too. We stayed in a Junior Suite and it was spacious, clean and comfortable. The only complaint I had during our stay was that the walls are extremely paper thin. If you decide to stay there, I hope you have quiet neighbours. Because some of the rooms have kitchens within, we could hear cabinets opening and closing, cutlery, pots and pans banging around... on our first night, we also heard the TV from next door turned on... unfortunately he/she did not turn it off until 3am. If you have a room facing Orchid Avenue, which is also the street located at the back of the shopping centre, you will be woken up at 5-6am each day (I think only weekdays) by trucks unloading stuff for the shops in the shopping mall I presume. Lucky, I had ear plugs. If you don't mind noise or if you are a heavy sleeper then you won't have a problem. Otherwise, try and get a room which does not look out onto the street. All in all, we had a comfortable stay and enjoyed our time in Hollywood!

Reviews.Title: “A great place for families”
Reviews.Author: Wes3941
Reviews.Content: We'd read plenty of good reviews for the Orchid Suites so decided to book online for three nights in early December. The rates were very good considering the location and our room was upgraded to a King Family Suite which was a bonus. Our first impressions were that the facility was very clean and well kept and the staff were very focussed on helping the guests in any way possible. Our room (105) had plenty of space and our two sons were impressed with the large flat screen TV. Beds were comfortable and the bathroom was clean, but probably not to the standards that some might expect. For us it was fine. Breakfast is pretty basic and there are only a few tables, so be prepared to wait 5-10 minutes, but you will probably strike up a conversation with the other guests like we did . The lady managing the breakfast area is excellent and always happy to oblige with any requests. The location cannot be beaten for the price, and free parking and excellent WiFi thrown in. It can be a little noisy in the evening with delivery vehicles servicing the Hollywood and Highland retail centre located right next door. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: jamsandwich101
Reviews.Content: The Hollywood Orchid Suites won't win you over with its flashy decor, mints on your pillows or bell staff who bend over backwards for you. It doesn't have those things and frankly, it doesn't need them. What the Orchid Suites does have is this: Helpful and friendly desk staff, clean but dated rooms and a location that's nigh impossible to beat for a visitor to Hollywood. Just steps from the Orchid Suites' front door is a passage into the Hollywood Highland center, right in the heart of Hollywood Boulevard: think Kodak Theater, Mann's Chinese Theater and more people trying to take you on celebrity tours than you can shake a stick at. It also puts you pretty much directly on top of a metro station that can take you to Universal Studios and beyond. Meanwhile, parking is free and the underground lot seems pretty secure, so if you've got a car you shouldn't have to worry about someone taking it for a joyride. The rooms themselves are fairly unexceptional, but there's little to complain about. We found our room to be clean and a little old... no surprises there. The floor was a little lumpy in spots and the suite could have probably used a renovation. But it was perfectly functional and given the choice of new carpet and a soft underlay underfoot or the affordable rates at the Orchid Suites, I'd go with the cheaper rate every time. Let me be clear, though: This is not a place that gets by on its location alone. With an older building like this, preserving the sense that it's clean is not an easy thing to do. Yet that was my first (quite pleasant) realization after checking in ("this place *is* clean!") If you're looking for luxury, go somewhere else. But if you're looking for somewhere to rest your weary bones for a reasonable price, this is the place. Clean, comfortable accommodation and a great location at a great price. My preference is generally to roll the dice on Priceline or Hotwire, but sometimes you need a little more concrete plans.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable hotel and good value”
Reviews.Author: willo76
Reviews.Content: We had an upgraded room that was the size of an apartment with a kitchen bedroom and lounge area. Great Hollywood location and quite central for all LA sights. Friendly staff, free breakfast, parking and internet computer. I would stay here again and recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: dephal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night with my 11 year old daughter. We had a Junior room, which is one (large) room with a tiny kitchenette and two double beds. We paid $109 plus tax. The pros: really excellent location if you want to do Hollywood stuff. There are tons of restaurants very close by, the Metro is about a 3 minute walk, etc. The room was quite large. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. We were able to check in early. Parking is relatively secure and is free. A continental breakfast is included. There's free wifi, and also a computer and printer for guests to use. Because the room have kitchen facilities, it would be a good choice for families. The cons: The decor is old and fairly minimalistic. The wifi didn't work well in my room, which was at the back of the place. The walls are thin, so noise is an issue. There was a group of young men staying in the rooms adjacent to mine and when they came in at 4:30 am, they were very loud. The following morning, some of them were standing on the balcony (where he had to walk to get to the elevator), in their underwear, smoking. Charming. Overall, it's convenient and a good value, especially for families, so I'd recommend it. Just don't expect anything fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: TheMuggins
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in Nov 2010. We had a deluxe suite, one room for our 3 year old son and one for us. The rooms were very spacious and the kitchen had everything needed. As with everyroom we have stayed at in the USA, the noise from the neighbours was a little annoying, but not overly so. The location was excellent, walking distance to the sites on the blvd, restaurants. The staff were very helpful and pleasant, lovely people. The breakfast was simple but adequate. The free wi-fi worked well and they have a computer with free internet available which also works well. This place has a great location and spacious rooms at a great price. It doesn't have modern anything (except tv) so if you want new...go somewhere else!!!! If you are happy with older but still neat and clean then stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: darylwi
Reviews.Content: I booked here based on other reviews generally from this website. I wasn't disappointed. The hotel is located right behind the Kodak Theater. The location was absolutely awesome. It was about 2 minutes to the Hollywood at Highland Center and Hollywood Blvd and the Walk of Fame. Also there is a metro station right next to the center so it's easy access to North Hollywood/Burbank, Wilshire Blvd and downtown. The hotel has free underground parking which is great for the location. It's also secured. So is the hotel, although I never felt unsafe in the area. The area seems pretty busy well into the night. We had a two bed room with kitchen and dining room and it was huge. The kitchen had everything you would need to cook yourself. It has a full fridge and stove, utensils and sink, you name it. The beds were queen size and extremely comfortable. The A/C was a little tricky to work but not impossible. They have wi-fi and they serve breakfast from about 8-10am. There is also a rooftop patio or gathering area but nothing was really going on up there when we checked it out. The pool looked fairly large and very clean but it was too chilly to use it anyway. The best way to describe this place is to picture all the new places you see that look horrible inside because they don't keep it up. Well this place is rather old but kept up very well. So it features a lot of true hard wood fixtures, old ceramics and older appliances, kept up very well. It reminded me a lot of my grandparents house. The best part was the cost. For the location and proximity to everything nearly possible, you can not beat the price at all. I would imagine that if there is a major event going on in Hollywood, you probably want to book early. But I went the week of the AFI Festival and got in fine and I don't believe the place was sold out (although by the end of the week the parking basement seems to get pretty full). And if something is going on, walk out to the boulevard and the chinese theater. You might see somebody. We saw Will Ferrell and Sylvester Stallone while there, and several other semi-famous stars too. There's even a Coldstone Creamery in the Center. And the California Pizza Kitchen was awesome. There is a Fresh & Easy Supermarket and CVS about two blocks west of the Kodak Theater.

Reviews.Title: “Good little place”
Reviews.Author: Wenb1756
Reviews.Content: Really close to all Hollywood has to offer. Rooms were ok, facilities fine for a few days. Staff very accommodating especially when hot water ran out and they found us another room immediately. Generous continental breakfast, too

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, awesome value, great staff...Worth staying here”
Reviews.Author: Shangel
Reviews.Content: Our family of 13 (aged 6 weeks to 70 years) stayed here for 7 nights. We had five rooms. We all enjoyed our stayed here, from check in to check out. The staff were amazing and catered to our every need. We were certainly made to feel at home. Our rooms suited us perfectly, they were spacious, had full kitchens and provided the rest that we needed after long days of sight seeing and shopping. The parking is free, there is free wi-fi and a free continental breakfast. The location is excellent (as per previous reviews). Our family would love to stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, wi-fi...and location ; )”
Reviews.Author: Aggie_Z
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is exceptional! A ten second stroll to the entrance of the Hollywood & Highland Shopping Mall followed by a thirty second stroll through the mall gets you to Hollywood Blvd and the famous Hollywood Walk of Fame. Approximately three minutes walk gets you to Fresh & Easy supermarket, CVS Pharmacy, Direct Shoe Warehouse (they stock designer shoes and handbags at cost price, ladies...) and souvenir shops. Other attractions on Hollywood Blvd include tour providers, chain stores, the Kodak Theatre, El Capitan Theatre, Madame Tussauds, Grauman's Chinese and Egyptian Theatres and Ripley's Believe it or Not. Public transport is readily available on Hollywood Blvd - buses (212/213/217/780 express) arrive frequently and travel directly to places such as CBS Studios, The Grove, Melrose Avenue, La Brea Tar Pits and the LA Museum of Art. The entrance to the Hollywood/Highland Metro station is opposite the eastbound bus stop. Universal Studios is one stop away from Hollywood/Highland station. Other areas that can be accessed by metro include Downtown, Chinatown, Long Beach and LAX. A one-way trip on the bus or train costs $1.50. Dining options in the area are countless - Hard Rock Cafe, Johnny Rockets, Hooters, Mel's Drive-in, Baja Fresh, McDonalds, California Pizza Kitchen, as well as the famous Frank & Musso Grill. There is a Starbucks next door to California Pizza Kitchen in the mall which offers free wi-fi and outdoor seating.
