The hotel provides a free continental breakfast daily from 8-10am, with items such as muffins, croissants, bagels, fresh fruit, cereal, juice, tea and coffee on the menu. The hotel itself is dated but incredibly well-maintained. Rooms are spacious, beds comfortable, the kitchen well-stocked with crockery, cutlery, washing-up liquid, kitchen towels and the fridge was spotless and odour-free! The bathroom is sparkling, includes a shower over a bathtub, toilet, sink and a fantastic row of Hollywood-style lights above the bathroom mirror which makes make-up application a breeze (and just a teeny bit dangerous with make-up megastore Sephora so close by in the mall!). Room amenities include an in-room safe, flat-screen TV with 17 different channels to choose from, a small balcony with table and chairs, built-in wardrobe, chest of drawers, and two large, comfy armchairs. The free wi-fi provided by the hotel is really useful when needing to check-in for onward flights or just check emails. There is also a laundry and vending machine located in the basement next to the free parking garage and an outdoor pool. We felt safe and secure during our stay at the Hollywood Orchid Suites and rarely heard any noise from other visitors. The only noise we heard was from delivery trucks at the loading dock of the mall in the early morning, but it didn't bother us too much. I would highly recommend a stay at the Hollywood Orchid Suites, both for location and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Orchid Suites.....its all about location and that's it!”
Reviews.Author: efzed
Reviews.Content: Orchid Suites is very much like the house that you used to share with your friends in college.....habitable but nothing fancy.......the beautiful part of this hotel is the location........you are on right on Hollywood Blvd and many of the things that you want to see and do are really, really close-by

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in the heart of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: kgersen
Reviews.Content: Nice suite with lounge/kitchenette and separate double bedroom. Very clean and tidy but the decor is looking a little bit outdated. Excellent value considering the location. A little noisy first thing in the morning (delivery trucks on the road outside), to be expected in a busy town. Friendly and helpful staff. Will use again, next time I'm in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't get closer to everything if you tried-well at that price!”
Reviews.Author: NellyElle
Reviews.Content: Great trip. Perfect location to see hollywood. metro, shopping mall,tour buses, chinese theatre, Kodak.....Handy little entrance across the street to the Mall. Great. Nice helpful staff to get tickets for Universal and bus tours. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay at Orchid Suites”
Reviews.Author: redrob1234
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the price is right........that's why people choose this hotel. The free Wi-Fi, free parking & free breakfast were all great and can really save you a lot of $$. We were not on a tight budet but I still like to get good value for money. It's true the decor is dates but it is clean and safe and the staff are very welcoming and helpful. There is a laundry room and vending machine in the basement as well. I really struggled when making our decision or where to stay in Los Angeles. I was considering staying at one of the big name places located and 100 feet away from this place but I was put off by the very expensive parking, wi-fi & breakfast charges. I would recommend this hotel to anyone provided you don't need room service and other services that other fancier hotels can offer - at a price.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: Mon81
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - really really clean and VERY central! The rooms were very very spacious, breakfast was great and the pool was really nice!

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel that needs a renovation rescue”
Reviews.Author: GlenB062
Reviews.Content: Great location hotel in Hollywood but needs a serious makeover. Firstly the bed was saggy and the mattress was covered in plastic which made it extremely hot and uncomfortable and a poor sleep. Internet access was always very slow and frustrating. Good size rooms and storage. Air conditioner was very noisy and there was building work happening beside the Hotel that started at 7am. Overall, a fair hotel but there is probably better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, amazing value”
Reviews.Author: baylinersarah
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing value for its location. The rooms are very clean and spacious, and its one of the few hotels we found where you can do your own laundry! The breakfast is light and a great start to the day. Make sure you visit the Ivy for lunch, and the maddam tussad's wax museum. It's amazing! We would defintley stay at the Hollywood Orchid Suites again. The undercover parking was a bonus for us as we had a hire car. The parking fee was all included in our room rate. There is no room service or anything like that, but there is a full functional kitchen so that you can purchase your own food / drink. Tea / coffee facilities available in the room and all provided. There is a drink machine down stairs near the laundry with milk, coke, etc. All very good prices. Excellent hotel - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value”
Reviews.Author: 20_times_ATW
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very convenient location, and only slightly hidden by the big expensive hotels around it. You wonâ€™t get better value for money than this. The hotel is easy to find and parking is free (though rather cramped). The receptionist greeted us with a warm smile and I felt I had not made a mistake to drive past the larger brand hotels to get there. Our room was huge, though I confess we did not take advantage of the large sitting area, kitchen, or dining area. We used the separate bedroom area and shower! There is a pool which is good size: much more than the usual puddle that has been blown up with a very wide angle lens to get you through the door. We didnâ€™t use it but other guests said it was good. Breakfast is included and comprises cereals, buns, fruit, juices, tea, and coffee. The breakfast area is small so we used a tray and took food back to our room. We could not have asked for more. We didnâ€™t use it, but there is a laundry room downstairs. Everyone is friendly, including the reception staff, the janitors, and the breakfast lady. We never encountered an unhappy face or a negative word fro the staff. The hotel is five minutes walk from the Avenue of Stars and another five minutes to the Chinese Theatre. What could be better? From the shopping mall, you can see the Hollywood sign on the hills. To get to Universal Studios, take the subway. The station is five minutes from the hotel and one stop on the subway. Cross the street and take the free shuttle bus to the studio. That will save time and aggravation with driving and save money on parking, too. There are a plethora of souvenir shops, food stores, and restaurants within walking distance. Unfortunately, there is poor public transport to Disney Land, so you have to drive there. It is about 45 minutes. If you are going to Disney Land for several days, you might want to move to a hotel that is nearer! The only negative aspect is that they have designated smoking spots and occasionally the cigarette smoke drifted into our room. They should just make the entire hotel smoke free.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: louluvslabs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the heart of the action, about 1 minute walk to the Hollywood & Highland shopping centre and the famous walk of fame. My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights right at the start of our USA trip and found it to be fine. It doesn't have the bells & whistles of other properties but if you are looking for an average, clean hotel, then this is it. Even has a pool and breakfast is included. Also free parking and free WIFI - you can't beat that!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Ruds10
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at Orchid Suites on the 10 & 11 Sep 2010. We booked a Executive Suite with a King size bed. Room was very spacious with a seperate kitchen. The kitchen is fully equipped if you intend to cook. My only complaint on the room is the floor which is dirty. The bottom of your feet is covered with soot if you walk barefoot in the room. Breakfast was provided and the servings were adequate. The best part of staying here is the location. Its less than 5 minutes walk to Kodak Theatre, Gruman Chinese Theatre, shopping mall, city sightseeing hop on and hop off bus. DO take the 24 hours Hop on and off bus as its trully value for money if you want to see LA without going with a guided tour group. The bus comes with commentary for each stop. We bought a 24 hour all routes ticket as there are 4 different routes in total.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Location!!”
Reviews.Author: HooTraveler2005
Reviews.Content: Stay for 5 days and would defineitely stay again. The suite was nice and spacious with a kitchen and table and a seperate hallway for the bathroom. The bed wasn't uncomfortable and the furniture was fine. The continental breakfast was nice although the grocery store was a 4 minute walk so we also bought food and made breakfast. The location is AWESOME. You can walk to the Hollywood Walk of Fame through the mall or take the metro in less than 5 minutes. We also made several road "excursions" and always found it easy to get back to. The staff were very willing to help us (esp with take out one late night). The free wifi was also a big plus!! Maybe the best part was that we didn't have to spend $30+ on parking. Free, safe, underground parking!! Could it use some "cosmetic updates"? Probably but who cares for the price and location!!

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: feistyfemme
Reviews.Content: When we first drove up to the hotel we were a bit sketchy, but having read other reviews in regards to this hotel I still had high hopes. We weren't disappointed. The front desk were always more than willing to help. The suite we had was more than adequate. We had a balcony with 2 queen beds and a kitchen. The kitchen had the basic items required and we used it well. The free underground parking was a bonus! This hotel had a very decent continental breakfast, a computer with printer to print out directions, it had a swimming pool that our teenage girls took full advantage of. The mall was less than 100 feet away and a shortcut to the famed Hollywood Blvd and the stars. We took the metro the one stop to Universal Studios for $1.50 each, which is more than resonable. If you're looking for a high end place this isn't it. If you don't mind an older place that is clean, decent, a comfy bed, and all amenities around you, then I would suggest to go here. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - could do with a bit of TLC”
Reviews.Author: gillards
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our Californian holiday. Stayed at the Orchid Suites for 3 nights. Conveniently located for the Hollywood tourist attractions. Don't underestimate the size LA though, beaches are a good distance away. We had a car though so very accesible. Hotel rooms dated but clean. Continental breakfast just what was needed just start the day. Free parking a bonus. Would definately recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, good value”
Reviews.Author: RoRo_in_Perth
Reviews.Content: I didn't think finding accommodation in Los Angeles would be so hard! Since my friend and I weren't travelling with a car, location was very important to us and we wanted to stay somewhere where it would be relatively easy to get around. Transport in LA isn't the best - hard to believe for such a modern city! I came across the Orchid Suites on a website, checked it out on Trip Advisor and it had pretty good reviews, so we booked the last room available for two people - a junior suite. I was expecting it to be small, but it was quite roomy, with two double beds, a kitchenette, a TV, nice bathroom, closet and safe, which came in very handy. There are many positives about the hotel. They include: * friendly hotel staff - I think the guy was called Marlo, he always had a friendly smile and was too happy to give advice and tips * free internet!! which was so handy, it was great being able to check your email in the morning and at night and print out tickets to theme parks * free continental breakfast every morning - we were so appreciate to have access to cereal, fresh fruit, muffins, bagels, tea, coffee every morning...it was simple but a great way to start the day of sightseeing * location, location, location! Just a walk to Walk of Fame, Chinese Theatre (which is handy if you want to take a Starline Tour to any of the theme parks, around the city, etc), the metro is just down the street (which is just one stop away from Universal Studios) * decent sized swimming pool (which we didnt use) * free parking (which again, we didnt use but was a great option to guests who needed it) * decent sized rooms - more than enough space to store your suitcases. I was happy to have a decent sized fridge to store drinks and fruit too One tip if you're visiting LA and staying at the Orchid Suites - check out this website for details of upcoming premieres http://www.seeing-stars.com/Calendar/index.shtml#premieres Thanks to that website, I discovered that Angelina Jolie was having her premiere of "Salt" at the Chinese Theatre during our stay and since its just a walk away from the hotel, we was able to watch all the stars walk the red carpet and even had a moment with Angelina and Brad!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: april_li
Reviews.Content: good location, friendly staff, reasonable price, huge room!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a handy location - look elsewhere if you like 'boutique style' tho”
Reviews.Author: JC_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights in August and loved this hotel.. not for the great views or the luxury accommodation (neither exist) but for the convenient location, space and value for money. We stayed in #300 (double exec suite), booked direct with the hotel and got a discounted rate as we were there for a full week. Facilities are great for the price - 24hr desk, free and secure parking (guaranteed space), decent sized pool, rooftop terrace, free Internet access, PC & printer plus a full kitchen (utensils & crockery are basic). Breakfast is called 'light continental' but there was lots of food on the buffet every morning so you won't go hungry - cereals, fruit, bagels (& cream cheese), croissants, muffins, tea, coffee, orange juice, etc. Plus, you can take it all back to your room or sit on the roof terrace to enjoy some sunshine with your meal. The staff were all very friendly and helpful - directing us to the closest supermarket (fresh & easy, just past the Chinese Theatre), printing maps for us when the PC was busy (usually at breakfast time & early evening) and booking a $55 fixed rate taxi deal to the airport. If you're someone who gets annoyed by small things when you're staying at a hotel (eg some people have pointed out that the bed sheets don't fit well.. they're right, they don't! We also had a leaky tap in the bathroom and a very slow running cold tap in the kitchen) or you like to have modern furnishings then you probably won't enjoy your stay here. But if you can overlook them then you'll have a great stay and a lot of extra $$ in your pocket to enjoy what LA has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: cmg65
Reviews.Content: First off, I have to note that due to a mix up with reservation dates (my fault) we arrived a month earlier that we were expected! The front desk staff was very accomodating and managed to fit us in for the entire length of our stay during a busy period and because of that we were in a room at the front on the main floor. I was concerned it would be noisy but we were never once disturbed by noise from the street or the office area perhaps because we had the A/C on most of the time. The rooms are large and with the kitchen, make eating in very convenient. The free Wi-fi worked good. This was our 2nd stay here-first was 4 years ago. It is very centrally located to all the Hollywood sights and parking is no problem with an underground secured parkade. If you have a larger vehicle space could be a little tight. The hotel itself is an older property but kept in good condition, the continental breakfast is more than adequate and the staff is friendly and efficient. We found the beds to be comfortable enough for us. A bonus for a hotel of this category is a nice pool area. We would definately stay here again. We stayed at another hotel on the same street 2 years ago but I would choose this one over the other one if we were to come back to Hollywood again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic room in a great location for a great price”
Reviews.Author: Neaseoul
Reviews.Content: As the woman on Hollywood blvd told us "This is Hollywood ladies, don't expect too much". If you are looking for luxurious accommodations, this place is not for you. If you are looking for a clean place to stay in a great location for an unbeatable price this is the spot. Pros: Hollywood blvd is less than 2 blocks away, attractions, food, shops, club are near by. Free parking, large room which felt more like an apt than a hotel, full kitchen and very quiet at night. Cons: Located on a small back street near the loading dock of the nearby Renaissance hotel so it can get noisy in the morning with all the trucks. No view but who cares if you are there to sleep, not look out the window. Overall: We did not spend much time in the room so it did not have to be the best hotel on the strip. Walkable location near all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly good Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Meags4273
Reviews.Content: Orchid Suites is not a ritzy Hotel by any stretch of the imagination, but it is clean, cheap and conveniently located. The staff are lovely, especially Marlo at the front desk who was only too happy to help us whenever possible. The rooms are a great size and have everything you need to make your stay a pleasant one. There is also a great size heated pool, which is perfect to come back to after a long day sight seeing. Would be only too happy to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but fantastic”
Reviews.Author: pythia
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay when in Hollywood....60 seconds from the Chinese Theater, shopping centre, open top bus (thats a must do ) and the Metro. Rooms are spacious, spotless and has everything you need.....The pool has sun on it most of the day, so its nice and warm in the afternoon....Free Wifi in the room, and if you dont take your lap top, then there is a computer with printer in the breakfast area for you to use (breakfast is included as well)...and finally the staff....friendly, helpful, nothing was to much trouble. Thank you for a the best stay in Hollywood Oops forgot the parking, its free and undercover

Reviews.Title: “JAZZZY Time!”
Reviews.Author: DiddyJoe69
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife went to the Jazz festival this weekend, and oh la la la, we had such a great time. This hotel had such great customer service, it's close to everything, free breakfast and parking(which is a big deal in hollywood!), free wifi, it's clean, and affordable. The front desk agents were so friendly and informative, especially that really cute guy, I think his name was Jasper. He helped us out a lot! Will definitely be staying again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect luxury & you won't be disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: CheekyMacyCat
Reviews.Content: We had a king bedded room with kitchen. This is more like a motel than a hotel, but if you don't expect too much, you won't be disappointed as it's a little old. Basically, all the staff were very polite, our room was quiet, overlooking the pool area, and the bedroom and lounge area were very comfortable. The kitchen was really handy and everything was very clean. The breakfast was a basic continental and was more than adequate to start the day off - who wants a cooked breakfast every day anyway. The location was excellent - better than I expected. Go outside the hotel entrance, through the shopping centre next door (which had plenty of choices for dining), and you were at the Graumann's Chinese Theatre & Kodak Theatre. I think it was really good for the price and would definitely stay there again as it was good value for the price paid. Like I said, if you can get past the fact that it is a bit old & some of the public area could do with a bit of an update, I would stay here & save my money for spending on other things.

Reviews.Title: “location location”
Reviews.Author: cate054
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 7 am and were immediately booked in and upgraded check in not till 4 pm. Made very welcome. As read in reviews the rooms were tired but we found ours to be very clean and had everything you needed in the kitchen. Free use of the computer was great we did not get it anywhere else that we stayed. The staff were particularly friendly and we had a chat every night with the owner. He offered to drop us off to the Farmers Market on his way home nice guy. Location was great just step through the shopping centre out to Greumann Theatre. Fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, Great Value, Convenient and Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: evenstar944
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orchid Suites with my cousin for four nights in a one bedroom unit. The room had two queen beds and full kitchen, dinette table, flat screen TV and bathroom with separate sink. The sink being separate worked out great when getting ready in the mornings. Although the room was dated, it was clean. We had a small balcony and table that looked out over Orchid Avenue which we did not use. Although we did not use the kitchen to cook it was nice having a fridge, plates, utensils and glasses to use when we brought home take out. The staff is friendly and useful. They have pamphlets near the front desk for sightseeing and ideas on things to do in Los Angeles. A continental breakfast was included with the usual fare of muffins, bagels, cereal, coffee, tea and juice. There was a small pool but the weather was cool during our stay so we did not use it. There is a computer and printer which was handy when printing out our boarding passes. I loved the use of the free underground parking garage which always had plenty of parking. The hotel is not very aesthetically pleasing but it was such a bargain and a great base for traveling to all the sights we saw. The hotel is centrally located to Hollywood sight's and about a ten minute drive to Universal Studios and the Griffith Observatory. It is also near the scenic Mulholland drive and very easy to get around to most of the sights we saw. The furthest drive was Santa Monica which took around forty five minutes. The only issue was that there was some construction going on around the Hollywood and Highland mall which we were able to hear in the mornings but it did not impede on my sleep. One night they were some noisy neighbors that did wake me up around 4am but this is not the hotel's fault. What to do in Los Angeles Mulholland Drive: Nice scenic drive through the Hollywood Hills. They are some great scenic lookouts. Checkout Runyon Canyon Park for some trails. Getty Center: Beautiful architecture, gardens and grounds, also nice overview of LA Griffith Observatory: My favorite for a scenic overview of LA and the Hollywood Sign Universal Studios: pales in comparison to Florida Disney parks but had a great time here nonetheless. Favorite was the Simpson and Mummy ride. Rodeo Drive/Beverly Hills: Saw some really nice houses. I like 5th Avenue in NYC better in comparison to Rodeo. Farmer's Market and Grove: Although not an outdoor outlet complex, it reminded me of Woodbury Commons in NY, however much nicer. I really enjoyed the Farmer's market. Had some good old fashioned pistachio ice cream and great brazilian churrascaria. Santa Monica: The pier reminded me a little of Coney Island in Brooklyn but much nicer. I enjoyed the Third Street Promenade. Although the shops were nothing new they had a lot of my favorite ones on one small strip. Also kudos to the H&M there for having my size and the clothes not being in a disarray like most of the H&M stores in NYC. Had pretty good pizza at a place called Joe's but still not as good as pizza in NYC. It's the water...heh Venice Beach: the beach itself was mediocre. It reminded me of a inferior Greenwich village. Not my vibe but was fun to walk through. Felt that an hour there was enough. Hollywood: an inferior Times Square. You have to experience it but an hour is more than enough. Took a tour of the Kodak which I enjoyed. Unfortunately the theatre was covered in plastic due to construction for a new cirque du Soleil. Mel's Diner has the best burgers ever! The Avocado burger is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value in the center of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: gotarheels
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the first time in this small hotel (motel?) tucked behind the Hollywood Rennaisance in April '10. I was in town for the TCM Classic Film Festival. First, the MANY pros: -Price. $139/night, was approximately 1/3 the cost of the "official hotel sponsors"--the Roosevelt and the Rennaisance. -Very spacious room. It was more like a studio apartment than a hotel room with sleeping area, full kitchen, four-seat dining table, ample closet space, and bath with shower/tub combo. -Location. The property is right behind the Kodak Theater and adjacent to the back entrance of the shopping mall right next to the theater. One might think that the location in back of something else might make it more seedy or dangerous to walk around, but as a solo traveler, I can tell you that I felt much safer taking the quick right into the mall rather than venturing out onto the streets at night. -Attentive staff. The property is small enough that they recognize you quickly. You either have to use your room key or get buzzed into the front door. I never once managed to produce my key quicker than I was buzzed in. There is a security camera by the front door that they use to recognize you. Since I am a lone female, I requested a room near the front desk when I made my reservation and they honored it by giving me the closest one with a clear sight-line from the desk to my room. -Easy access to public transportation...no small feat in LA. I don't like to take long cab rides when I'm traveling alone so chose to use the Flyaway bus from LAX (thanks for the tip, Amazing Race!) to the Union Station stop then the Red metro train line to the stop just 1/2 block from the Orchid Suites. This is the first time I've taken public transport in LA. On the way from LAX, I was not familiar with the system/times so it took about 1.75 hours to make the trip. On the way back, I timed it better and was at the airport in just under one hour. -the small pool was clean, private and lovely. There is also a rooftop garden and sitting area on the top floor where I can imagine it would be nice to enjoy a drink with friends...especially if you want that drink with a smoke. -free wireless internet throughout the property. They issue you a security code at check-in. Two Cons: -beds are moderate. Not terrible, with springs sticking out, just not up to the level I'm used to at Westin, Hilton and Wyndham. I did manage to sleep fine, but it took a bit to get comfortable. -No view. The hotel is surrounded by parking lots/access roads on three sides. In conclusion, I thought the Orchid Suites was an excellent value and will certainly book there again next time I'm in town. Didn't cook anything in the kitchen (there are plenty of restaurants and quick stops in the area), but found the fridge to be a convenient and cheaper way to keep leftovers and drinks than going out for more. Particularly if you are traveling with a family and staying a while, you could really have a significant amount cut off your budget in such a place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 19nat89
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed at the Orchid Suites in the last week, and found it great. The location was fantastic. Less than a 200 metre walk to Hollywood Boulevard, and Hollywood Highland Shopping Mall. Within walking distance to a lot of attractions and restaurants/cafes. If you are after luxury, then do not stay here. It is old and starting to need updating, but it was clean, and the staff were all very friendly. There is a free continental breakfast. It is only very light, but enough to start off the day. Also free computer and printer service which was very helpful. I was only there for 3 nights, but it would be great for a long stay too because of full kitchen facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay when exploring Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: KatyerFin
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location! ItÂ´s next door to the kodak theatre and few minutes walk from the main attractions in Hollywood. Didn't need to use our car at all while staying in Orchid and the parking was locked, based under the hotel. Our room was huge with proper kitchen. I thought the room was clean but the decor was outdated. Could be even nicer if they would update the carpets, curtains and bed covers. But I didn't mind as we stayed only for 3 nights. Staff was very helpful and there was nice basic breakfast and free wi-fi. During the night there were some noices from upstairs but it didn't bother me too much.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Bibster2005
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located across from Kodak Centre, Walk of Fame, Chinese Theatre and Highland & Hollwood Shopping Centre. Staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms are abit old and tired but comfortable and roomy. The kitchenette was a big bonus and is the feature of our stay. We were able to buy food back from a nearby supermarket and cook our own dinner. A bit dissapointed that the pool was being renovated during our stay. If you are on the lower floor, you might hear a lot of noises from the top floor, especially when you are in the kitchen. Otherwise, this hotel is thumbs up for its location and staff. Breakfast was simple and casual.

Reviews.Title: “excellent base for exploring los angeles”
Reviews.Author: tmh52
Reviews.Content: Room decor is a bit tired but comfortable and the kitchen is a big bonus. Continental breakfast provided is perfectly adequate. Staff are very helpful. The hotel is in an ideal location - next to a metro and on several bus routes, walking distance to all hollywood sights. Getting around in LA can take a long time as it is so vast - we underestimated the distances but it is still perfectly do-able on public transport, eg you can get to the Getty Center or Venice Beach in under an hour and a half. Universal Studios is one stop on the metro.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cherry Hill, New Jersey, United States
Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the money”
Reviews.Author: Alice G
Reviews.Content: Hotel in the middle of everything! It is directly behind the Kodak Theater. This hotel seems to have been at one time an apartment building turned into a hotel. This building is old BUT the rooms are big, huge closets, huge full size kitchen, everything is freshly painted and clean and I think that is one good selling point. I felt it was very safe even to walk at night alone to and from the Kodak mall. The hotel sits directly across the street from the Kodak, Renaissance Hotel loading dock. (not loud at all) and there was 24 hr security there. This is a dead end street so there is not a lot of traffic. I did feel that there were three things that needed improvement. 1, replace mattress's they were a bit brutal. 2. replace the 19" tube tv. but then again I might be a bit spoiled from my own flat 52" 3. more knowledgeable front desk clerks. They knew very little about what was going on in the LA area. So do your homework before you come. They were of very little help. They offered free internet and free parking which really most hotels in the are charged for , so those two saved us money! There was also a sky top garden which didn't seem like anyone used. Would be perfect for a candle lit dinner etc.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we chose this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yusoff
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights, from Mar 17 to Mar 20 2010 with my wife and 2 kids. Spent lot of time looking for place to stay that close to places to visit and affordable rates, finally found this hotel which suit my needs. Check in was quick. The lady at the front desk was friendly, accomodating and very helpful. Its a pity I didnt get her name. The room has 2 king size bed, full kitchen, nice LCD TV and clean bed. Dont expect any nice view, we dont really care anayway because we spent most of the time outside enjoying our vacation. Breakfast is basic, but enough for us. Self service laundry room at ground floor next to carpark - great and very convenient. We will definitely stay here again next time we visit LA/Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Apartments turned hotel”
Reviews.Author: vkraemer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times over the last ten years. It has never been a palace. But it has been a great place to stay when I have travelled with my kids through the years. I reckon that the property started out as an apartment building... like some of the other buildings on Orchid Street. At some point, this was converted into a hotel. Their rooms have been clean. Most of the rooms that I have stayed in have had a front bedroom/living room area and a back bedroom. They have all had kitchens. The kitchens have had most all the basics that you need. There is a pool. The staff is nice. The location, behind the Kodak Theater and Hollywood Highland Center is great. The large high-end hotel next door is way more expensive per night and their rooms are just as black when you close your eyes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, comfortable beds, clean with decent free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Aussiesweetpea
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here on two separate occasions during our month long holiday in the States during Feb 2010. This hotel is older but I found it to be really well maintained, comfortable and clean. The staff were super helpful friendly and made you feel very welcome. I found the breakfast to be good enough (especially for free!!), with fresh fruit, choices of cereals, bagels, croissants, muffins, juice and coffee which is available all day. There is free us of the computer and the internet and plenty of phamphlets on all the entertainment on offer. The rooms we stayed in were quite big, the beds comfortable and I remarked to the hotel staff how quiet it was despite being 1 min behind Hollywood Boulevard. Unlike other who have reviewed this hotel, we didnt hear other guests and did not find anything offensive about this place at all. The location is definetly unbelievably great and we felt very safe (2 Aussie girls , mum and daughter) alone. In a nutshell for an old hotel we found it fabulous and will definetly stay there next time we are in LA.

Reviews.Title: “outdated and smelly but great location”
Reviews.Author: babooWyoming
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after winning a trip off the radio and so we didn't get to pick this place. If I had a choice, I wouldn't have stayed here. It was free so I'm not sure what the cost was. It was very outdated, had an old smell, and wasn't comfortable at all. I was afraid to sit on the furniture due to it being rather old and dirty. I inspected the sheets and they were clean and fresh but we didn't use the blanket or bedspread because they looked, well, old and I couldn't tell how clean they were. I wouldn't walk on the old, dirty looking carpet without slippers either. The location was GREAT though. It was so close to the subway and shopping and what not. The underground-off-street parking was really nice too. I felt safe that my rental car wasn't gonna get stolen or broken into.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tatirj
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a small and quiet street behind kodak theatre. The room is spacious with a good kitchen and clean.

Reviews.Title: “prime Hollywood location for inexpensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: IaLLS63
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for cheap lodging in a good location, this is your hotel. This hotel is directly behind the Hollywood & Highland Center mall and the Kodak Theater. A very short walk through the mall leads you to Hollywood Blvd. There isn't a gorgeous view outside your window. The rooms are dated, the carpets are a little worn. This is an older hotel but it is a hidden gem. It is clean and quiet and roomy. We had a room with 2 beds, a sitting area, a balcony overlooking the pool and an eat-in full kitchen. The complimentary breakfast was satisfactory-pastries, muffins, bagels, toast, cereal, juices, milk, coffee, hot chocolate. Internet access (one computer with printer in breakfast area and wifi throughout the hotel) is free. Parking in a keycard access underground garage is free, a rarity in Hollywood. The staff was friendly and helpful. The front door of the hotel is locked in the evening for security. The desk clerk will let you in when you ring the buzzer. As a woman, I felt very secure in this hotel. If you're on a budget & planning to spend most of your time outside your hotel room, this is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you're into location, this is the place..”
Reviews.Author: lyks2travel
Reviews.Content: Indeed, it's just at the back of the kodak theatre. what a perfect place to stay if location is the no.1 priority. otherwise, you will hear the next door neighbor's voices word for word, occupants upstairs running and so you can hear them , the truck loading and unloading during early morning, then, in the middle of the night, there seems to be some kind of a train passing by and uses the horns. Place -wise, don't expect a high end accomodation, as I've said, this is all about location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: CB1020
Reviews.Content: Basic breakfast, walking distance to sites, incredibly helpful staff. Only downfall was thin walls, but you get used to the noises.

Reviews.Title: “What a delightful surprise”
Reviews.Author: ismaryandedgar
Reviews.Content: For $109 I was not expecting much but what a delightful surprise! The hotel was situated right in the heart of hollywood. The front desk was super friendly. There was Free parking and since the hotel is next to everything you walk everywhere anyway, it was fantastic. The free breakfast was just right (cereal, muffins, fruit, bagels, orange juice, etc.) The best part, we got a free upgrade from a standard to a suite, it was like staying in a bed room apartment!!! I wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Location cannot be beat and free parking”
Reviews.Author: pcbdoug
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orchid Suites for four nights and was very pleased. The hotel is directly behind the Kodak Theater and a short walk to Hollywood Blvd and the Chinese Theater. Also it is very close to the Metro Station and it was easy to get to downtown Los Angeles and Universal Studios is only one stop away. I also rode the Metro from The stop next to the hotel to Pasadena to the Rose Bowl. The hotel is old and is in need of a little updating, but this is easily overlooked due to location, price, and free parking. I had an executive 2 bed suite with a full kitchen and an outside terrace. Housekeeping left me with extra towels each day. I was very pleased with the cleanliness of the room and bathroom. The breakfast was pretty good--cereals, fruit, toast, bagels, jams, and juices. The front desk staff was friendly and gave me some good restaurant choices. If you are looking for a luxury hotel, this is not the choice for you. However, if you are looking for a good value, conveience, and free parking, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Budget Choice...”
Reviews.Author: fleurr
Reviews.Content: For the price Orchid is a pretty good bet. The location couldn't be better and has all the facilities of the HH mall at your doorstep...as other reviewers have said you are inside the mall within 60 seconds walk. Plenty of security guards hanging about the back too so it all feels perfectly safe. The hotel itself is a pretty no frills motel style deal..we were lucky enough to get one of the few (I think there's 3?) rooms with a sun filled balcony. Really nice to relax on at the end of the day. The kitchen was handy with a full size fridge and would be great for families...bed's comfortable enough. Bathroom was fairly average and the shower water pressure wasn't great but for the price we paid who could complain! It was nice to be able to walk downstairs and collect a few things for breakfast and bring a plate back to your room...great having a pool too. Really it's all about location...sephora, johnny rockets, cpk, mac, cinemas, forever 21 you name it right on your doorstep. Universal studios is also only one stop on the subway away and super easy to get to. The Starline tours all leave from the HH mall too and only 30 seconds walk from the hotel. Def a good bet! just be sure you want to stay in the Hollywood area though..that was the only prob I had. it might be cleaner than before but it was still pretty seedy about as the night got on and we found the LA bus system a bit of a nightmare to try and navigate around! You also have the annoyance of all the entertainment hustlers right outside constantly trying to get you to take photos with them etc..get's very old quickly!

Reviews.Title: “No frills hotel excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Samtoh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and although the hotel is old we could not fault its location nor the price we paid. Pros: the kitchen, the free interent, the free breakfast. Cons: the room was freezing! We did not know how to work the heater but really the heater should belong in a museum not in a hotel room. The carpet was also a bit questionable. I would recommend this hotel as long as you understand this is a no frills hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for a Tourist”
Reviews.Author: lionleosn
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to stay in the middle of tourist country then this is your place. This location is a quick drive from Warner Bros. Studios. Plus a quick walk to the Kodak Theatre, Chinese theatre, walk of stars, etc. The staff was friendly and informational. They didn't go out of there way to say "hi" to us, but I think it's because they were respecting our space. They were very helpful and informative when we asked them questions. I would definitely rent a car, so that you can easily drive to other fun LA areas, but I saw a lot of taxis too. We just thought we saved quite a bit of money by renting a car, because it was relatively simple to find metered parking and garage parking (parking validations were usually offered w/ purchase). Plus, this hotel offers free parking and wi-fi which are bonuses. NOTE: Don't expect luxury while staying at this hotel...you get what you pay for. Everything is pretty outdated and old, so you will enjoy your stay as long as you keep this in mind and don't have unrealistic expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Updating needed badly, but clean & excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Judy94
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended for its location. NOT handicap friendly. Stairs up to check-in desk and to small elevator. Nice staff. Walls thin as paper. Decent breakfast. (coffee,tea, cereal, juice, muffins, bread, jam, fruit) Has a very sloooow but serviceable computer and printer for everyone. $15 per person shuttle bus from airport. (We didn't buy shuttle bus tickets ahead of time, but we did not go during high season) Did not rent a car. Jimmy Kimmel show, Madame Tussaud's, Graumann's, Kodak theatre, shopping centre and grocery store 1-4 blocks away from hotel. If it's the first time in Hollywood for you and you want to do the tourist thing, I would recommend taking hop-on hop-off Starlight bus tour for 2 days which office you will find about 2 blocks away from hotel. Although the subway & bus stops are about 2 blocks away from the hotel, you won't be able to identify trivial things like "where Jim Carey stayed when he first came to Hollywood" unless it's pointed out to you (like they do on the tour bus) and frankly, we just didn' t have enough time to plan and travel around by bus & subway (if you do take public transport, buy the $5 day pass for unlimited travel for the day) The tour bus also gets you to Santa Monica where you can walk (45 minutes) to Venice Beach. Souvenirs on Santa Monica Beach are 1/2 price on Venice Beach. You can also use the tour bus to go to downtown L.A., Chinatown (where you can bargain for items) , Farmers' Market, CBS Studios, Paramount Studios, Rodeo Drive, Melrose street, and to Universal Studios Theme Park (which we didn't go into). Went to Jay Leno show which was good. Also went to the Warner Bros tour. This is a very good tour and our tour guide Tara was extremely well informed and entertaining. Also went to 4 hour taping of "New Adventures of Old Christine". That actually went very quickly bc the emcee was incredibly funny. They give you pizza & water. For both Leno & "New Adventures" they say you can't bring in cameras, but as long as you don't use it, "Leno" won't take it away from you . Leno comes out before show & chats . If you ask nicely, he will usually take a pic with you. Will also stop and give you an autograph & shake your hand if you wait outside for about 1/2 hour after the taping. "New Adventures" will take your camera and hold it for you until you leave. It's a $25 taxi fare (one way) from the hotel to Burbank where Leno & Warner Brothers Studios are. NOT worth going to are Hollywood Wax Museum & Guinness World of Records Museum. Celebrity & TV & movie character Impersonators in front of Graumann's & Kodak theatre. To take pics with them, be ready to tip them $2 to $4. They don't ask for money and many tourists will not tip them, but remember this is what many of them do for a living. So the better the costume, the better the tip. Went to Los Angeles County Museum of Art - LACMA *sigh* Maybe it's bc I've been to the museums in Paris, New York & London, but I don't consider this a world class museum. Architecture is good, tho (I know that it gets raves from others so I was disappointed. I suggest you go to the Getty instead) Personally, I prefer New York bc everything is pretty close by and subway more extensive. L.A. is a very large and all the tourist attractions are far from each other. Also, I prefer N.Y.'s "vibe".

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: TravelersMichigan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right behind the Kodak Theatre. You can walk through the back alley into a mall, then right out on to the Walk of Fame. It is a great location in a safe area. Our room had 2 double beds, a comfy chair, a table with 4 chairs, a small kitchen and bath. We put in a roll-away bed and still had plenty of room. It is a little dated, but clean and comfortable. I was worried it might be noisy because of the location, but it wasn't at all. Breakfast was included. Staff was extremely friendly. Parking was underneath the hotel, so very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Value”
Reviews.Author: DJD43
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in Dec and could not have been happier with the value-for-money of this hotel. If you're after something modern and flashy then this is not for you. However, if you want something within walking distance of Hollywood Blvd that has large clean rooms, free secure parking, free wi-fi and good breakfast all at a low price then this is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: staxtics
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 8 nights, i've read the reviews about this place and almost all were good reviews and it turned out to be true. The location was excellent, it was located right beside the Hollywood & Highlands mall and behind the Chinese Theatre. The room looked a little old but that didn't really bother me that much and the complimentary breakfast every morning was average. Staffs were very friendly and helpful and i enjoyed my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Orchid Suites was a really great choice for us.”
Reviews.Author: HeyTigerlily
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in LA for the night and wanted to a find a hotel that was economical and central to the major attractions. If youâ€™re looking for a place thatâ€™s clean, comfortable and will not break your bank, then I highly recommend the Hollywood Orchid Suites. The hotel is situated in a quiet street behind the famous Kodak Theatre. The representative at the Front Desk was pleasant and provided us with maps of the surrounding area. She booked us in Room 211, a large room in the back corner of the hotel. Upon entering our room, we were hit by the smell of an â€œolderâ€� hotel. After the initial smell hit us, it quickly dissipated as we explored our room. The full size kitchen was big with all the amenities of home: Gas powered stove, toaster oven, full-sized refrigerator. I could envision families with children getting the most out of this hotel. The bathroom was clean and the bed was decent. The carpet and dÃ©cor were outdated but that was to be expected. The biggest pet peeve for me was the really thin walls. I was awoken the next morning by the shouting of our loud noisy neighbors and I could honestly hear their full conversations. Thankfully it was already 9:30 am and time for me to wake up anyway. When we were leaving, I peaked into a room that the housekeeping staff was cleaning. I was reassured by the thoroughness of their cleaning. They were pulling off all the linens on the beds and making sure that all the sheets were fresh for the next guests. I also got a kick out of the parking spaces. They named each of the spaces after a famous celebrity. I remember we were in the Al Pacino space for the duration of our stay. Although not a huge parking structure, it was still a great way to remember where your car was. Hollywood Orchid Suites was a really great choice for us. It was clean, affordable and you definitely can't beat a place that provides you free wi-fi and parking.

Reviews.Title: “Old but clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: GBDK
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to stay for a couple of nights. It was fairly old but clean with comfy beds. Free parking and breakfast were included. Our unit had two separate bedrooms. The size of the rooms was also good. The walls were a little thin and we were able to hear some noise from other rooms. It didn't bother us too much but after a week I'm sure you would be wanting a good nights sleep. The location was great for all things Hollywood. Would stay again 1-2 nights. Staff were friendly enough.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: michelledarwin
Reviews.Content: I spent 9 nites here in nov 2009 and i loved the location and the rooms were very nice and had lots of space , and having a kitchen was wonderful. The breakfast they provided were wonderful and i loved my stay there so much i even cancelled my booking at another hotel in venice beach and went back to the orchid suties for my final 2 nites in hollywood , the computer they have for guest to use was great to keep intouch with family and friends at home. I would highly recommend this wonderful place to stay to any one coming to Hollywood , the location is so close to everything the staff were absoultely wonderful i will stay there agin if i ever go back to hollywood Thanks for a great stay to everyone working there

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good”
Reviews.Author: ktowntravllr
Reviews.Content: The good: Good value for the price. As has been stated before, excellent location. Free parking, wifi, computer terminal with printer, were all great to have (used the printer to print out a map of a park we wanted to go to). The free continental breakfast was plentiful and sufficient - would have preferred if it had started a bit earlier though. Staff were all professional and very pleasant - definitely added to the stay being more relaxed and enjoyable. Room was large and kitchen was fully stocked with all necessary dishes etc. The bad: The pool was had a sign up during our stay that it would not be heated - a bit of a drag because it was warm enough during the day when we were there for a quick dip. The rooms were older and dated (but clean and fine in my opinion for the price we paid) and were sprayed with an obnoxious smelling spray before our arrival. Enjoyed our stay overall, and would consider staying here again. If you want an updated hotel and room then this wouldn't be the place for you, but for a budget priced suite it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Lil-Barthy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 6 nights. The rooms are very big and spacious. They are clean and also very handy have a kitchen. The hotel staff were friendly and polite. The hotel is in a great location right behind Hollywood and Highland Shopping centre - about a 1 minute walk to Hollywood Boulevard. So that was fantastic! The train station is right around the corner as well. The only complaint I had was the walls are thin and if you have noisey people staying next to you like we did in the second half of our stay it is annoying as you hear everything. I complained to the receptionist and I think they must have said something as the people were a bit quieter. Other then that though we would stay again as it is very close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE, GREAT VALUE, GREAT LOCATION.”
Reviews.Author: PaulPauline10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights Oct 14/15,a bit apprehensive before arrival. The staff are very polite,(Thanks to Marlow on the front desk, very helpful and informative) she answered all my 50 questions with great tolerance and patience. Breakfast was fresh and plentiful,get a tray and take your breakfast to the pool or on the roof terrace.Free parking, Free internet and printer, no rush to checkout and let us remain in the carpark.Overall, rooms old but clean and comfortable with all ameneties. If you're thinking of staying here don't hesitate, for the price you pay you won't be dissapointed.At night try the u wink bar in the shopping complex over the road,not expensive and plenty of choice.Thanks to all at the Hollywood Orchid Suites,Paul and Pauline,Manchester ,England.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT , EXELLENT, EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: bigmumma60
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here, it was fantastic, friendly helpful staff, close to everything.The only thing was the shower head in the bath was really high, a bit hard to shower young kids if u have them. Breakfast was great, plenty to go around, free internet, free parking (we didn't use). Got the train one stop $1.25 each way to Universal. Plenty to see on Hollywood Walk of Fame, plenty of places to eat. Easy bus ride to Farmers Market. Go to the CV Pharmacy, cheap, cheap supermarket , they gave us a discount card, so it was even cheaperr lol If & when I get back to Hollywood I will definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: smurfs_in_the_usa
Reviews.Content: Wow this place is a real find... For around $100 we got a room that was more like an apartment! Full kitchen was so handy to be able to cook meals, large bedroom / lounge, free wi-fi internet and a printer for sights vouchers, free parking, a lovely pool and friendly and helpful staff. All located right behind Mann's Chinese Theatre! Yes the decor is older, but the rooms were clean. Can't comment on the breakfast as we did not make use of it. Best value in Hollywood

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: matmanf27
Reviews.Content: just arrived and stayed here for 3 nights. We found the rooms clean, the pool great and the reception staff all very very helpful. my only complaint would be the mattresses need updating. Location is central to so many entertainment options and dining places. Free parking included.our first hotel stay for our holiday and we were not dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “If you're staying in Hollywood, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: c1d
Reviews.Content: Would certainly recommend this hotel to others. Its location is amazing. Right behind Kodak Theatre, it literally only takes 1-2 minutes to walk from your room to Hollwood Boulevard. The hop-on hop-off tourist buses have a stop right near the hotel which again is greatly convenient. If you only need 1 reason to stay here its definitely the location! The service was very friendly and the staff at the front desk are always happy to help. There is a complimentary breakfast served daily which was nice, only problem was it only ran for 2hrs so if you are up early or late you're going to miss it. Hotel also offers complimentary internet which was handy. The rooms themselves were nothing special, a little dated but they were kept clean and they did the job nicely. The airconditioner was quite old and noisy but it did keep the room cold.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, spacious apt style rooms, great value!”
Reviews.Author: travelagentoslo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights, loved the place! Excellent location, right in the middle of Hollywood. Alot of Hollywood's attractions within walking distance, as well as shopping centres, restaurants, cafes, and movie theatres. Free secure garage parking, free internet access, laundy facilities, pool, 24 hour reception, TV, fully equipped kitchen - Hollywood Orchid Suites has it all! Free breakfast with bagels and pastries, tea/coffee and orange juice. Be sure to book free tickets online to the Jimmy Kimmel Show - a 3 min walk, just across from Chinese Mann's theatre. We highly recommend this apartment style motel/hotel! A perfect place for backpackers as well as families or couples who want to stay right in the middle of everything, not spend all their savings, be able to cook ur own food and stay at a place with "everything" included in the price. Look no further, book it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, for all the right reasons”
Reviews.Author: Distant-travla
Reviews.Content: Firstly I'd like to say the staff we dealt with were excellent, very friendly, helpful and nothing was a problem. The location was why we stayed there and to be able to walk out of the hotel and have Hollywood at your feet was amazing but the public transport to get you almost anywhere you wanted to go was excellent, the Metro to Universal, the 217 to the Farmers Market, the 222 right to Warner Bros and all the tour operators along Hollywood Boulevard if you choose to see the stars homes. The pool was great to hop in every night to cool off at the end of each days activities. We feel the breakfast was more than ample and the choice good considering it was advertised as a "Light" breakfast. The laundry was handy and the change machine was good to get fares for bus/train rides. We found the rooms were dated but more than comfortable and being serviced everyday were kept very clean.

Reviews.Title: “great location but very basic”
Reviews.Author: detravellers
Reviews.Content: this hotel was in a great location- close to tourist attractions & Universal Studios. The rooms needed upgrading! They were hot & stuffy but clean. The beds had a plastic covering on the mattress which made it hot & uncomfortable to sleep on. The staff were very friendly & helpful. Breakfast was very basic but the pool was nice to relax in. Good place if you're on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: julie070
Reviews.Content: We booked the Orchid Suites based on the reviews that we read on trip advisor which were quite accurate. Great location, near Hollywood Blvd, Kodak Theater and shopping center with lots of restaurants to choose from. The free parking, nice breakfast and computer with printer were great. The staff were very friendly, accomodating and helpful in particular when we asked to change rooms since we were initally given a suite on the ground floor facing the pool which was very noisy. However, the rooms are a bit shabby and run down with a smell and sliding doors that do not work and is definitely do for a renovation. Do nto expect a 5 star hotel. Also, the older man on duty in the evenings was extremely rude and basically ignored us. We decided to wait until the morning when the "nicer" staff were on duty.

Reviews.Title: “Great everything”
Reviews.Author: Freshjive_Adelaide
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly service, great rates...totally would recommend to anyone going to LA. It is very close to everything, and even to the LA subway system, close to the shops, the supermarket, can't really find anything wrong with this hotel.... two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Crazy33Italy
Reviews.Content: As many have already pointed out, this hotel is the best when it comes to location. It is just a short walk from Hollywood Blvd (there is a small road outside of the hotel that exits directly into the shopping plaza). The hotel is located behind the Kodak theatre. I enjoyed my stay and have no complains at all. The room had a parking lot view but even so it was never noisy. In the end it was better to face that side as it was quiet all the time. Our room had a kitchen that we did not use and fortunately it had a door as the fridge was very noisy. But the room had an odd smellâ€¦ The rooms that face the pool seemed to be very small and one of the rooms had a very very noisy air/con. The air/con system is very old, so are the rooms, but I guess that if all was to be refurbished, it wouldnâ€™t be so cheap anymore. The breakfast was simple but had a good selection. There was also a computer with printer so we could use the internet for free. The hotel staff was so friendly! The lady at the reception in the morning gave us so many great tips! She was really helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location; Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Crube82
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel for 2 nights for a short visit of Hollywood including a visit to the Universal Studios Themepark. If your plans are to see Hollywood and do all the "touristy" stuff, this the perfect hotel for you. Its located just behind the Kodak Theatre and the Hollywood and Highland Shopping Center. Its a 2 Minute walk from the Hotel through a side-entrance of the shopping center and you have everythink you want to see right in front of you: Graumann's Chinese Theatre, Walk of Fame, Hollywood Wax Musem, etc. etc.. The Shopping Center provides diverse possibilities to eat and shop. I can especially recommend the uWink bar, where you can order food and drinks and pay and play casual games on a touchscreen display located on every table and also at the bar. The italian restaurant on the second floor of the shopping center also has some really fine food for reasonable prices. If you want it a bit cheaper almost every fastfood franchise is located directly at the Hollywood Boulevard in front of the shopping center. Finally, if you plan to visit Universal Studios, in the shopping center there is a metro station. The very next station (direction North Hollywood) is Universal City. On the hotel: it has a very nice and clean pool that is not very crowded (it was not when I was there on the weekend in the end of August), hotel staff is very nice and helpful, rooms are ok (big enough but a bit old), there is free WiFi everywhere in the Hotel area and also a public PC including a printer. Finally: book a shuttle to get from LAX to this hotel. Taxis cost a fortune. Regarding which shuttle company to use: I can recommend Karmel Shuttle. I heard some bad things about Super Shuttle so I did not use this one even if it would have been a bit cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Redwitchdiver
Reviews.Content: Good budget hotel, the continental breakfast was ok (better than some places I have stayed) and the pool was nice. The location is absolutely wonderful for Hollywood Boulevard etc and the staff were really helpful. The rooms are a little old fashioned, and could do with a bit of refurbishment as sofa bed was past it's best and the kids slept on th mattress on the floor as they found more comfortable. however, value for money this hotel is great and the location cannot be beaten. And free parking included worth $20 per day at least.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Andrew Sezonov
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights in May 2009. For the price, rooms were very good. Decent size, small kitchenette, good sized bathroom. Rooms are dated but always clean. For tourists that want to see all the Hollywood has to offer this hotel is located superbly. Close to train station (going to Universal or to LA). 3 minute walk to "Walk of Fame" and all the associated tours that leave from Hollywood. Excellent selection of shopping, bars, restaurants. Located with in 1 minute walk to large shooping complex in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Xlnt Hotel for Hollywood and Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: parkinsd
Reviews.Content: We concur with all the positive reviews. We took our two teen-age grandkids to Universal Studios and stayed in a suite with king beds in the living room and bedroom. Easy access to the covered private secure parking. Two TV's and a full kitchen. Short walk to all the funny happenings on Hollywood Blvd near Grauman's Chinese Theater. We walked to Mel's Diner (fun) and Cafe des Artistes (delicious). If we were going back to Universal and/or Hollywood we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lesleyann57
Reviews.Content: Apartment style hotel, with full kitchen, eating area. Spacious bedroom. Furnishings and decor clean but a little dated. Small swimming pool, continental breakfast. Excellent location behind Hollywood Highland Shopping Mall. Subway station very close.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: LentonFamily
Reviews.Content: we had a huge room/ appartment in the orchid suites, pretty basic but a lot of space for the money and it was good to have the kitchen slace. There can't be a better placed hotlein hollywood in ths price range , easy to find, great free parking, good, pool, nice complementary breakfast, very friendly staff and access to a laundry where we could catch up on some washing midway in a long trip! Very fair pricing etc. even then vending machines weren't the usual rip off. Would definately stay here again if in the area. As well as free wireless internet there was a pc and printer available to guests free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “You cannot get a better location... however the room was SO NOISY”
Reviews.Author: Uptownerd
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of fantastic things about this hotel. The most important one, however, is the location. You are seriously 1 street behind Hollywood Boulevard. It takes a short 30 second walk through an alley to get to Hollywood and Highland. Another fantastic thing about the hotel is the free parking. You can securely park your car underneath the hotel which was so handy seeing that you need a car to get around LA. Breakfast is now also included, however when we went there it was always busy and there were no seats to sit at. As we had a kitchen, we just made our breaky anyway. There was also a computer where you could use the internet, you just have to hope that patrons are not inconsiderate and only use it to send an email or to check into their flight.. not to sit on it for an hour and browse (like a few people did). Now for the negatives. Our room was '201' which is RIGHT next to the lift and the breakfast area. It was so noisy it was unbearable. Don't expect to sleep in after 8 because everyone will be banging around. Also don't expect to get to sleep early (9pm) because people were still banging around on the computer or wailing in the reception area. The walls and floors also seem to be paper thin because it sounded as if the people above us were baby elephants (I'm sure they weren't purposely stomping though). We were also next to a really noisy family who would leave their door open and make so much constant noise and slam doors. Also, when they left at 4am one morning, they made sure we heard every suitcase they were dragging around. I had earplugs but I was still constantly woken up. It was so frustrating. So, the location was above fantastic. The rooms were also spacious and a good value for money. However, I would not stay there again if I was put in the room I was because of the noise. I'd request to be put further towards the back of the hotel and away from the reception and breakfast area. I am quite a tolerant person and don't expect much for the money I pay, however it was unbearable and frustrating. (We even called reception once when somebody sitting down there waiting for a taxi was screaming, but they weren't too much help).

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and conveniently located.”
Reviews.Author: nammiesgal
Reviews.Content: The recommendations from travellers on Trip Advisor were accurate. We arrived at this hotel and were not suprised by what greeted us. Totally recommend for travellers on a budget who are only after a room to stay the night. Pros: Large, spacious room (walk-in robe) Conveniently located to subway (next door), Hollywood Walk of Fame, Grauman's Theatre and Shopping Mall (next door). Clean and tidy room and bathroom. PC in common area for web surfing. Very affordable. Cons: Decor outdated. Need renovations to spice up the bathroom and kitchenette. Room we had was a bit noisy around 5am as it was facing the serviceway that was used by delivery trucks that delivered goods to the shopping mall that was next door. Staff a little unhelpful when we asked for directions to Disneyland. We worked it out ourselves anyway.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: luvsthetravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cheap but amazing. It is right behind the Chinese theatre, plenty of public transport. It is friendly, clean and very safe. Great area in Hollywood...free internet, pool and breakfast. I do not have one complaint, you get what you pay for...here you get more for the price. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, cheap and spacious hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scott_Atwell
Reviews.Content: I've got absolutely no complaints about this hotel. Its not much to look at but the customer service was great, the rooms were massive and clean although the decor is about 20 years out of date. The free continental breakfast is a great start to the day and there is a PC with free internet. The location is absolutely ideal for Hollywood being directly behind the Hollywood and Highland Centre with a walkway through to the centre. Also this location is ideal for Universal Studios as its just 1 stop away on the Metro from Hollywood and Highland. Within about 2 or 3 days you'll be bored of Hollywood so unless you've got a car I wouldn't stay around there much longer.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated hotel at good location”
Reviews.Author: peejay_dk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 3 nights late June 2009. We had choosen the hotel based upon the tripadvisor reviews and got pretty much what we expected. The location is great. Free parking, free Internet, pool, simple breakfast and the front deask service was all excellent, with minor issues only. The room however was rather tired, and we slept quite bad on very soft beds. We would probably look somewhere else if we got the chance, but might end up in something worse, or a lot more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location family friendly”
Reviews.Author: buckster1
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel stay in the US, we had tried going through the travel agent but they couldn't find or dint want to find us a hotel that would sleep 2 adults and 3 kids. I bit of research on the net using trip advisor and we located this little gem. Great location close to all the tourist attractions of Hollywood, and easy subway trip to Universal. Staff were very friendly and the included breakfast was good. Pool was good and the kitchen facilities in the room made it easy to cook a meal at 'home'. Would recommend for any family

Reviews.Title: “perfect hollywood location!”
Reviews.Author: m1che
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed for 3 nights during July 09. Check in service was very friendly, pointed us in the right direction for things, surrounding attractions/buildings. Felt very welcomed. We were in room 111 on the first floor, it was a very quiet apartment style room. We were very impressed with the full kitchen after having come from Las Vegas which were shoebox hotel rooms. We shared a super king bed (to try save on cost lol!), the bed was a bit uncomfortable - there was a plastic sheet on the mattress that acts as a protector I suppose, every time you move it makes a lot of noise so if you are a light sleeper this is going to annoy you. Location cannot be beat - just through the back alleyway you hit the Hollywood walk of fame, Kodak Theare etc. We had lots of fun coming out several different times of the day to see which character dress ups we could take pictures with. We found a favourite diner, Johnny Rocket, which is located inside the Hollywood/Highland shopping centre. It was apparently Elvis' favourite burger joint! Burgers are priced from $5 upwards, very handy when you want a quick, cheap meal. The pool is very small, but the hotel is not big so I suppose it is adequate. We had fun just mucking round there. Really appreciated the free breakfast every morning between 8-10am. The area gets quite crowded, there are only 4 sets of tables/chairs so we often took away breakfast in paper bags (provided). Breakfast included croissants, muffins, cakes and coffee/tea. The free internet station is also located in the breakfast area, so using the internet at this time is impossible. Very handy having this free service though - we had just come from hotels that charged $0.50 per minute! Besides the uncomfy bed, I cannot fault this budget hotel. We paid $150 per night (including taxes), we were very happy with this rate as surrounding hotels so close to Hollywood attractions were much more. Just what we were after!

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything”
Reviews.Author: Tranen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights over the independence day weekend. We had 4 rooms, one on first floor, one on second floor, and two on the third floor. All rooms were basic, but clean and everything that was supposed to work was working. The room overlooking the driveway/entrance (301) is not recommended if you are a light sleeper though. Delivery trucks for the nearby shopping mall woke me up in the wee hours every night (think backing up for delivery, beep, beep, beep). However, this was the biggest problem, and I specifically chose that room to let the others sleep in peace. Hotels location is its best asset, within one minute of leaving the lobby you will find yourself in a massive shopping mall with plenty of food alternatives, add one minute and you are on Hollywood boulevard, just in front of the Chinese theater and Michael Jackson's star. We could even walk to Hollywood Bowl, which was about 10-12 mins up the hill, really enjoyed our John Fogerty/LA Phil/Fireworks concert. Breakfast is served from 8AM to 10AM, and it is basic, and free. Internet was VERY good, which is always a good thing. My favorite Hollywood bar, The Power House, is located just 2 minutes walking from the hotel lobby, just go under the taxi stand for the nearby hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat the location.”
Reviews.Author: KFOhio
Reviews.Content: We booked three nights at the Orchid after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor, and the reviews were right on target- great location but outdated rooms. We did not want to rent a car and drive in LA so this location was ideal. We took SuperShuttle from LAX to the hotel ($27 for two of us) and then were able to use public transportation to get us almost everywhere we wanted to go. We took a taxi about four miles to CBS for a taping of the Price is Right and it was about $15 each way, largely due to the traffic. The red line Metro station is right on Hollywood and Highland so we took it to Universal Studios, just one stop away. We also took the red line to Union Station to catch the Amtrak train to take us down to San Diego for a few days. There is a visitor's center in the Hollywood and Highland shopping center and they told us which bus to take if we couldn't take the red line to our destination- like when we wanted to go to Pink's for chili dogs. You really can't beat the loaction- right by the walk of fame and right next to a shopping center. We never felt unsafe walking from the hotel to the shopping center or Hollywood Blvd., even at night. Tour companies operate booths right outside the Hollywood and Highland shopping center, making booking and taking a tour very easy. The room was outdated but we didn't spend much time in it anyway. Our room (211) was pretty quiet because it overlooked a parking lot and not the delivery truck area. There was a small air conditioning unit to cool the entire suite- kitchen, sleeping area and bathroom- so the bathroom and kitchen weren't always very cool The pool is small but was never crowded. The staff at the Orchid were very friendly and helpful as well. They pointed out area attractions, helped with directions and arranged for taxis. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would stay at the Orchid again if we return to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Clean, Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajchi3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night in early June 2009 (a Thursday night). I reserved my stay via email direct with the hotel after reading positive Trip Advisor reviews. Price was US$105+tax, which was just cheaper than the list price, for booking direct. Hotel was literally right out a back entrance of Hollywood and Highland Mall. Great location if you're wanting to base yourself in Hollywood, also relatively quick drive to Beverley Hills/West Hollywood. Car parking was easy, located under hotel and accessed with room key. Basement level also had vending machines for snacks and drinks, and a self serve laundry. Pool was located on ground floor, looked clean, but I didn't swim. My room was on the 3rd floor (elevator service). Room was yes, a little dated, but spacious and comfortable. I had a Junior Room which consisted of 2 queen beds, a small table and chairs, basic kitchenette (with fridge and cooktop), lots of wardrobes and seperate bathroom. Bathroom was clean, had shower over bath, hairdryer, basic toiletries. Only complaint was slight smell in the room (musty/residual smoke) Breakfast facilities were on 2nd floor. Breakfast was tea/coffee, juice, some fruit, muffins, and bagels. Nothing fancy, but a good start for the day. Check in and out was easy. I was very happy with my stay here, it was exactly what I was hoping for. It is basic, so don't expect luxury - but for the price, it's great.
