Personally, I found I'd seen all I wanted to in Hollywood after an hour or so, but if you want to tour attractions or spend lots of time shopping you could fill a day or so.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, great value for L.A.”
Reviews.Author: zazusmom
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here at the beginning of a two week Cali trip. You cannot beat this location for the money. We had a two room suite with two king beds, one in each room. Kind of weird, but it worked for us. There is an apartment type kitchen if you want to go to Ralph's for groceries, but you're on vacation, why cook? We did reheat leftovers and put together sandwiches a couple of times, and bought some fruit to supplement the meager breakfast offered in the lobby. The room itself wasn't beautiful or stylish, and the beds were spongy, but it was clean and safe and had lots of room to move around. Parking is free in the underground garage, but it's a tight squeeze. The best thing about this property is how close it is to Hollywood Blvd., you go out the front door and cross to a breezeway that leads to the center of the Hollywood and Highland Complex. Lots of restaurants and shopping here, and a quick walk to the Walk of Fame and Mann's Chinese Theatre. We went with the camera early in the morning when no one was around and we could explore the imprints in the cement. At dusk it is a scene to behold. It's apparently cleaner than it used to be, and I never felt uncomfortable, but it is still a little seedy in spots. For a great breakfast go to Dukes next to the Whisky a Go Go on Sunset. Really good food and lots of it for not a lot of $$. The Farmer's Market on Fairfax is really fun, good eats there too.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable for location”
Reviews.Author: saveytravelers
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hollywood Orchid Suites for 5 nights back in March and my partner and I really enjoyed our stay. The suites are very close to all major attractions along Hollywood Boulevard and yet a quiet place to retreat to after a busy day of sightseeing. The rooms are spacious, clean and ideal for self catering with a fairly well equipped kitchen in the suites. There is a 'Fresh & Easy' supermarket just a short stroll from the suites which saves you money from having to eat out all the time. The staff are very friendly and helpful and I believe that they now offer a complimentary breakfast which was scheduled to commence soon after us leaving the place. The only negative comment that I have to make is that the building itself is not very soundproof and you can hear your neighbors very easily if they are a bit noisy ( perhaps bring earplugs just in case!) I recommend the Movie Star Home tour but wear something warmish as it is an open roof bus tour. We would definitely stay at the suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable for location and Value for Money!”
Reviews.Author: blueysmum
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel if you aren't too concerned about 5 stars...As others have said, you can't beat the location, the free parking, the size of the rooms, the staff, and the free breakfast was a bonus. Don't expect a modern hotel, but do expect a clean, comfortable stay. I would definitely stay here again, and will recommend without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic location”
Reviews.Author: Dianne51
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and have to say that its a great place to stay, excellent value for money and ideally placed for Hollywood Boulevard, the Chinese Theatre and the walk of fame etc. The rooms are a bit dated but who stays in the room for long?? We had a kitchenette, good bathroom facilities, a tv and two very big beds! Everything worked and there was a pool(no time to use it unfortunately!) free internet and free continental breakfast. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and we would definately recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Centre of Hollywood!!”
Reviews.Author: Ken2Blitzkrieg
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Hollywood Orchid Suites for 15 nights from May 26th ...as a few have already said .. its ideally placed ...right behind the Kodak theatre on hollywood blvd ... and u just walk through the corridor from orchide ave thru the hollywood and highland centre and you are on hollywood blvd right opposite the el capitan theatre and in VERY close walkin space to the Metro station ...(ideal for a quick trip up to universal studios/city walk for a a mere $1.50 each way ) The Hotel comes equipped with a self-laundry room downstairs which also houses a dryer as well .. Parking is FREE and VERY safe .. u need a key to get into the garage from the outside The Staff are all very helpful and friendly (cant do enough tp help ) which is great if u havent been to that area of the world before Very well worth checking out if ya not looking for a ***** place and save some money

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: tik_nat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Orchid Suites for 2 nights in May with my parents (2 bedroom suite). The location is excellent (directly behind the Kodak Theatre) and the service from the from desk was outstanding. The rooms are of the older variety, but they are clean, comfortable, well kept and well equiped.. Highly recommend this young couples or families.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: mirilohr
Reviews.Content: I like this place! Have stayed there now for the second time and would absolutely book it again! You can hardly beat that location! I love to stroll around Hollywood Blvd. at night and enjoy the atmosphere and thatâ€™s no problem, because youâ€™ll still be home in 2 minutes by foot. The rooms are huge and tidy plus we had a kitchen both times we stayed there. The staff is always friendly and helpful. I also love to take a swim in the pool in the morning. I really do like this place :)

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem, great bargain, clean, value property”
Reviews.Author: KatFrazz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is directly behind the Kodak Theatre... you literally walk through a tunnel and are in the shopping center. They offer free parking which is awesome. The continental breakfast is very basic, but that's how they keep the rates low (muffins, bagels, fruit, juice, coffee). The furnishings in the room are a bit dated, but clean... honestly, who comes to LA to hang out in a hotel room? Our room actually had a full kitchen it. They have an outdoor pool, small - but clean. In fact, all I saw them do was clean! The ladies at the front desk all seemed nice and helpful (the one at check-in was especially sweet!). In the room the owner has put together a binder with their recommendations for various types of food, attractions, etc. They even mark the "must sees" and the ones you should do if you have time. A lot of time and effort obviously went into the book, and I found it very helpful. I got the room cheaper on Expedia than the hotel's direct rate. We noticed travelers from all over the world staying here. This hotel is not posh, but... it is definitely the best value you can find and it is clean. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: Cel79
Reviews.Content: Hollywood Orchid Suites was fantastic. It is literally right behind Chinese\Kodak theatre. We stayed 5 nights in a 2 bedroom suite, the rooms are definetly not 5 star BUT they are clean & spacious, they have eveything you need. The staff were extremely helpful, had free internet & breakfast is included!! I looked around for a long time & nothing came close when you were comparing location with the low amount you were paying for the accomodation. Would definetly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “So happy we chose this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joadul
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 and were very happy of our stay at the Orchid Suites. The staff was very helpfull, the location was absolutely perfect, safe area and the room we got was huge and perfect for 5 people! free parking, wifi and breakfast was something we really appreciated a lot. For sure, next time we go to LA, we'll definitively stay again at the Orchid Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Can't get any closer to Hollywood this this!”
Reviews.Author: MolloKobi
Reviews.Content: Wow - talk about location location. Hollywood Orchid Suites is literally a stones throw from the thick of Hollywood - an easy 3min walk to the Hollywood Stars and Chinese theatre - plus the pick up/drop off points for many of the sightseeing tours. Right on the doorstep (well through a small lane) is a shopping centre with restaurants and boutique shops, plus down the road approximately 10mins is two large supermarkets (very handy if your room has the kitchen). You are also a quick 3min walk to the train station. If you want to stay in Hollywood than this hotel is for you! The rooms are comfortable. My only complaints would be the shower - impossible to get a nice flow of warm water and also the positioning of the air conditioner - it is literally touching the second bed in the room and the person in there freezes. Other than that the rooms are nice and clean. Nothing overally fancy. Our room had the small kitchen. The staff was very helpful and would always greet you with a smile. There is a laundry with new washing machines and also some vending machines with VERY cheap Diet Coke ($1.50 for a bottle - BARGAIN!). Free Breakfast, Wi Fi and printing. Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Reviews here are right on”
Reviews.Author: nejmaps
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the good folks here at Trip Advisor, I booked one night at this hotel. I was in town for an event, so I just needed a place to stay. This was a good choice - great location, great price, the free parking and wifi were a big bonus. The room was comfortable and clean - only complaint was a weird smell from the kitchen (which I didn't use, but is a full kitchend that was stocked with whatever you'd need to make a meal). Also, believe the reviews about the noise from the loading docks in the morning. It was very loud. Some of the other guests were a little noisy too. The staff was nice and the breakfast was pretty good - basic but okay. If you're looking for luxury the hotel across the street would do the trick at an extra $200 a night (for instance, the tv was "old school" with only 24 channels - but hey, it had HBO). But if you just need a clean, safe, comfortable place to stay, and you aren't planning on sleeping late, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best overall!”
Reviews.Author: mommywom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because all the reviews were positive. The staff is top notch , as good as a 5 star hotel! Although the location is convenient , we didn't see a single security guard in sight at any time. However , there were plenty of staffers for the Kodak and H&H around. Also that location is as loud as Times Square. The hotel is nicely appointed , best pillows on the planet! We've never had decent pillows anywhere else. The breakfast buffet is wonderful and always replenished up 'til 10a.m.. The kitchenette suites are ideal , there is a grocery nearby(Fresh&Easy). Unfortunately the walls are thin and many guests were quite loud , especially past 10p.m.. Like our 13 y.o. son , children need to be reminded that they are not at home and to be considerate of other guests. We're not planning to return to Hollywood , but I still highly recommend this hotel for travelers going to Hollywood!

Reviews.Title: “Best location and price I could find in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: ReadyToGoMore
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights before returning home from a cruise. Agree with all good things said about location, pool, kitchen. And one not so good, walls a bit thin. Took the bus easily, cheaply. Farmers market good. Walk down from Griffth Observatory at dusk was spectacular !

Reviews.Title: “Not Flash but good location”
Reviews.Author: Ero40
Reviews.Content: For LA this hotel is not badly priced. It's not a bit flash, a bit like a older motel. It's in a great location right behind the Kodak Theatre, and near where all the tours go from. There is a small shopping area here and a food court. Perfect location. We only had one night in central LA and this place was perfect. Remember the decor is old and very very tired, but it;s clean and it's very safe and you can not and I mean can not beat the location!!

Reviews.Title: “couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: dianneon2
Reviews.Content: Let me join the parade of reviewers who enjoyed their stay ay the Orchid Suites Hotel. I won't repeat all the pluses but would add that the feel of the place is more like a Bed and Breakfast with the benefit of privacy and lots of room. The staff were so personable and helpful, acknowledged us when we came in but were not all intrusive. All had helpful suggestions. In retrospect , I wish that we had stayed there for 2 more nights instead of moving over to the Hilton Universal . With the Metro being so close to Orchid Suites and only a 5 minute ride away from Universal, we could have done it easily and much cheaper. I'd have no hesitation recommending this hotel to anyone who is looking for comfort, space , convenience with no pretentions of being a 5 star hotel. Only downside is that it can be noisy in early morning with delivery trucks etc. ,but the bed was so comfy I didn't have any trouble getting back to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service Great Room, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: AussieOzOz
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hollywood Orchid Suites EXECUTIVE SUITE room, the room was perfect for two people, it even had a full size kitchen, which was great when you want a quick snack or a cup of tea! The rooms were clean and great value for money. There was a group of us, so we had about 4 rooms all together, everyone enjoyed their stay at Hollywood Orchid Suites, and loved the fact that there was a kitchen. The service was fantastic and the staff were very helpful. There was a computer (on the second level i think) with free internet access, which was handy. The location was great directly behind HOLLYWOOD & HIGHLAND shopping centre and Kodak theatre. Just walk through the HOLLYWOOD & HIGHLAND shopping centre (a 2 minute walk, not even) and your at hollywood blvd. It may not be 5 star luxury, but id definantely stay here again, its GREAT LOCATION, GREAT SERVICE, GREAT ROOM, GREAT VALUE, is definantely worth visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best value hotel in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: lizzybear
Reviews.Content: I booked a 4 night stay here for me and my boyfriend (as part of a longer west coast trip) on the strength of the great reviews here on Tripadvisor and I wasn't disappointed. I honestly don't think you could find a better value hotel in this area: A good sized room with a kitchen, included secure parking and a great location for exploring Hollywood and beyond. Just to point out: This is an older property and the interior is a bit dated compared to many other hotels but I would imagine this is part of what keeps the rates low and we thought it gave the place character, if you want a cookie cutter Holiday Inn type of place then look elsewhere! Also, it's behind a shopping mall so truck/road noise is inevitable, may be advisable to bring earplugs if this would bother you.

Reviews.Title: “Not a disappointment...”
Reviews.Author: CGTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this past weekend, March 13th through 15th. We had read the reviews and had high expectations as far as location of hotel and friendliness of the front desk. Neither disappointed. The folks working the front desk are amazingly nice and welcoming - they literally go out of their way to see that you know where you are going and how to get there. I don't think I've ever stayed anywhere where the front desk was that nice. We reserved a 2 King Executive Suite and we were very happy with the size and the price. Not to mention the fact that we had a full kitchen, tons of closet space, and a dining room table that seated four which made it handy for meals brought in. The hotel is an older property, so it's not the Sheraton by any means. But we were really only using it for a launching point to take our kids to Universal Studios and to see the sights of Hollywood, so we didn't need a lot of frills to get by. And the room was exceptionally neat and clean. The carpets could maybe be replaced or get a good scrubbing and I know that grosses some people out. I took socks, because I'm one of those people that can get grossed out, and simply used them to walk around in after showers, etc. But I have to stress that besides that, the room was spotless. It even smelled good, which is some kind of modern day hotel miracle in iteself. The beds are ok, nothing is ever as good as what's left at home, but the kids slept soundly. Our bed was little soft, so that caused some slight backaches, but nothing we didn't get over quickly with a little moving around and stretching. Our suite was nice because the kids had their bed in what would have been a front room in a 1 bed suite, and we had a bedroom to ourselves. It's always nice to have that privacy and quiet. The bathroom was just an average bathroom with a tub/shower combo and toilet. The sink and mirror were located outside the "wet room". My husband was so happy because at 6'3" he could fit under the shower spigot. Towelse were thick and fluffy and didn't have that weird "washed in old bleach" smell to them. Our bedroom had a full closet with sliding mirrored doors, and a small entertainment center/dresser. There was also a large coat closet in the hallway and another closet with sliding mirrored doors in same hallway that had shelves for storing shoes, pants, etc. We were all able to hang or put away our gear and leave an uncluttered room which was nice. We did not eat the continental breakfast, although my kids snuck a bagel the 2nd morning we were there. We ate out at the Bob's Big Boy in Burbank (best restaurant every IMHO). We did not use the laundry facilites. The parking in free and subterranean. We have a 2WD Ford Expedition and it barely fit under the gate - if your driving anything taller that 6'4" you can forget parking there. The only real gripes I would have is that the A/C units in both rooms did not blow true cold air. It was chilly when we were there, but with four people taking showers would get humid and hot in the room. My husband figured out that if we opened the bathroom widow it sucked all that humidity right out of there. Once we got that figured out, it was so nice and cool in our room we didn't need the a/c - but I would be concerned about the temp in the summertime. Also, the tv in the front room/kids room had a short or something and would turn off and on. You had to do some kind of voodoo ceremony over the remote to get it to stay on. It was great entertainment for my kids who decided the tv was haunted - so thank goodness for kids with a good sense of humor! We bought tickets for Universal there and got a $10 discount off the price we were going to pay online. So we saved $40 on those alone. And, just as an aside, we'd read on the forums that Universal was a 1/2 day trip. Well, none of us had every been there and it took us from open to close to see and do everything we wanted to. So just a word of warning for other Universal virgins, it's not quite as easy on time as some might think. All in all, we were very pleased with the hotel. The location could not be beat. The hotel is directly behind Graumann's Chinese Theater and it's a hop, skip, and jump through the Hollywood and Highland mall and the Kodak Theatre to get to Hollywood Blvd and the walk of fame. Once you hit Hollywood Blvd., you are directly across the street from the Jimmy Kimmel Live show, the El Capitan Theatre (plays all Disney movies), and the Roosevelt Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favour! Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Ularu
Reviews.Content: I can't speak highly enough about this hotel, great location only steps from the best part of Hollywood Blvd. Graumans Chinese Theatre , Hollywood and Highland , all the popular entertainment museums ,cinemas,restaurants and the Metro are a VERY short walk away. My family and I stayed at the the close-by Hollywood Celebrity Hotel & the Liberty Hotel on previous holidays before discovering The Orchid Suites but they are not a patch on this place! Parking is free and the staff are all super friendly and helpful. It must sound like I have shares in this place, but believe me, do yourself a favour and try it out. The rooms are huge and well appointed, kitchen, a safe and good size bathrooms. Rates are sensational $79 (off season) for a junior suite and they upgraded me to a much larger suite with a big private courtyard! My wife and kids have always felt safe and secure here and we will be back again, hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “We JUST LOVED The Orchid Suites!”
Reviews.Author: Blgspc
Reviews.Content: It's Right in the middle of Hollywood! Only steps away from the Walk Of Fame and Grauman's Chinese and the Kodak Theater is even closer. It's older but squeaky clean. Everyone on staff there were quite helpful! The location, price were perfect! Room was comfortable. There was a full kitchen, dining area for 4, two queen size beds in the room we stayed in and there is a safe in every room-electronic and you set the entry code! I really wouldn't stay any where else if I were to return to LA!!!! It's simple, comfortable and the best location if you want to enjoy all that Hollywood has to offer. There is a guest computer on the second floor available, if you need it. If you're looking for 'Posh', 'trendy', 'high-end' and high dollar then you will need to look else where.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: katykiwi
Reviews.Content: Like a previous reviewer said it took all of 20 sec to hit the H/H Mall a shoppers heaven and then down the stairs and next thing you know you are cruising Hollywood Blvd. The Location can't be beat. Staff were really helpful. Our room was tucked down the back passageway - dark room, but nice and quiet. The Pool was lovely to relax in after taking in the sights. Subway really handy and used this heaps. We still talk of Hollywood it was such fun with the characters getting right into it and chasing my daughter down the street. Seen Pussycat Dolls perform live in the Mall and even managed to get them to sign daughter's CD. What a highlight. Would definitely encourage anyone looking for accommodation to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault!”
Reviews.Author: carmen88
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the absolute BEST location in Hollywood - it is off the main drag of Hollywood Bvld, tucked directly behind Kodak Theatre and the Hollywood & Highland Centre. At night time we would walk the whole 20 seconds to the Hollywood & Highland Centre to do some shopping, or walk through the H&H Centre straight out into the middle of Hollywood Blvd - smack bang in the middle of all the action! Don't be put off by the fact that it is behind the H&H Centre. There were security always staffed at the back of the Centre, so walking there at night was not an issue at all. We stayed in an Executive Suite for 4 nights. The room was HUGE! Our room was 227 if I remember correctly. The king size bed was very comfy! The room had two chairs and a table in the bedroom, with a perfectly working TV. The kitchen and kitchen table were in a separate room which could be closed off with a door. The kitchen had plenty of utensils, pots, pans, glasses along with an oven, full sized fridge, toaster oven, microwave etc. There was a large wardrobe to hang your clothes and put your suitcase. The safe is located in that cupboard. The bathroom was very clean and had everything that you needed. Not the largest bathroom, but large enough for its purpose. Very well lit. Housekeeping staff were excellent. The front desk staff were lovely. We were offered fruit on our arrival. Check in and check out was quick and easy. All in all, I am very glad that I chose the Hollywood Orchid Suites. It is Hollywood's best kept secret! If i ever went back to Hollywood, I would definitely be staying there again! Some reviewers have complained that it is outdated and in need of renovations. I found that while yes, the bed spread and carpet was a little unfashionable now, the rooms are not run down or anything, and are very well looked after. So, yes they are perhaps a little bit 90s style, but the rooms are well looked after. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone, but in particular those after value for money, who aren't put off by an "out of date bedspread", and who don't want to skimp on quality, cleanliness and safety. You simply cannot beat the value, loaction and service of Hollywood Orchid Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Accomodations....”
Reviews.Author: fletch182
Reviews.Content: We were very fortunate to walk in with a roomsaver.com coupon and have it honored. The front desk assistant was very friendly and accomodating. We were provided with a double-bed room on the third floor in the back. The room had a kitchenette (refrigerator, sink, two burner stove top & a few dishes). The room was clean - no odor, older furninshings but adequate. Good size room with two double beds (not queen) & two closets. The beds were comfortable and the sheets were clean. The bathroom had a shower/tub combination. The shower head did not provide the best water pressure and the tub did not have a stopper. As stated previously, in other reviews, no breakfast is provided but there are several restaurants nearby (the front desk can provide a map). The hotel does have a pool which looked very clean, we did not use it during our stay. The free parking is an added benefit in this close in location. I attempted to access the wi-fi without success. The location is excellent and convenient to Hollywood attractions. The metro is located just a block away at the Hollywood/Highland complex. I was very disappointed with the housekeeping. They do not get around to cleaning rooms until early evening (5 pm or so). This puts a damper on preparing for evening events.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location”
Reviews.Author: PABee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orchid Suites for four nights, starting New Years Eve '08. It completely met our needs for a budget hotel. The lobby was a bit shabby, but our room was spacious and very clean. Its close proximity to an elegant mall led to some noise at night and in the morning, but this paled beside the incredible convenience of having shopping and multiple excellent restaurants (not to mention Grauman's theatre and its stars' hand prints) only a two minute walk away. Orchid Suites is also very close to a subway stop, which made it possible to take rapid transit New Years morning to the Rose Parade in Pasadena. Staff were generally very polite and helpful (except for one evening clerk who appeared depressed and never cracked a smile). One caveat: our room was on the second floor overlooking the lobby, and the aforementioned clerk's cigarette smoke filtered into our room unless we opened the door to a nearby breezeway. These drawbacks were minor, considering the many positives: free parking, incredible location, comfort, cleanliness. I would strongly recommend the Orchid Suites for families, but we, as a 60+ year old couple, were also very well served.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't even stay here for a night. This place is terrible.”
Reviews.Author: edge99
Reviews.Content: My mother booked this hotel for their first time visit here in the US. The only room available for 4 people is a smoking room which cost $140+/night. We really didn't care if it was smoking or non-smoking since a room is a room, as long as it's clean then it should be ok, right? We we're very much mistaken, the moment we entered the room I almost wanted to vomit because of the stench of the place. Not to brag, but I do quite a bit of travelling myself, and I know what a decent hotel room looks like, this place is just absolutely ghastly. So I got on my computer and I immediately checked out the nearby hotels thru hotwire, thank God I found a room at Westin with 2 beds for 4 people that costs $89/night. Can you believe it? So we called the frontdesk and asked the lady to just cancel our reservation. When asked why, I politely told her that the place simply wasn't right and I found a different hotel to stay for the night. She was rude and nagged about how we we're spending money at their hotel and we wouldn't even use it. I was just thinking in my head that THIS PLACE IS SO BAD THAT I WAS WILLING TO PAY HER GOOD MONEY JUST TO GET US OUT OF THERE. Save yourself a headache and a few bucks, get a room from one of those hotel booking sites and get a deal unlike this one. This place is simply terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Living in Hollywood with an affordable cost”
Reviews.Author: smcwai
Reviews.Content: It is my first time to write a review for a hotel accomodation. We have been searching for a hotel accomodation in LA for almost a month. Most of them is either too expensive or too far from any attractions. Orchid Suites is located just behind Kodak Theatre and several minutes walking distance from Metro in Hollywood Highland. I can plan to have a couple of days without renting a car (visiting Hollywood areas and Universal Studios). The room condition is clean but the furnitures are old (Don't expect it is a luxry hotel). I am satisfied with it because it comes with fully-equipped kitchen (with Microwave and Oven). However, I found that the kitchen is a bit smelly but you can close the kitchen door to prevent the smell goes into the room. In LA, you cannot go further without a car. We rented a car for a longer distance travelled and the hotel provides free underground parking which is another advantage over some other hotel in Hollywood. Other merit points including free in-room wifi access, in-room safe and washing machine. For the room rate at around $110 plus tax, I need not ask for more during my stay in the hotel. Finally, one tip for other travellers is to bring your own shower gel as they only provide soap.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Oz_BigTravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four days from Thanksgiving. We selected it based on the reviews on this site but were very disappointed. The price is OK but the rooms were not what we thought we were getting. We had booked a suite as we were travelling with our two teenage sons. The suite is actually only one bedroom with the second bed in the lounge/kitchen area. We asked for a rollaway bed (as the boys are unwilling to share a bed) and were assured that it wouldn't be too cramped. We found that it was very cramped. The kitchen was very small and did not have a dishwasher and there were no tea towels to dry things. The oven seals kept falling off the moment the oven was heated and the oven door did not fully close. There were no dishes in which you could put leftover food. We were given one room but the moment we walked in we could smell urine so asked to be moved to another room, which the staff did. The carpet on the floor was dirty (as mentioned in another review). Staff did not come in to clean the rooms until around 5pm which meant that we had already arrived back from being out all day and were getting ready for the night's activities. Getting luggage to the room was difficult. One alternative is to carry them up to the third floor or use the lift. The lift is only accessible from the road via the garage. The garage is locked and had to be opened for us and the lift is extremely small so only 1 large suitcase (we had 4 in total and carry ons as we had been travelling round the world for the previous 6 weeks) would fit in, meaning a number of trips had to be taken to bring all of the luggage up. The staff were courteous and the location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: chicanabella
Reviews.Content: Husband and I (mid 30s) stayed here for 2 nights Sat Dec 6 and Sun Dec 7 to be close to Universal Studios (1 metro stop away, though we didn't feel safe in the metro subway at 8.30am on a Sunday morning - very quite and isolated and shady in-your-face characters try to get money from you for 'helping' you to use the automated ticket machines and 'kings of the metro' who harrass single and groups of women ... take a cab instead) and the Warner Bros Studio Tour (completely brilliant - just do it!). Hotel staff were extremely helpful and accommodated our request for a quiet room away from the pool area. Unfortunately on Morning One, our shower didn't work properly and water just spurted everywhere all over the bathroom floor. The conceirge came up and said there was a knob missing. He gave us a key to shower in a room on the next floor up. This was inconvenient, but our shower was fixed by the time we returned from Universal Studios later that day. The room upstairs was much nicer and better updated than our room, and while he offered us an exchange of rooms, we prefer not to move once we've settled as we're already staying in 5 hotels during a 3 week stay. Providing we can get some sleep, we can cope with any other little inconveniences. No breakfast was provided, but go to the Fresh and Easy supermarket a few blocks up the road for supplies to make your own breakfast / other meals (the frozen vegetarian selection is outstanding!) The best thing we did in Hollywood was take the Kodak Theatre tour which is right next door. When you are standing on the front steps of the Orchid Suites, look up on your immediate right and see a long glass corridor with yellow paint underneath. That's where the Oscar winners walk past the photos of previous winners after coming off stage to do their press interviews. This tour was the entertainment highlight of our whole 3 week trip to the US (especially walking out onto the stage itself, then taking Johnny Depp's front row centre seat while learning more about the theatre and Oscars ceremonies).This hotel is definitely not the Ritz, but you coudn't get any closer Grauman's Chinese Theatre (we missed the tour there but bought tickets to see a film inside), the sidewalk stars (not the dodgy fakes dressed up as stars who charge you to take their photos!) and the celebrity hand and footprints. The UWink restaurant in the Hollywood and Highlands centre is a bit of fun for a meal (except when 40 drunk male and female 'Santas' arrive right after you've placed your order on the computer screen on your table and get even more drunk while you wait for your meal!) The Orchid Suites staff were happy to mind our luggage after check-out until our LuxBus came to take us to Anaheim. We can't imagine staying anywhere else during a short, low budget stay in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: wspatsy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchid Suites for 4 nights in December 2008..the location is amazing! You can't get much closer to the centre of things, and for us this was perfect. You literally walk round the corner to the metro, restaurants, the Chinese theatre, etc etc. The rooms are not the most modern, and probably a bit old-fashioned, but extremely clean. Our room was fortunately at the back, as I think the front rooms can be noisy. The staff on reception are fantastic - friendly, helpful, and efficient as well. They got tickets for us, booked a transfer, told us the way to places . . . what more do you want?

Reviews.Title: “travelers rest”
Reviews.Author: barneysail
Reviews.Content: this apartment style is extremly good value helpful staff good rooms and fresh air this unit very clean and tidy great location with train on backdoorstep barney cahill new zealand

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you want to see Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: MikeHoustonTexas
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at Hollywood Orchid Suites. The location is great: one block off Hollywood Blvd and right behind the Mann Chinese theater. So if you are into the Walk of Fame and the Mann celebrity imprints, its for you. When we went to Universal we took the metro where there is also a station also right around the corner. (By the way, Universal is nothing special). You can also get the metro from/to Airport. People at the front desk were very nice. They put us in room 201 the first night and even though the hotel is on a dead end street, the room is right over the garage and you could here the entry gate go up and down for every car that came/left. And the room is right in the elevator corridor so you can hear every conversation going in and out of the elevator. Adam (I think was his name) at the front desk was very gracious and changed our room to one in the back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Private”
Reviews.Author: maddierose
Reviews.Content: Me and a girl friend stayed at the Hollywood Orchid Suites for 3 nights, December 1- December 4. Booked the stay based on the reviews on Trip Advisor. We wanted somewhere that was close to the main tourist-style attractions, and with easy access to Universal Studios. Our room was a king executive suite, which had it's own bathroom, kitchen and dining area. The most important thing was that the room was clean. The sheets and towels were fresh. Our room was not facing the pool, or on the balcony, but around the corner, facing a car park behind the hotel. This felt far more private, as no one would be walking past us to access their rooms. The safe was a helpful addition to the room, but quite small, which was a downside as we were traveling with a laptop computer. The hotel is located conveniently just behind Hollywood Boulevard and the Kodak Theatre. Tucked away in a private street along with other hotels like the Liberty and Hollywood Celebrity, it is just on the end right behind the Hollywood and Highland Shopping Mall. There was easy and convenient access to the centre at a 1 minute walk. The mall backed right on to Hollywood Boulevard and the Walk of Fame. The mall was useful for places to eat, but we found it tiresome and limited in terms of options. We could not find anywhere that served breakfast, which was very disappointing. We often skipped breakfast altogether because of this. Universal Studios was easily accessed through the Metro station which is underneath the Mall, and people looking to visit the main tourist attractions will be pleased with the location. It's also close the the Hollywood museum, and the Hollywood Wax Museum. The one problem we found with this hotel was that the day we arrived, there were some MAJOR construction works going on next door, on the Mall. Massive drilling noises were VERY intrusive and trying to sleep after a long international flight was near impossible. We weren't warned about this in advance, or when we checked in. The construction was still in process when we checked out. This didn't go on during the evening or early morning, but if you wish to sleep in or have a sleep during the day, you might find it annoying. Overall, though, we found our stay a pleasant experience with no problems. The staff were helpful, by arranging us a cab and letting us know where the major attractions were, and how to access them. Highly recommended if you are on a budget and need somewhere to stay in the heart of Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: AZTrainer
Reviews.Content: I was in LA for 4 days on business. Downtown hotels were booked so I stayed here and took the metro into downtown. The suites are large and the location is great. Plenty of restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: 85hoya
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a trip to LA that included 3 nights at the Orchid Suites. I couldn't be happier with the room, rate, location and staff. Everything in the room - one BR plus kitchen and living room - was clean and comfortable and the location can't be beat. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling on business as well as families looking for a convenient base while seeing the sights of Hollywood and west LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but.........”
Reviews.Author: stanthecaddy
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel due to it's proximity to Hollywood Blvd. However, after our first night there, we realised there wasn't much going on and we would have been better staying in West Hollywood, Downtown LA or Santa Monica. The hotel itself is perfect for people on a budget and the rooms are clean and tidy. Having the Hollywood & Highland Centre a minute's walk away is perfect for dining, shopping, etc. Also, the club at the top is pretty cool. Metro line is 3 minutes walk. Easy to use as well.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem In Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Eveleyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 3 children ages 10-16 and the location and price cannot be beaten. The rooms are not the most up-to-date but our room was quiet, the staff were extremely helpful and courteous and the free parking a bonus. if you are looking for great value in a great location this is the place. If you want 5 stars you may be disappointed but if, like us, you need a place to stop after a busy day this is great value for money and my husband is already planning his trip back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: angelina_alix
Reviews.Content: Great location for Hollywood Boulevard and shopping. Universal studios a short drive away. Large, clean rooms. Helpful reception. Perfect location for exploring Hollywood. Free car park.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price for the Location!”
Reviews.Author: livegoodCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently after reviewing all the reviews of this hotel posted here on tripadvisor. We were not disappointed. The room was large, clean, had free coffee, mini fridge. The hotel also had free internet access on their computer located on the second floor. Laundry facilities are also available at this hotel and we also liked the fact that the hotel had a security system in place and the parking garage was locked and only hotel patrons had access to it and the parking was free. It is literally two minute walk from the Chinese Theatre and Walk of Fame. In fact I am considering going there again to take my elderly mother there as she will be able to get around and not have to walk far. It is in a superb location. Also we found the staff to be very friendly. The hotel is smaller and has a very cozy warm feeling. We plan to stay there again on our next trip to LA!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: BillericayBaz
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, just a couple of minutes walk from Hollywood Boulevard and within easy reach of other great attractions. Short Drive to Universal Studios. Accommodation was very good. We didn't cater for ourselves as good restaurants and coffee shops close by. But the facilities were good enough had we have wanted to.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore Hollywood and beyond”
Reviews.Author: storm44
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located just a short walk from Hollywood Boulevard and places of interest such as the Kodak Theatre, Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel, and Hollywood Walk of Fame. You can catch a tour bus from the Kodak Theatre which takes you along Rodeo Drive, Sunset Boulevard, through Beverley Hills and up to Universal Studios. The hotel staff are friendly, we purchased tickets to Universal Studios through the hotel and got money off. The rooms are clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for LA”
Reviews.Author: anmelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood Orchid suites with another couple. Shared a 1BR suite with 2 King beds. One bed was in separate bedroom and another in the lounge. All in all very very comfortable. Rooms are basic and decor is dated, however it was spotlessly clean and the amenity of the kitchen was handy. Free internet also a plus, as many places in the USA seem to charge a great deal for internet usage. There was also free parking. The location is handy, right behind the Hollywood & Highland mall. There's a pool, although we didnt use it. LA is a city you really need a car to get around as it's vast and there's no "centre" to speak of. Overall, and particularly for the price, I thought this was an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: heowa
Reviews.Content: Great place.Great location.courteous staff.Exellent value for money! me and my wife stayd there for two weeks in executive suite and liked it a lot.It was great to have full kitchen to use.Dont have to eat out all the time.We have only good things to say about it and recommend it to everybody that likes good clean reasonable priced room.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: Sheila1964
Reviews.Content: We had 4 nights at the Orchid Suites and you cannot fault their location. As everyone here says - minutes to Hollywood Blvd and Mann's Chinese Theatre and a shopping mall which is OK in terms of shops and has restaurants and takeaways close to hand. We had a double king bed suite which was clean and served its purpose. The suites are a bit tired looking and a coat of paint would work wonders but for facilities - full kitchen, bathroom with good shower, plenty of hanging and drawer space, dining area plus patio with sunbeds - you could not do better for the money. Its location is ideal for seeing the sights of Hollywood, Beverley Hills, Santa Monica & Venice beaches and we even went to Manhattan Beach - superb beach (thoroughly recommended) south of LAX. Despite the tired look of the suite the towels were lovely and obviously new (evidenced by the white fluff we carried on us for days!). I'm not sure I'd recommend Hollywood Blvd at night on foot. We went to the McD's across the road and it didn't feel particularly safe to me. Too many homeless and hustlers around! The reception staff were very helpful. One fun bit for us was the underground parking spaces all had stars' names so we tried to park in our favourite actors' spaces! Paul Newman was taken while we were there (days after his death)! The parking is very secure with key required to access and later at night the key is also required to access the lift. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “perfect position”
Reviews.Author: aussie1Sydney
Reviews.Content: As all the reviews state, this hotel is in a perfect position to be able to walk to the main strip. The fact that it had a kitchen was perfect for the family as we were all sick of eating out after spending a week in Disneyland. There was a big supermarket ( Fresh and Easy I think it was called) on the main drag where fresh meat, vegetables and fruit could be purchased. The room itself was quite spacious - it also had a safe which was handy. The pool was well maintained and perfect for a dip after a day out and about. They also provided free internet access on a computer located on the 2nd floor which was great for checking e-mails, getting directions, booking tours etc. The free parking was also a bonus, as was the laundry that was resonably priced. All the staff were pleasant and the service people did a great job cleaning the rooms every day. Just a tip - do not get sucked into doing a tour of the homes of the stars. They are overpriced and you really don't see anything!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: angwri
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just steps from Hollywood Boulevard, but amazingly quiet. My room overlooked an apartment block, which meant the view was not great, but there was no noise from the shopping centre. As previous reviews state, the place is a little tired, but that can so easily be overlooked with all the advantages. The place is beautifully clean with a pleasant pool and roof terrace. The rooms are very well equipped. There are two double beds, iron/board, hotplate, fridge, coffeemaker, cutlery/crockery, roomsafe, TV, clock/radio and hairdryer. There were always loads of coffee, sugar & creamer. Buying a few basic supplies made it very easy to prepare breakfast in the room There is a huge double mirrored wardrobe and very clean bathroom with bath & shower. I had a small problem with the bath plug & maintenace came to repair it within minutes of reporting it to reception. Very slight negative were the very thin dividing walls meaning next door conversations could be overheard. The hotel is a few yards from the subway & the Hollywood & Highland shopping centre. Also many tours leave from the front of Grauman's Chinese theatre, making very convenient. This is a well located, reasonably priced hotel & I would recommend it for a visit to Hollywood

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great Location”
Reviews.Author: Chapas77
Reviews.Content: Stayyed at the Hollywood Orchid Suites for a couple of nights. From the outside it just looks like a normal building once you got in it was nice. The room was huge with a seperate Kitchen and dining area didnt really use the kitchen much apart from putting some beer in the fridge but it looked like it all worked ok. The pool looked nice but again I didnt use it as was a short stay. Bit of noise acouple of nights as the walls seem thick but the noise ssems to travel through the doors but it soon went away. The best thing about this plae is the Location right at the side of the Hollywood and Highland centre which leads on the walk of fame where there is plenty to see and and places to eat. The staff were helpful when had a couple of questions and handed out leaflets with nearst places to eat, cinema times ect. when I had quesions of how to get to Universal Studios the guy worked there told me how to get there and back. noc harge for leaving luggage eithier. All in all good place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: teba18
Reviews.Content: This place is all about location - if you want to stay somewhere totally central within minutes of the walk of fame, Kodak theatre etc. then this is the place. Yes, it's a bit dated, and maybe a bit noisy but it's in the centre of Hollywood, it's clean, spacious, with a pool, secure parking and free wifi. We had a suite with 2 king beds - one in an 'almost' separate bedroom - with kitchen area. We loved that as it meant we didn't have to go out to find breakfast - by this time we were a bit fed up of pancakes & maple syrup! Eat at Trastevere in Hollywood & Highland, just round the corner - a fantastic Italian!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location And Good Secure Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rplusr
Reviews.Content: We have just completed a 4 night stay here and were quite impressed with the hotel. As most of the reviews state the location is perfect right behind Kodak Theatre, Mannâ€™s Chinese Theatre & Hollywood & Highland Mall. Whilst the hotel is not brand new, of course if you do your research you already know that before you book, the price is reasonable and it is in this brilliant location. We had arrived into LA early that morning and after picking up our rental car and doing some sightseeing we arrived at the hotel a couple of hours before check in. They allowed us to park in the carpark and we had a look through the Mall until our room was ready. Our room was very large with 2 armchairs, a separate hallway lead to a large wardrobe and down to the bathroom and there was a separate kitchen with dining table so we were able to have breakfast in the morning before going out. The room was also very clean and there was a courtyard off the main area if you wanted to sit outside or you can also sit at tables near the pool area. There is also free Wi-Fi internet as well. My partner and I would certainly recommend this hotel and should we return to LA in the future we would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Buddy74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and had a great stay. We choose this hotel for a number of reasons including price, kitchen facilities, parking availability and great location. We arrived around check-in time and had no problems. The room was large with seperate kitchen and hallway to the bathroom. It was great to stay at a place that had secure parking at no extra charge. There is also a laundry at the hotel which we used without any hassle. Internet is provided in a small lobby area on level two of the hotel as well. The location is excellent.... only a 2 minute walk to Hollywood Bvld, the subway etc. As stated in other reviews the rooms are a bit dated but all in all for a value for money stay in the heart of Hollywood you can't go past a stay at the Hollywood Orchid Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK.”
Reviews.Author: Jose2006
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a nice bargain for the location and room amenities. Located in the middle of Hollywood, is a 3 start property with a 4 start service. Front desk is extremely helpful, and provide you with many attractions information as soon as you check in. Room is what you expect in a studio apartment. However, donâ€™t expect a fancy room. Just a nice place to relax. Pool is small, but great. Many dinner options within walking distance. Metro is just 3 minute walk. My only complaint is the noise during the morning due to the trucks loading/unloading process at the mall. Ask for an inside room, not one that face the street. If you are looking for great location and a nice place to relax after a long day, this hotel is a strong option.

Reviews.Title: “Not For Me”
Reviews.Author: msar1076
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night in July. One night was plenty. We got there early and was told that we couldn't check in because the room wasn't ready. We could park there though which was good for us. The parking is under the hotel and is accessed only by a locked gate. The whole place has locks everywhere. Locks to the garage, locks to the front desk, locks to the stairwells. I wonder how bad it is that they have to lock everything? We walked over to Hollywood and Highland which looks like a new outdoor mall. Very nice place. Within minutes of the hotel. We then walked Hollywood Blvd. Went back to the hotel and was told we could check in. Went to our room only to find cleaning ladies still there. They rushed out of there. They only left two towels for four people. I had to go find them to get more towels. Room was just okay. It was really big but very outdated. It had a weird smell. The bed was extremely uncomfortable. Very lumpy, terrible. Room was as clean as it could be for a very old place. The pool was very clean although we didn't use it. The worst part about the whole thing is at 5:30 am you feel like you're at a freight terminal. You're right behind the mall so you hear trucks backing up making deliveries. Unloading of the trucks and trucks ideling while waiting to unload. The whole hotel was up by then or so it seemed. This place is alright for one night but IMO I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Uktraveller84
Reviews.Content: We are so glad that we chose this hotel as it was perfect for our 4 day stay in LA. Great location just behind the Kodak theatre with easy access through the Hollywood Highland centre to Hollywood Boulavard and access to transit at Hollywood/Highland We found the hotel on Google Earth and had checked the Tripadvisor reviews so we were fairly sure it would be good. However we thought it was perfect, the price was good, it had a pool and we liked staying in the apartments so that we didn't have to eat out all the time. It is an old hotel so a bit worn but very clean and great service/advice fo first time LA visitors. They have useful sheets that list local restaurants (we recommend Mel's Diner) and we ordered in Chinese with menus provided by reception. Free wifi was also perfect. Don't listen to the locals who say you cannot survive in LA without a car! We used www.metro.net and took buses to Venice Beach, took the underground rail to downtown and Universal Studios all for fraction of price of taxi and just as fast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joanne1968
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my cousin we went to LA alot and we always stayed at this hotel it is clean and very big and the pool was great and it is near everything. I am gona go back and take my daughter.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel, but what a great location!”
Reviews.Author: DutchDiverGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood Orchid Suites for three days. We could park our rental car in the underground parking of the hotel, which was very convenient. The building looks quite dated, as does the lobby, but the lady at the front desk was very friendly. The room was large and it had a separate fully equiped kitchen with a dining table. The funiture and drapes were clean, but not very modern. In the kitchen there was an unpleasant smell, of which we have not been able to determine the cause. The reason we chose this hotel was the location, in the center of Hollywood, right behind the Kodak Theather. It proved to be a good choice. There are plenty of eateries nearby and after catching a movie at the Man Chinese Theater, it is only a five minute stroll to your bed. If you're not looking for a very modern hotel, but want your hotel to be in a top location, chose the Hollywood Orchid Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Orchid fit the bill!”
Reviews.Author: BingySeattle
Reviews.Content: This motel is an old apartment complex made over into a suites hotel. Key word is old! Although the property could stand with some major updating I would stay there again in a New York minute! The location was absolutely outstanding, the staff was very friendly and helpful, free parking, very large suite (we were in a deluxe king), secure, free safe in room and relatively clean (not spotless but clean enough). The pool area was very, very clean and looked quite inviting but we were on the go from 9am until at least 10pm every day there so we did not get a chance to swim. I would recommend this motel to anyone on a budget but looking for great value and location. I would NOT recommend this motel to someone who is accustomed to 4 or 5 star type hotel/resorts!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, safe, secure location.”
Reviews.Author: Kat1sydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in May and found the hotel to be in a great location and perfect for our needs. While it may not be brand new, for the price and location it was great value. We would definatly recommend this hotel unless you are looking for 5 star this will suit your needs. Very friendly staff and accommodation. Due to its location there was large amout of 24hour security which made it very safe at any hour. Kat and Mike - Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Awesome Suites”
Reviews.Author: sportzfan86
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hollywood Orchid Suites on our round the world trip. We booked here because of the good reviews on tripadvisor and we weren't dissapointed! The hotel is located right in the centre of hollywood about a minute walk away from Hollywood Boulevard. The room was clean and housekeeping good throughout the stay. The room was also quite big for just a standard twin room so you can't go wrong. We also went to Universal Studios during our stay which the reception was able to help us with cheap tickets which helped us avoid the queues for tickets. Universal Studio is only one stop away on the train from the suites. Anyway I would highly recommend this hotel for its location, price and amenities provided.

Reviews.Title: “An apartment in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: CYKL
Reviews.Content: We had an executive 2-bed suite, which had a combined living and sleeping room, one separate kitchen, and a terrace. The apartment is probably 60m2 in total, there isn't much walking space in the combined living and sleeping room, where there are 2 beds, a TV, and 2 armchairs. The dining table (for 4 people) are in the kitchen. The kitchen is equipped with the usual kitchen stuff, though the only things we used were the coffee machine and kettle. There is an aircon as well as a heater in the combined sleeping and living room. One point to highlight is that the carpet is rather sticky. We walked barefoot in the room and after a while, our soles were all black. I also killed an unidentified bug in the room. But I won't say it's exactly the hotel's fault, because when I was walking along the streets outside at night, I saw a lot of cockroaches. So maybe it's just the general condition of that part of LA. There is also free internet and printer and paper in the lobby. The apartment is located in an area accessible by lots of bus lines and the metro red line. We took the metro to Chinatown, and the buses to Sunset Strip, Farmer's Market and The Grove, and the La Brea Tar Pits. We were in LA again at the last part of our trip and we stayed at another hotel in another part of LA. While it had been a hassle/problem-free stay at Orchid Suites, I probably would try another place or stay with the other hotel that I have stayed at in this trip, if I were to revisit LA.

Reviews.Title: “Orchid Suites Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: infolondon
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in some excellent locations, but it is hard to beat this one. Barely 30 seconds walk to the Hollywood & Highland centre. 3 minute walk to red line metro, 90 seconds to Starbucks, etc. The rooms are an excellent size with kitchen, living area, bedroom and bathroom. Staff varied in terms of helpfulness and friendliness. No one was rude but one particular lady did annoy me who continued to chat on the phone whilst serving me. My biggest complaint was to do with general upkeep. Some small repairs did need to be undertaken in our room (104). Hole in bed blanket. Very top bit missing off cold tap. Tap drips. Hairdryer didn't work. We did mention this to reception but nothing got done to correct problem. Toilet became blocked easily, I was given a plunger. Wireless internet worked fine in living room, but the signal was too weak to use in bedroom. Overall I might stay here again. If you want a bed for the night in a great location stay here, if you want anything more look for somewhere else. Note: To get to the hotel from the Hollywood Highlands metro station the easiest route is to turn right out of the station. Pass a couple of shops. You'll then be at the entrance to Hollywood & Highlands centre. Go up escalator to level 2 then head left across courtyard. Pass Kodak shop on your right and take exit tunnel next to Kodak shop. On walking out on to the street you'll see the hotel diagonally left of you.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Great, Great !!”
Reviews.Author: Scatterling
Reviews.Content: What a treat this little hotel is!! We booked what I think they call a junior suite. It was great!! Clean, and exactly what we were looking for. The location of this place is unbelievable. Just behind the Kodak theatre, and a shopping centre. We had a kitchen in our suite, so just popped down to a nearby grocery store and bought some provisions. This kept our costs down and was great to have a quick meal at home after a long day of sight seeing. There is a pool which was great as the weather was really hot in the few days we were there. The staff are very friendly, and the hotel is very secure, as you are given a key for the door. There are washing machines in the basement, and I think, free parking. (we didn't have a car, but I did overhear someone saying it was free). While we were there, there were some awards evening, so we had fun trying to spot some stars. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who was looking for a clean, friendly place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location Locstion Location”
Reviews.Author: sue2004
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this great hotel. Okay the kitchens were a little dated but clean. The size of the rooms were massive. We had a two bed suite (i think thats what it was). In the first room there was a superking size bed , an armchair , tv , dinning table and 4 chairs and a complete kitchen all but a washing machineand masses of room. Then through a short hallway which had 2 sliding mirrored doors which housed the safe and hanging space and shelves, also another cupboard with hanging space. Into a mirrored area with sink and mirrored cabinet on the wall. Off of this was a toilet and bath with shower over and also another room with a superking bed and mirrored built in wardrobes , 2 bedside cabinets and tv. this room also had a ceiling fan as well as air con. Between the first room at the start of the hallway was a hidden sliding door that you could close if privacy was needed . Bit detailed i know, but when i want info on a place i like to know it all. Was a very secure hotel with doors locked at night and couldnt get in without your key or the desk clerk letting you in. The free wifi in room would have been good if we had bought our laptops but there is a free pc on second floor with a free printer. Great location 20 yards or so from the Mall, when you walk through the mall and come out in the open go left and there a great view of the Hollywood sign. You must try the Restaraunt called The Grill upstairs in the mall, the steaks are to die for. Also a johnny rockets and other ast food places.

Reviews.Title: “A detailed review; also, in comparison to a nearby hotel”
Reviews.Author: i_dr
Reviews.Content: I was in Los Angeles for a total of nine days recently. The initial four of which was spent here at the Orchid Suites. And they were a good four days. Unlike the previous reviewer, my experience in check-in was pleasant. We came in late past 10 pm, tired from a 4+ hr. drive from Las Vegas. On our way over, I was worried that our room might be given to another guest so I called to confirm our arrival. The person who answered assured me that our room is waiting for us. Upon arrival, the same man who I talked to earlier greeted us with a smile. Check-in was a breeze. Good start I thought. The last time I was in L.A. was more than a dozen years ago. And my memory of this part of town was that it was seedy. But reading the reviews here in T.A., I found out that the area has undergone a transformation. But unless I witnessed it myself, I had my doubts especially since I was travelling with my 7 & 12 yr. olds. So security was a major issue. I took a chance since I felt that this is the area I wanted to be in. The road where the hotel was located is a real quiet road where nary a vehicle pass. This despite the presence of delivery trucks to the nearby big hotel and mall. The traffic from the surrounding very busy streets of Hollywood, Highland and Franklin could not be heard. One of the things I liked was that upon check-in, you will be given a key (aside from your room key) that can open all the other common doors like the entrance and garage doors which were locked. Safe. The garage is located underneath the hotel and was ample. It was always full but I managed to find a spot all the time. And for those wondering, I saw big SUVs parked with space to spare. Transporting your luggage was easy since there was an elevator. The room was big, generously appointed, and clean. The look won't win any awards and might even be dated and turn off some, but it didn't matter to me. I liked the fact that it had a complete kitchen with a ref, mini oven, microwave, coffee maker and plates and glasses even. You can save money by preparing meals occassionally. A bonus were the mini safe in the closet and the working heater in the bathroom (it was cold when we were there). Service was good. The front desk staff would suggest activities for the day when they see you in the morning (or at least one did). And they were cheerful when answering my daily querries. Aside from the ready answers when asking for a great place for breakfast or a nearby grocery store, they researched and got back to me when I asked sor something they didn't know ( I asked for a nearby church if you must know). And let me repeat the available free wi-fi. You could probably find better accommodations elsewhere. But at $139 a day, it is hard to fault this hotel. Okay, included breakfast would be nice. Would I come back? I definitely would. After my stay here, I brought the family to San Diego and Anaheim, but returned to L.A. for unfinished sight-seeing. But for comparison's sakes, I decided to book at the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel for the 2nd half of our L.A. holiday. Let me state that it is hard to choose between the two hotels. While I liked everything that the Orchid offered, the free breakfast at the Celebrity may be clincher for some. Add that to the fact that the latter is $10 cheaper. But on the Orchid's plus side, you feel more secure in it. Plus, it is a more convenient hotel. This is expounded in my review of the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel. The way I see it, if you have a car with you, the Orchid Hotel might be a better deal. If you don't, the free breakfast and the $10 difference might point you to the Celebrity instead. Personally, I'd put the Orchid Suites in front by a whisker (I had a car). Travelling with my young ones, I like the security and the convenience it offers. Plus the free breakfast the other hotel offers I offset by buying some bread, cereal and juice myself (which is pretty inexpensive). Sorry if this review has stretched out the way it did. Jet lag has given me extra time to write early in the morning (2 am). I just hope I helped you decide if this is the right hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “My only complaint”
Reviews.Author: HotelReviewerNOLA
Reviews.Content: My only complaint is that we stayed there. The carpet was SO dirty that my feet were black. The bed was terrible. They were late getting the room ready and while we were walking in, they said (in broken English) "Don't touch the walls, the paint is still wet." The people upstairs was stomping all night, even after I called the front desk to complain. The bathroom window was open and UNABLE to close...so no showers. Glad we only stayed 2 nights...but 2 nights toooooo long! I will say that the size of the room was nice and the location was GREAT. But that is about all I can say nice.

Reviews.Title: “good overall, but...”
Reviews.Author: salaciouscrum
Reviews.Content: I booked the orchid after reading fabulous reviews here, and the price was very reasonable. It's great for a budget hotel, and I know I've stayed at worse. The location was pretty good, right in the middle of Hollywood and nearby the h&h mall. I had been worried about noise from delivery trucks early in the morning, as other travelers have said, but I didn't hear any. The free wifi was awesome, and the room was kept well. The roof garden was a nice place to hang out- the only drawback was there really was no view. Didn't use the pool, but it looked pretty clean. The little patio to our room was a nice touch. Among my complaints would be: the surliness of the check in clerk. I guess we had arrived earlier than expected, and the woman acted like it was some big hassle to tell me our room wasn't ready yet. I was so put off by this I had my boyfriend deal with her when we officially checked in. The rest of the staff was great, except for her. We would have used the kitchenette more, but there was a strange smell in there, even when we first arrived. This is a great hotel for visitors to LA and Hollywood, but their customer service skills are a little lacking

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: l4ndncame
Reviews.Content: I don't even want to write a review since it was just great place to stay, keep it secret, apparently many people already know tho. Location is great, rooms were good too. Also, staff at the reception were very helpful when in need (well I'm stranger around the area and needed some help). Right behind the Kodak Theater, it's just such a good location to have fun in Hollywood!! Only needed a fridge to keep bottled water cool, but kitchen is fully equipped, so you can cook anytime if you need to. Wi-Fi is in if you got a laptop, or you can use the desktop there. I'll defenitely stay here again when I get chance to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DonnaLee5
Reviews.Content: I came to Hollywood with my mom in law for a film festival off of Beverly. We had previously booked a room at The Farmer's Daughter, but cancelled once we found this sweet bargain! A very much affordable suite hotel within walking distance of Hollywood Blvd and shopping/attractions plus great security and free on-site parking! How can that be beat? The room was terrific! Plenty of space with a full kitchen and dining area. We had a balcony too! We had booked one of the 2bedroom executive suites. It was very clean with comfortable beds. For once I did not wake up with a back-ache from sleeping in a strange bed. The staff was very friendly and informative. I also got great use of the free high speed internet computer available. I was able to print out much needed directions with ease. I will most definitely stay at The Orchid again. Great Value and Great Price! ~ Donna

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, not too shabby”
Reviews.Author: tavo82
Reviews.Content: The location to this hotel is fantastic, right in the middle of Hollywood. Rooms are a decent size, clean and fairly comfortable. We had a room with a kitchenette, as expected the kitchen facilities werenâ€™t fantastic, one stove didnâ€™t work, there werenâ€™t a lot of cooking utensils, but we could get by to save some costs of eating out. Free internet and printing service is great. Also has secure parking.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: wvdeb
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and very nice and the room was very clean. The room was, of course, older decor, but that's what you expect for an older hotel in Hollywood - LOCATION! You're in HOLLYWOOD!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: karenvegas
Reviews.Content: I have just returned with my friend after my second stay at this great hotel .I will certainly be staying here again when I next visit. Fantastic spacious room, fully equipped kitchen, really comfortable beds.Most importantly it was really clean. The staff were really lovely. Very helpful and courteous. Even let us check out or our rooms a little late. There is free internet access which is really useful. The hotel is situated right in the heart of Hollywood.The surrounding area is really safe enough to walk around at night. Right next to the Hollywood and Highland complex which has some great shops and fast food places (on 3rd floor) . Also right near the Metro and buses go from nearby to all attractions. If you want something really different to do whilst in town try the Dearly Departed tour(www.dearlydepartedtours.com)which not only shows you famous muder sites but it is very informative and gives you alot of history on old Hollywood- well worth checking out!!! It was a real pleasure staying in the Orchid Suites and I will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, great value, clean and confortable”
Reviews.Author: Nicks_gal
Reviews.Content: Have just stayed here for two nights, it was excellent, it cost us about Â£45 a night and was well worth it, two mins walk from kodak theatre, walk of fame etc. Very Clean, comfortable suites with kitchen and massive bathroom etc. Free internet access to catch up on your emails etc, Staff friendly and helpful. Decor a bit dated but in terms of value for money and location i think you would struggle to do better than this in los angeles. Would thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: student81
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in December. Unlike it's surrounding it is a safe area. Prior to check-in, you will be wondering where to park, just stand in front of the garage, there is no real place to unload. After check-in, parking itself is perfect, and safe. If you have any trouble (we didn't) just ask the friendly staff they can help you. Our room was very large, perfect for a long stay. There was even a door to seperate the second bedroom from the front one. The kitchenette was perfect as well, eventhough we didn't put it to use. The room in general is very clean & practical, eventhough it does look a bit dated. The free Internet access worked fine. We did not check out the outdoor pool as it was Winter. Location: The hotel is directly located behind the Hollywood and Highland Mall, a shopping center full of stores and restaurants (Great: California Pizza Kitchen!!!). You walk about 100 meter from the hotel and voila you are standing in the mall. Just ask the hotel staff for advise, they can help you with everything. Universal/Warner Bros Studios are close by, you can either reach them by public transportation or even better by car. The Hollywood Boulevard itself was rather disappointing, it is a very touristy place, but I guess thats what it is supposed to be ;=) Do check out the cinema though, the sound system is amazing. There are two nightclubs open on weekend within the Mall, but the value is rather bad. For the younger crowd it might be nice, they have days with 18yr admission. If you are roadtripping, I would suggest to stay just 2 days here, first for the Hollywood area, second for a Studio Tour. Any additional days I would spend closer to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: dougie78
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the place. Couldn't be closer to the action, literally right next door to the Kodak Theatre. Very comfortable and clean. We booked the 2 king option as were travelling with another couple. Comfortable beds. Didn't see any of the dodgyness associated with Hollywood. Found it very safe! So much to do. Secure parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Bjmc28
Reviews.Content: Having never been to LA before I had no idea where to start looking. There were so many mixed reviews on what part of town to stay in and everything seemed so expensive! In the end I took a punt and booked at Orchid Suits and we were not disappointed. While the rooms are dated they are clean and comfortable and the location cannot be beat. We had a car so drove around the rest of LA but being so close to all the main parts of Hollywood was a bonus and there were heaps of shops and restaurants nearby plus all the Hollywood attractions. It was really easy to park in the undercover carpark and we had a 1bed king room with kitchen facilities that was all clean and tidy and everything worked well. If it is 5 star luxury you are after then you will be dissappointed by this place but if it is a clean room with lots of space and good location for a good price then this place is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: Stroppers
Reviews.Content: Had stayed here before in Summer of '06, and returned in January for a second visit. The rooms are big, but have seen better days and a refurb is overdue. However, the location, staff and price more than make up for it! if you want to stay in Hollywood, you'd really struggle to get a better location. The hotel literally backs on to Manns Theatre on Hollywood Boulevard. We had 2 nights here, drove to Vegas, and then came back for 1 more night before flying home, so stayed in 2 different rooms. We had no problems with noise/neighbours etc. The kitchen is well equipped, and also had a dining area which was a bonus. Area feels safe; the first time we stayed we walked up to the Hollywood Bowl at night to see the LA Philharmonic Orchestra play Tchaikovsky with fireworks - amazing experience, and we don't even like classical music!!!
