Would recommned Mels Diner for dinner and/or breakfast - ask reception for directions!!

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump!”
Reviews.Author: OldTravelingGuy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from LA to visit our Granddaughter. I found the "Orchid" online and it seemed OK. Being on a dead end street enticed us thinking it would be quiet, and the price seemed reasonable.........Well as the proverb says "You get what you pay for!" While having complimentary underground parking, I can think of nothing else good. The rooms are old and seem to be a converted condo/studio apartment deal. Spacious, yes, Nice-No. The bed is the WORST we have ever slept on, and the NOISE, my God! We were there on a Saturday night and the construction noise sounded as if they were in the basement. Each time a door slammed or a phone rang, or an ambulance raced by you were awakened. Plan carefully when coming to LA and avoid staying at this "cute" Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaAustralia
Reviews.Content: Were a bit dubious about the outside but as soon as we got inside the staff were wonderful. We have two little boys and they made an effort to remember their names and gave them a little gift each. The room was HUGE, with own kitchen with every possible thing in it, unlike most hotel kitchens. Even the housekeeping staff were great, very clean, a few stains on floor, but staff cant do anything about that. Little laundy , vending machine downstairs. It is definately not 5 star but they were so nice, comfortable and so close to everything. Not the best area, some bums and weirdos, butthe big shopping plaza next door was very upmarket with lots of shops and great views of hollywood sign. Oh and free internet and printing.

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls”
Reviews.Author: bargain
Reviews.Content: I doubt there could be a lower priced hotel room located in as good a location in Los Angeles. Our room was spacious and was pretty much like a studio apartment. Washers and dryers are located in the basement next to the underground parking. Just across the road is the super luxurious Renaissance Hotel with room rates 3 times that of the Hollywood Orchid Suites. If money is not an issue, stay at the Renaissance. For those with a limited budget like us, the Hollywood Orchid Suites is a really good option. We did have problems with the noise though. We were woken up at 4am by loud laughter and excited girls' voices outside our room. The next night, we were woken up by heavy footsteps and other banging noises from the room above ours. The walls are so thin that we can hear the people staying in the room next to ours talking to each other. But, we were out most of the day. It's a short walk to the Metro from where it's one stop away from Universal Studios in one direction, and one stop away from the Pantages Theatre (where we watched an excellent performance of Wicked) in the other direction.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: janetea
Reviews.Content: Great location. Very near Hollywood and Highland shopping centre and metro. Handy for visiting universal studios by metro. Can walk to Hollywood sights such as Graumans Chinese theatre. Spacious suite with kitchenette. No problems. Reasonable price. Able to leave cases whilst we looked round area after checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: sez_dee
Reviews.Content: Hollywood Orchid suites is a great budget hotel . The staff were always helpful and cheerful and the 24 hour reception desk was great. The rooms are not the nicest but for the price you can not complain. Across the road from the hotel is the entrance to Hollywood and Highland and there are always people around, even at night, so i always felt safe. I dont think there would be a better location in Hollywood for the price. I would highly recommend this hotel for any budget traveller visiting Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect- Could Not Rate More Highly”
Reviews.Author: NZOZ-team
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous. The location is unbeatable and the price is the best part! Short walk (2 minutes) to downtown Hollywood, Chinese Theatre and the boardwalk, 2 minute walk to train station and one train stop from Universal Studios. Great underground parking if you have transport (although at this place you would not need it as everthing in Hollywood is at your doorstep). Friendly hotel staff, eager to help with any request. Lovely big clean pool and deck chairs to relax on. Rooms are huge, big beds and large kitchens means you can cook anything. Very clean rooms which are serviced prefectly every morning. Could not rate this hotel more highly, would definately be back and would reccommend this hotel to anyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Above average stay”
Reviews.Author: Elisa_B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights - fantastic location, right behind Chinese theatre - couldnt fault this - definitely made stay easy and convenient. Room was large - we had a two bedroom suite. Rooms a little outdated but still were clean. Would stay here again for the convenience of the location.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: MaryJeanC
Reviews.Content: My daughter, grandson and I stayed 2 nights August 15-16,2007 at the Orchid Suites Hotel.The hotel is walking distance to Hollywood and Highland Mall and all the other Hollywood sites. Our room had 2 queen beds,full kitchen and a balcony. Our first night we went to the mall for the whole evening and returned to our room around 9:00PM. The next day we went to Universal Studios and it was late when we returned so parking was an issue in the uderground parking lot but someone was leaving as we came back so we were able to park. Some parking spaces are very tight. There is also parking on the street.Our last morning we went back to mall before check-out. We would recommend this hotel to everyone. We felt safe walking to the mall. There is a post office right before the entrance to the mall. There's a lot of restaurants in the mall. Fun,fun fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Apartment accommodation at budget hotel prices”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Jules
Reviews.Content: Being in LA for ten days I wanted more than just a hotel room and this was it! My deluxe room, at around $116/night, was a one bedroom apartment with plush sofa and armchairs, dining area, full kitchen and separate bedroom (with heaps of closet space) and well-appointed bathroom. And essential for the modern traveller - free high speed wi-fi. (there is also a fixed internet terminal avail free on the first floor). The spacious suite was well kept, clean and pleasant - I overlooked the pool and there is also a roof-top garden, as well as laundry facilities. Staff, from the management, to reception desk and cleaning staff, were lovely - helpful, and courteous. I was going to move to Venice Beach for my last four days - but I loved Orchid Suites so much I stayed on there! It really felt like a home away from home. Location is fantastic and close to buses and trains to everywhere. Don;t believe the myth - you can get around L.A. easily and cheaply on public transport.

Reviews.Title: “What's not to love?!?!”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel86
Reviews.Content: The most amazing hotel! When we arrived we could BELIEVE the location it is LITERALLY next door to the Hollywood and Highland Centre, The Kodak Theatre (where they have the Oscars) Mann's Chinese Theatre, INCREDIBLE! You walk out the door of the hotel go through the passageway at the back of the centre and there you are right in the middle of the Centre, in the middle of Hollywood Blvd. You couldn't get a better location. The staff were so friendly and helpful and the room was AMAZING. We had 4 girls staying in the room and we could have fit more. 2 giant beds and a couch with tonnes of room still to spare, a full kitchen with table and 4 chairs and a bathroom. There was a safe in the wardrobe with an electronic lock, a powerful ac in the room and a little balcony overlooking the pool (which was also lovely). There was a laundry room in the basement with vending machines (mainly drinks). Great value for money, i will be staying here any time i visit LA.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: CincyCD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 3 nights during a west coast trip that included LA and San Diego. The location was unbeatable, just behind the Kodak Theatre/Mall and walking minutes to Hollywood Blvd's main attractions! We also purchased discount tickets for Universal Studios from the hotel desk for $52 ea and rode the Metro one stop (a Metro stop is also minutes away) to Univeral's front gate. The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating. The room was huge, (more of a suite that included a bedroom, bath, kitchenette, and TV room), a bit dark and dated, but clean. A bonus was the free secure parking under the hotel, (yes the spots are tight but i was driving a compact!) I would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Works4TheMouse
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed here for one night in September for a "girls night out" to see "Wicked" at the Pantages. The pre-registration parking is a bit of a nightmare. You can't park on the street because it's permit only and you can't park in the hotel parking lot because it's secured by a gate that you need a key. I left my friend in the car in the parking lot driveway while I ran in to get a key, parked and then registered so it worked out. The hotel is not luxurious. If you are looking for 4 or 5 star accommodations, you'd be better off at the Marriott next door. Just be prepared to pay about $400.00 more a night plus $30.00 a day parking! The staff was extremely friendly. Our room was not ready when we checked in but since we arrived prior to the check in time it was not a problem. We had a JR suite with two beds and it was a perfect size for two women to try and get ready for the theatre. It had a little refrigerator that was great for keeping our Diet Coke in and a little coffee maker for wake up coffee the next morning. The location to Hollywood Blvd is awesome. Just a short walk to the corner and the Metro Station is right there to take you wherever you want to go. And dining choices are unbelievable with the Hollywood and Highland Center right in front of you as well as the Disney Store and Soda Shop just across the street. If you are looking for a clean, friendly place to sleep, shower and change while seeing the sights or going to the theatre, this hotel is the place you want to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - needs updating a bit.”
Reviews.Author: smiffy79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights on out trip to Los Angeles. The hotel is in a great location if you want to see Hollywood, however LA is so big you have to drive to get anywhere else. It is directly next to the Hollywood and Highland mall which is great for shopping, restaurants etc. The staff were very nice and the parking is really handy. Our room was large with 2 double beds and a kitchenette which was quite good. The dÃ©cor is a little worn but everything looked clean. It could be quite noisy at night but I think you have to expect this in LA. The pool was really lovely and we enjoyed having a dip in the afternoon and enjoyed catching some rays on the roof terrace as well. We went to Universal Studios one day on the subway which was really easy. The rest of the time we used our car. Our only issue with this hotel is that I saw a cockroach downstairs in the laundry and vending machine area. The area is exposed to the outside and Iâ€™m sure there would not be any in the room but it made me a bit nervous and worried for the last night. If I were to go to LA again I probably wouldnâ€™t stay in Hollywood as we have seen it now but would go to Santa Monica etc

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Steve_Guttenberg
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights with my girlfriend as part of a road trip around california, and it was great. Clean, friendly, safe and enjoyable. As mentioned in previous reviews, this place has a fantastic location, just off Hollywood Boulevard and all the tourist stuff, you know the deal. There is also a convenience store selling basics & liquor just across the street. The staff were some of the most helpful we came across in over 2 weeks. They helped with directions, maps, advice...... you name it. And they did it with a smile too. The pool wasn't as heated as expected, but the cold water certainly helped freshen me up in the morning anyway! Free internet access, free underground parking for about 25 cars (one of the main bonuses for us). The Suite was a good size, and the kitchen and dining table a nice bonus. Only slight problem was a bit of noise in the mornings coming from the Renaissance Hotel...... trucks reversing, skips being emptied etc, though I think this was due to some specific construction work being done at the time, and not a permanent problem. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, and would stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: jondeb2005
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights when in LA, great location as mentioned in previous reviews. After staying in a few motels on our journey, it was nice to have a couch and kitchen to make a home from home for a few days. Yes, the rooms are a bit dated but quite adequate and comfortable. Great free internet access and loads of secure parking underground, we enjoyed our stay here and got a good price for the location. Booked direct with the hotel. If we go back to hollywood I would stay here again. Hollywood was good but a little bit dirty compared to the rest of LA, and came away a little disappointed. Took a while to find nice places to eat, would recommend Mels Diner and also the posh burger place - 25 degrees in the Roosevelt hotel which are both nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great motel”
Reviews.Author: carolauckland
Reviews.Content: This is excellent accommodation at a reasonable price. The location is ideal (right behind Kodak Theatre in Hollywood). Great pool. The decor in the rooms is a little old, but its clean and the kitchen is well appointed. As a family of 5, I booked 2 adjoining rooms which opened up together, so we had 2 bathrooms. It was fantastic. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: Maccas14
Reviews.Content: You cannot get much closer to Hollywood Blvd, The Walk of Fame, Chinese Theatre than this!!! This is literally a two minutes walk to the walk of fame! The Service was fantastic, very helpful people even helped find where the resturant we were going to was, printed off maps, give us some good helpful tips for LA. The rooms were big, roomy and clean bit on the old side but for dollar value and location this place is well worth it. Also free internet on the second floor which is always handy. Highly reccommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: softiegal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in December 2006. Pros: - Excellent location, very close to all the action - Good Price - Secure parking - Pool looked nice (although we did not use it) Cons: - Room was kind of dark (no view) and felt very dated - Carpets need cleaning and room had a slight smell to it. Overall the hotel was okay for the price. It was basic, but nice.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: mohicans
Reviews.Content: Wow - for a stay in Hollywood - this is the place you want to be. It is an older property, but the owners seem very committed to providing the best they can provide for budget travellers looking for a clean, safe place at a fair price. There is evidence of slow but sure upgrading and renovating in common areas - and while the rooms have dated furniture and stuff - considering the great price for such a location - and its all okay. We had a 2 king bed suite and stayed 4 nights. We were very comfortable there. Universal is only one subway stop away - and the Hollywood & Highland Center is right next door. Get up in the morning and wander over to Grauman's Chinese theatre before the tour buses start arriving and you'll have the whole courtyard to yourself. If you are driving, the underground parking is perfect. This place has a lot of character and the staff are marvelous. We'd gladly stay again and again - couldn't recommend it more!

Reviews.Title: “We like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: TwoCruisenuts
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our one night stay at the Hollywood Orchid Suites. We were in town to see a concert at the Kodak Theatre but didn't want to pay the high prices for the Marriott Renaissance. We were surprised to find this hotel was located across a small street at the end of a short hallway leading from the Hollywood/Highland complex. I mean it was just steps from all the shopping, movie theatres and the Kodak Theatre! We were impressed by the large rooms and the very large kitchen! It's larger than mine at home! And both of us slept like babies! It was so quiet and the beds were very comfortable. This would be an ideal place to take the children and make a weekend out of seeing a movie at the historic El Capitan Theatre, shop at the Disney store next door, put your feet into the footprints of the stars next door at Graumeins, and look at the Hollywood Walk of Fame right there under your feet!! Oh there are so many things to do and see right within those few blocks! I would give the hotel 5 stars except that it's a little worn around the edges. Quite clean, but in need of an update. But I suppose the rates would go up accordingly and this little gem we found would cost nearly as much as the other more famous hotels nearby!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: phantom4536000
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was very pleasant. Check in was fast. Room was very clean. Hotel was in the middle of everything. The parking was secure. I felt secure at this hotel. We like it so much that we decided to stay an extra day and they accomedated us very pleasantly. They even gave us an extra discount for staying the 5th day. We were overall pleased with everything.

Reviews.Title: “Best One Star Rated Hotel in My Book!”
Reviews.Author: Quadders
Reviews.Content: A One Star Rating, someone needs to look at that! This place for a family, etc. IS THE BEST! Spacious rooms and the location is PERFECT! Went with my family a 6 in one suite, plenty of room hubby and I even had a seperate bedroom, clean kitchen for cooking, POOL!! You really couldn;t ask for more! Their staff was more then accomadating, my suburban fit in their 6'4 garage, which we thought it wouldnt, so parking BIG PLUS! Theres a HUGE mall right out the front door, I can't say enough and I was so nervous because we didn't know area and the ONE STAR rating, GO FOR IT!!! Just skip the tours of famous peoples houses, RIP OFF - All you see is bushes!! and the bushes are 15feet high! Save your $$$! Thanks ORCHID, we'll be back FOR SURE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and very comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Lauri
Reviews.Content: We are a family of five who just returned from a short two night stay at Orchid suites at the end of a two week multi-city vacation. The location was very convenient, Kodak theater and Highlands mall next door with well lit access . Universal Studios and Warner Brothers studios were part of our sightseeing and both were very easy to reach and only a short drive from the property. Staff was very welcoming and attentive to all needs, questions and assisted with tour arrangements/driving directions. Two king suite was very large and spacious, more than adequate room for bags, rollaway bed and 3 teenage children. Kitchen was convenient for drinks/snacks. Rooms appear older but are well maintained, clean and comfortable with most ammenities of a newer 4 star hotel at an affordable rate. Pool made for a relaxing break from or after sightseeing. Parking very safe/secure. We would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay there again if our travels take us back to Hollywood area.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: littlehobbit
Reviews.Content: We expected somewhere cheapish and cheerful...which we got, but also a lot more! We didn't expect the location to be so fantastic (Steps from a huge mall, steps from Hollywood Boulevard, and a couple of minutes walk from the metro. Also right next door is a cinema complex, a theatre, and (just out of interest)the place where they give out the academy awards! We didn't expect free parking, which was a real bonus, nor did we expect the rooms to be quite so clean and spacious. The front desk was very friendly and helpful too. All in all we would highly recommend this location for a comfortable and surprisingly quiet stay in the heart of Hollywood!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: EnglandFamily
Reviews.Content: Clean and spacious accommodation in a very central location - would certainly stay again

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: paskoolio
Reviews.Content: A nice place to stay, 70s style, in the heart of Hollywood. Our room was more an appartment with a big kitchen. Overall very good value for money. Reccomended

Reviews.Title: “Great location, secure parking , 70s feel”
Reviews.Author: planet-urko
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in July. We booked it as we were doing a road trip and needed safe secure central parking. We booked the two King room suite and were delighted. The suite was very large with lots of hanging space, The bathroom was clean and more than adequate as was the kitchenette.We even had a table and chairs to seat 4 a breakfast bar and still loads of space for cases etc.The teak furniture , drapes , coverlets etc were a bit tired and gave the place a distinctly 70 s feel and it smelt a bit musty initially but it was clean and we felt this added to the character of the place overall. The pool although small was great fun and a very welcome bonus after a day on your feet trying to get a cab or chancing your arm in a car !. The service was friendly and the rooms were cleaned daily . Considering its excellent central position and the secure parking which can be extremely costly we considered this place excellent value for moneyand very much enjoyed our stay. My only gripe would be that the windows were not particularly secure so we took our valuables with us when we went out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Amenities & Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: toni.lister
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I recently stayed for 4 nights at this property. Overall we found it to be in a good location, for a fair price, with excellent amenities. We arrived on a Tuesday afternoon & made it to the hotel fairly easily in our rental car, thanks to Google Maps. Check-in was smooth & we were able to park our car in the underground car park for free (this is a huge drawcard, as many properties of this nature do not have car parking). This parking facility seemed quite secure. We made it up to our room on the 3rd floor, looking out over the pool on the way. Although this accommodation is aurrounded by buildings (as it is directly behind the Kodak Theatre), it still seemed to maintain a fairly relaxing air about it, with most rooms having their own balcony, & table/cahir set. As well as the main pool areas, there is also a rooftop garden setting where you can see further afield. Our room was a real surprise, with a large bed, TV & lounge chairs, as well as a full (seperate) kitchen & dining area. The bathoom was a little odd with the sink actually outside of the bathroom, although this is becoming more common in many accommodations. The whole unit was fairly spacious although a little dated. However, everything was clean & in good condition. The shower was OK too, with good pressure & plenty of hot water. There was an air conditioning unit in the room although it wasn't that effective for the space it was trying to cool (it was certainly better than nothing). Downstairs (above the lobby) was a free internet comupter, also with printer, which was really helpful, although sometimes you have to wait to use it. Downstairs in the basement there is a laundry facility with a pile of vending machines. The location is fantastic - right behind the Kodak Theatre, it is about a 1 or 2 minute walk to the Hollywood & Highland complex, & just a few more minutes right around to the Hollywood Walk of Fame & Mann's Chinese Theatre. There are loads of things to see in this area so you can get to so much just by walking. Across one street there are some more small stores, as well as a convenience store where you can buy alcohol if you would rather enjoy it in the comfort of your own studio unit. The service was great & we were always greeted at the door. Staying here was a breeze & it was really nice to have full use of our own facilities. We would stay here again, & recommend it to others looking for a bit of independence in a studio accomodation setting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Brossie
Reviews.Content: This is a great value motel type accomodation. We had a large suite with a kitchen (including a table and chairs) and balcony. Decor is a little dated but this is a 2 star property and was what we had expected. The location is unbeatable - right behind the Kodak Theatre (do the tour - very interesting) and Chinese theatre. We could walk thru to the mall (Hollywood Highland) and have a choice of restaurants. The first night we were there there was a red carpet event going on - fascinating to see all the trucks and limos and glamorous people! This hotel is right next to a super flash 5* property - same location but way different price! The pool was a welcome relief after a day at Universal studios (one stop on the Metro). Clean and heated too. Housekeeping were a bit slow (not done til 5pm on one day) and the reception staff were not particularly helpful/friendly but these were minor gripes. Great to have the free, safe parking too. Definately recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Resmama
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week in July - and loved it! The location is unbeatable, and probably the best if you - like us - don't drive. It is not easy, but it is possible to get around with metro and buses, and Hollywood/Highland is a convenient starting point. We also loved our spacious suit, with a real kitchen where we could cook breakfast, etc. It was clean and nice, although a bit ugly, but everything worked perfectly. And staff was very friendly. Finally, we loved the laid-back, unpretentious atmosphere, where one could play in the pool, borrow some magazines in the lobby, do laundry in the basement, etc. We really felt at home! PS Thanks to the trip advisors who recommended this hotel to us!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem, fantastic location hard to find..”
Reviews.Author: knownstar
Reviews.Content: This place is located behind the Kodak Theater on a cul de sac. You won't find it just by driving by. I was visiting a friend who lives in the Hollywood Hills and she turned me on to the Hollywood Orchid Suites. I did not use my car for the 2 days I was there. The Kodak theater is attached to a Mall and the Chinese Theater and it is all just a few steps from the front door. The subway station is there too and proved very convenient. The room was clean and very large and the bed was very comfortable. There was a kitchen and dining table we did not use but would be very convenient for a family on vacation. The pool came in very handy as it was hot those days. All in all a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Still a terrific value and location”
Reviews.Author: fancypants-7
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Orchid Suites. We stayed in a studio apartment with two queen size beds and a kitchen (executive suite) and paid $129. Lat time we had a bigger suite with two rooms but it was not available this time. I just can't say enough for the location and the value. The Orchid Suites came to my attention through Tripadvisor. When I first booked it I thought it was a 4 star hotel from all the good press it was getting. Actually it is not a fancy place and rated 2 stars but has everything we need and more. As an example they have free coffee and tea in the rooms. I drink instant and my son drinks hot chocolate. We inquired and were given both on the spot. They are very helpful and the place is comfortable and clean. We feel very safe there, both front door and covered garage are accessed with a key. If you require a luxury accomodation this is not for you, But if you want a clean well located very well priced hotel, I recommend the Hollywood Orchid Suites highly.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Place in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Andrexxx
Reviews.Content: Needing a place to stay near the Pantages Theatre on Hollywood Blvd, we decided to try the Orchid Suites. I'm happy to report the great reviews were spot on. A comfortable hotel with a fab location. Next door to the slick Hollywood Highland Mall, and close to the Metro, Graumann's Chinese Theatre, and other "must see" sites. Staff was friendly and rooms were spotless. We will most definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but location makes up for it”
Reviews.Author: TizzieBelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of our trip and then 2 nights at the end before flying home. The location is fantastic and right in the heart of Hollywood. Rooms are very basic and smell rather musty and old, however, they are well equipped. We had the two king suite and used the spare bed to lay all the suitcases on which was useful! The kitchen was huge. There are some restaurants nearby in the Hollywood and Highland but the steak grill place turned out to be a disaster. Some people mentioned the Wolfgang Puck place was better. There is a small store nearby selling breakfast items. Although the rate we paid was good ($129 and tax per night) I do feel that it is highly priced for what you get due to the facilities being so old. Although if two couples were sharing the two king suites it would be a bargain. The location makes up for this. We did not have any problems during our stay although they do clean the rooms late in the day (3pm).

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, bit outdated, but clean and spacious room”
Reviews.Author: Roel2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in april 2007 based on tripadvisor reviews. This hotel shows it's age, but is however still a good place to stay. The room was clean and very spacious. We had a suite with a full kitchen, seating area, dining table and seperate bedroom. Parking is complimentary in the (closed) parking garage below. The location is perfect for visiting downtown Hollywood. It's a 2 minute walk to the Hollywood & Highland mall next to Grauman's chinese theatre.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location-Great Staff-Good Value”
Reviews.Author: 1SusiQ
Reviews.Content: First of all, when it comes to Hollywood Orchid Suites, location is the name of the game! Just go out the front door, up a little walkway to your right, and you're in the Hollywood-Highland shopping complex, which houses three stories of retail stores. It's Babylon Courtyard looks like a Hollywood set, complete with giant elephant sculptures. Viewing bridges at the back of the courtyard offer a great photo-op of the "Hollywood Sign". There is a wide variety of places to eat. Our favorite was the California Pizza Kitchen. (The lettuce wraps and the Waldorf Salad were awesome!) One of the stores that we frequented was a Kodak camera shop. Everytime we filled up a memory card, we would have them transfer the photos onto a CD (for $9.95). Take the escalator down to the street level and you're right next to Grauman's Chinese Theatre, the main entrance to the Kodak Theatre (Emmy's, American Idol), a movie theater, the El Capitan Theater (Jimmy Kimmel), the Walk of Fame, the wax museum, Mel's Drive-In, some of the best souvenir shops in town, and so much more! We spent one full day at Universal Studios. It took us about 8 minutes to drive there and park. (By the way, we recommend splurging on a "Front of the Line Pass"! No waiting in lines and you get to go "behind the scenes" on various attractions). Allow some time for Universal's "City Walk" also. There are LOTS of neat shops and restaurants. If you like Italian food, Buca di Beppo is fantastic for both food and atmosphere! If you like seafood, one just can't beat Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. We recommend their "Bucket O' Boat Trash"! On a separate day, we made the short drive over to Beverly Hills. Be sure to take the trolley tour around town. It only costs $5.00 and is full of photo-ops!!! All of the staff at the Hollywood Orchid Suites were personable and accommodating! Our favorite was "Adam" at the front desk! He really made our day with his wonderful attitude and smile! The hotel itself, as noted in many reviews, is rather "tired and worn", but it was clean and entirely adequate for our needs. (Just keep in mind that it is a 40-year-old converted apartment building.) We paid $119/night for a nice-sized room with two very comfortable queen-sized beds, a couch and coffee table, and a full kitchen with dining table. There are, of course, fancier accommodations in the area, but one would have to pay another $100-$200/night. It just isn't worth it, unless you will be spending more time in your room than seeing the sights. One of the main reasons we picked this hotel is because of the security features. Although we were two women, staying alone, we felt very safe here. One must have a keycard to use the elevators, the underground parking garage (parking is free), and the front door "after hours". The pool was very clean and warm! The laundry room was a plus. The vending machines had a nice assortment of snacks/drinks. Don't forget to visit the rooftop garden. It's a nice place to relax. We hope you enjoy your stay at the Hollywood Orchid Suites as much as we did! We can't wait to return next year!

Reviews.Title: “Its all good.”
Reviews.Author: BrisVegas5
Reviews.Content: All the recent reviews are very accurate. The location cannot be beaten, self contained, secure parking, laundry on site, free internet access, good housekeeping...it was exactly as described. We requested extra towels for the kids to use the pool, which wasn't a problem. We didn't experience any of the noise problems as noted by other reviewers (we were on the second floor). All in all a good stay, its not the Beverly Wilshire however it is great value for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Value!”
Reviews.Author: ATLTRVLER07
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orchid Suites for a week in May 07 with a couple of friends. We booked a 2-king suite plus a roll-away for about $139/night plus tax. This configuration was great for us, but it was sort of like 2 bedrooms with a kitchen in between--if you want a more traditional "living room" setup, there's a layout that replaces the 2nd king with a queen-sized sleeper sofa. Other configurations are available as well. The kitchen was a real plus--in addition to a full-sized refrigerator/freezer, stove, microwave and toaster oven, it included dishware, silverware (including a corkscrew), a coffee maker wih a daily coffee/cream/sugar setup, salt and pepper and paper towels. We saved a lot of money by being able to buy groceries and take home leftovers, and saved even more with the free parking. The location was great--you can cut through the "back entrance" to the Highland Center and be on Hollywood Blvd (and at a Metro stop) in under 5 minutes. A 24 hour drugstore (Long's) and a food market are about 2 blocks down the Blvd. The Hollywood Freeway (101) is a straight shot by car, just a couple of minutes away. There are also on-site laundry facilities and pretty extensive vending machines on the ground floor. The negatives are pretty much what other reviewers mentioned: tired decor (but clean), a shower meant for short people, some outside noise from delivery trucks and passersby on the outer walkways, and some ceiling noise from people on the floor above you (did not detect noise on either side, though). All in all, a terrific value--I'd recommend it for families or other travellers who are looking for a convenient, cost-effective base for sightseeing, as opposed to a "desination resort."

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to see the Sights!”
Reviews.Author: adelaidemum
Reviews.Content: Hollywood Orchid Suites is a basic, clean place to stay that is reasonably priced and right in the middle of Hollywood. It is located directly behind the Kodak Theatre and Grauman's and is only a five minute walk to Hollywood Blvd and the Walk of Fame. The room was clean and huge, with a separate, full kitchen, a dining area and heaps of cupboard space. Our room was the only room that was directly off the front foyer, but we never had a problem with this. Another bonus was free, secure, underground parking and laundry facilities. Universal Studios is only 10 minutes away by car, or do what we did and walk a couple of minutes to the subway station and then catch the train there (only a couple of stops). Hollywood Orchid Suites is nothing fancy and a bit run down, especially from the outside, but the rooms were great and the location fantastic. Don't forget to go to the Disney Soda Fountain Store and attempt Mickey's Masterpiece. Our 6 and 4 yr old still talk about it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: OlafR
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel with suite style hotel rooms (2 seperate rooms for 2 kids and 2 parents, kitchen and so on - all in one appartment), reasonably priced and this in Hollywood. We found this hotel, were led by other such reviews and our expectations were fulfilled: GREAT LOCATION - vis-a-vis the Kodak theatre, clean hotel rooms, friendly helpful staff, locked underground parking, even a heated pool etc. The interior and furniture was a little old, but everything was clean and was working properly. Good value for the money we paid. ....We often paid more for much worse hotels. Not to talk about the location which can't be beaten... I can only recommend Orchid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a rather tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: EnglishFamilyAbroad
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find (using Yahoo Maps) and has a brilliant location for accessing Universal Studios (simple 10 min drive). The staff/owners were very friendly/helpful and for what you pay it is difficult to find fault with hotel to be honest! However, the rooms are very tired and in desperate need of refurbishment. They are large though and have all the facilities that you need for a short stay. It also has a great little swimming pool. If you want a great location and a cheap and cheerful experience you won't be disappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cenral”
Reviews.Author: robin48
Reviews.Content: Stay here with my wife and two teenage kids (17 and 19). I got what I expected. Not top star accomadation and a price match, but clean, central and well priced. Noise! The suites are on the north side of the Kodak theatre, close to the walk etc, but can be troubled by the bin lorry at 6 am or deliveries to the large hotel next to the theatre. The room also had a noisy fridge and the walkways infront of the rooms is wooden. Just right for an early morning case being pulled along. Noise aside, great helpful staff on front desk, free secure parking and free internet. Overall a good place to stay if you want something above basic. Stayed for 4 nights. Went to Universal, Six Flags and the Getty Centre (recommended). If you want a good classy evening meal go to The Grill on 3rd floor of the theatre.

Reviews.Title: “Orchid Suites â€“ Return to Heaven in 2007”
Reviews.Author: mikelfenix
Reviews.Content: Last year in September 2006 I wrote a review of Hollywood Orchid Suites where I said that my fiancÃ©e and I loved the place. Well itâ€™s now April 2007, my fiancÃ©e is now my lovely wife and we are both here again at Orchid Suites, celebrating our honeymoon. I could say we knew what to expect when checking in for our third stay here at this wonderful â€œapartment hotelâ€� but you can always be surprised. Not only does the hotel live up to all our expectations, we were delighted when the staff gave us a bottle of Champagne as a Honeymoon gift, and we were even more surprised to find the apartment we had stayed in, and were to stay in again had received new lounges, and what I believe is new carpet. Fantastic!!! This place it awesome, it is above and beyond a hotel room, the staff go above and beyond what you hope for when staying anywhere in the US, overall Orchid Suites is just a wonderful, safe and convenient place to stay while checking out the sights. Julie and I are planning another trip for January 2008 and we can say without question we will be staying with Grace and the team at Orchid Suites. The only place more comfortable is our own apartment in Australia!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ogre
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Suites at the beginning of April and found it to be a great place to stay apart from the noisey neighbours but that was not the hotels fault. The Room itself was Massive with your own Kitchen including Cooker,Microwave and Coffee Making Machine. Off the Main Room is the Bathroom which is quite small with a Shower and a very shallow bath. The Room has a TV although you probably will only use it in the evenings if you are not going out it has a couple of HBO Channels which show great films. The Suites has a small pool and it is very clean as is the whole establishment. The location is fantastic just behind the Kodak Theatre and Hollywood/Highland Metro Stop. Be Careful though of the prices in the Restaurants in the Shopping Centre you could say this a bit of a tourist trap. If you want to go to the Beverly Centre catch the DASH Bus which goes from outside the Metro Stop at 25c it cant be beaten. There are plenty of Museums near the Suites including Ripleys believe it or not and the Guiness book of Records and Wax Museum. The last two i would consider a waste of money as they are in disrepair and quite boring. Another Museum to definite visit is the Museum of Hollywood next door to Mels Diner this is a fantastic Museum the only bad point is you cant take pictures but its probably the best of the lot. Any Questions fellow travellers just ask and i will see if i can answer them. Happy Travelling!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but Noisy !”
Reviews.Author: Biddleonia
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four who stayed at this Hotel for 3 nights. The positives to this Hotel are : - Location (short walk to the Boulevard and right behind major shopping centre....this is also a weakness, refer below) - Free Internet - Large rooms - Good security (front door access via key or reception clearance) - Warm Pool - Self contained kitchen. - Good price for the area Weaknesses to this Hotel are : - Noisy due to location. As this is the last Hotel at the end of a short street located at the rear of a shopping centre, there is a large volume of delivery and truck traffic from early morning. If you are a light sleeper, you will hear it all. - If you have "heavy" guests on the floor above, the noise from the thin floors is accentuated. We were kept awake by this for a whole night by people upstairs from us. - Decor is old On balance, the location of this property and the security were what we required in view of having two kids under 10. Would recommend to others, but be aware of the possible noise issues, particularly with delivery trucks from approx 4 am onwards.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price”
Reviews.Author: deskclerk102
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night for a quick Hollywood visit following a Vegas trip. If you don't want to pay $300+/nt at the Renaissance, this is the next best location. The property is located directly behind the Chinese Theatre and Kodak Theatre with a nice walkthrough to the Hollywood/Highland center. Tour offices are an easy walk if on Hollywood Blvd. The property has a pool, which looked nice although we didn't use it. The corridors are exterior, but were pretty secure after dark with the lobby and garage both locked and the perimeter wall around the pool and room area. Our room was spacious with a balcony overlooking the pool area (only 3 or 4 appeared to have this) and a kitchen. The room was clean, but the furnishings/vinyl flooring was a bit worn. A/C was in the form of a small wall unit, which worked well but we closed off the kitchen to help it cool faster. If you're staying more than one night, this wouldn't be as big of an issue with the unit running full-speed. This one all comes down to what you expect. If you are looking for a clean place to sleep for a night or two at a third of the usual Hollywood rates with an excellent location, this is for you. If the usual signs of wear that come with a 40-yr-old building bother you or if you want frills, it is not.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: AnabelT
Reviews.Content: The only thing pleasant about this stay was the location. The room was a decent size, but everything in there was soooo old looking that it was scary! The cups and dishes looked like they were rinsed off and put back into the cabinet. Our microwave looked like it hadn't been cleaned since 1902! ECK! On top of that the front desk kept calling our room with complaints from people who LIVE in the hotel stating that we were talking too loud.... WE HAD TO WHISPER IN OUR ROOM ON OUR VACATION! UNHEARD OF!!!!! The front desk called us at exactly 12:01 to let us know that it was time for us to check out!! DUHHHHHHH, we were on our way out the door. I have been to plenty of hotels and have never had anyone call my room a minute after check out and tell me that it was time to get out! RUDE RUDE RUDE! Sorry but I would rather fork out more money for a nice hotel next time. This place was disgusting!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!! at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: azrailer
Reviews.Content: This hotel certainly has a great location. We took the Glendale Airport Van to and from the Burbank Airport for 35 dollars each way and they were right on time to pick us up for the return ( Thanks Joseph) Easy access to light rail which gives you access to a lot of the area for a three dollar all day pass. We went to Universal Studios,Union Station, the Pantages Theater to see "Wicked" and even to buy some groceries all on the light rail. You are right behind a large Shopping Mall with plenty of eateries and the Chinese Theater on Hollywood Blvd at Highland. Our room had a complete kitchen down to a microwave, all utensils and even paper towels, two king beds,two television sets and a very clean bathroom with a seperate dressing area. All of this for 119.00 a night. Our stay was for four nights and every one was very polite and helpful the entire time. They have a computer for your use but without a printer so had to go to a close by internet cafe to print boarding passes. The area is a little noisey with deliveries to the mall so if you are a very light sleeper you may have concerns but for us the location made up for everything else. We would certainly recommend this hotel to friends and plan a return here in the fall.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sg1phileshipper
Reviews.Content: This might be the place to be when staying in Los Angeles. Located right behind the Kodak Theatre and Hollywood Boulevard, this is the best hotel I've stayed in Los Angeles. At $109/night for two person, we got a wonderful executive suite with a kitchen, which was enough for two people to cook in, and four people to eat in. The room had sliding door so you could easily walk onto the balcony. We had a wonderful view of the Hollywood Hills. Bed is comfortable and a huge King size, bathroom is excellent, and there's a big closet. Hotel has a pool, but we didn't use it, since there's so much to do. Staff: Very friendly and efficient. But my favorites were the cleaning staff. All of them were totally sweet and friendly and very helpful. And they seemed to appreciate to be able to talk to some of the guests. Our room was cleaned and left spotless each day. Location: Excellent, since you can do some shopping very close by and the area is very safe. You can easily walke around at night in the area, but don't wander to far up Hollywood Boulevard. The block aroud the hotel is very safe, up until the Gap there's no worries. And if you plan a trip to Universal Studios, don't take your car, but take the metro, since it's close to the hotel and the Studios are only one stop away. Traffic: This is LA and Highways are terrible. We went to Santa Monica from the Hotel and took Road 66. Major road works, so we got stuck for quite some time. Same thing with the Highways. And if you wanna go to orchid suites coming from Hollywood Boulevard, beware that you are not allowed to make a left turn onto Franklin Avenue at rush hour. I would advice you to turn left onto LaBrea Avenue from Sunset or Hollywood Boulevard and then a right onto Franklin Ave. It's gonna save you a lot of time and trouble. And if you get stuck in traffic. Keep calm and turn up the music! Parking: The hotel has a closed garage only guests can use, so no worries there. Going back home from the Orchid Suites? You have time to spare cause you plane leaves in the evening? No worries, just ask and you can leave you car in the garage. There's table and chairs near the pool. Except for your room, they let you use everything the hotel has to offer. Great value for the money. Clean, amazingly quiet for Los Angeles and a safe area

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 3sistersMelbourne
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location right behind the Chinese theatre. Hollywood Boulavard is literally a 1 minate walk and there is always plenty of action there. Staff were pleasant and the rooms were always very clean. The rates were reasonable and we had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Orchid a fine base for seeing LA by transit”
Reviews.Author: wanderer
Reviews.Content: Many people have noted the Orchid's fine qualities--price, location, helpful staff. On that I'd only add the recycling bin in the (good-sized) kitchen--with a city of LA sticker on it--something I'd never seen before in a hotel. It's a great idea because I know I wind up throwing out lots of newspaper and paper but this time could recycle them. One complaint--the radio part of the clock radio didn't work, the clock did. You don't have your 40 TV channels, but they never have anything good on them anyway. The Orchid is view-less, it's view is the blank back wall of the Hollywood Highland shopping center that is genuinely only steps from. It's worth the tradeoff. This trip I didn't rent a car and did fine--the Orchid was well situated for that. I used the Red Line subway that stops at Hollywood/Highland, the Fairfax Avenue-Hollywood Boulevard bus, the Sunset Boulevard bus, etc. There's also a lot of entertainment and eateries within walking distance. If you want to see LA car-free this is a good spot.

Reviews.Title: “Orchid suites a good choice when staying in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Noelvegas
Reviews.Content: We booked a two king-two queen deluxe suite for a few nights in mid January. The "apartment type" accommodation contained two bedrooms, two bathrooms and one large kitchen as well as a smaller kitchenette in our bedroom. In total we had 3 tvs in our apartment for five people which was great. The location is brilliant right behind the Kodak Theatre, in a very quiet, safe little alley, away from all the noise and lights of hollywood blvd. The hotel also has a pool which we didn't use because the weather was a little too cool. Staff are really pleasant and were quick to assist when needed. A couple of minor negatives include one of the bathroom doors being locked shut the last night from the inside and a little dirt around the window of the king bedroom but these have probably more to do with the age of the building than anything else. The wireless internet access was also very slow compared to what I am used to at home. However for less than $200 a night I don't know anywhere in Hollywood or Los Angeles for that matter where you can get a comfortable hotel suite in a great location with: 2 full sized King Beds 2 full sized Queen Beds 2 Bathrooms 3 TVs 1 large kitchen 1 smaller kitchenette Table/chairs etc. Certainly not five star quality but overall an excellent base for exploring Los Angeles at a great price

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: MC-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hollywood Orchid Suites for 7 nights during the first week of December. We arrived at 8am after traveling from Australia for over 16 hours. Thankfully, the staff were great and very friendly and our room was ready for us to check into. Although the room wasn't the most beautiful place we've seen, it was clean and well presented. We stayed in a King Executive room, which was huge. There was a separate kitchen with full size fridge and microwave, as well as a good sized table which could seat four. The location of this place is fantastic, only a few seconds' walk from the Hollywood Highland Center and Hollywood Blvd, with all of the touristy sights such as Graumann's Chinese Theater and the Walk of Fame. Another huge bonus of the Orchid Suites is the free internet access offered. Although there is only one computer, we never had a problem with waiting to use it. There was a strange smell in the room when we arrived, but it turned out to be the cleaning products and didn't really bother us too long. The only criticism we have is that the room was a little old and worn out, but that seemed to be LA in general. For the light sleepers, remember to pack earplugs - we could hear the person in the room next door snoring every night, so loudly it was as though we were in the same room. If you choose to stay at the Orchid Suites, just remember you're not paying the high prices of other hotels in the area, so don't compare it to those. The location couldn't be beaten, the staff were very friendly and helpful, and the room was clean and well maintained, which is what we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Find!”
Reviews.Author: Letmetravel!
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in April, and it was fantastic! The location is unbeatable (we were worried it might have been over exaggerated on the website!) the room we had was massive, with a great bathroom, and the pool was lovely! The laundry facilities also came in useful! I'd recommend this to everyone, and can't wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, but great location!”
Reviews.Author: TravellerAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood Orchid Suites for 4 nights in November 2006. You couldnt ask for a better location, so close to Hollywood Boulevard. At night, there was little noise, so was easy to sleep. The rooms were big, and the bed was extremely comfortable, and overall it was pretty clean. The only bad thing about this place is the terrible smell!! We could't even walk into our kitchen it smelt so bad. We had to sleep with the doors open, and when we did this everything was fine. The internet there was free which was good. The hotel staff were quite helpful also.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a great find!!”
Reviews.Author: slofeldmans
Reviews.Content: The suite was clean, large, and everything worked. Because the hotel is a converted apartment building, it had a lot of great things that you don't get in regular hotels, such four options of switches in the bathroom, fairly sound proof rooms, and windows that actually open. The bathtubs were equipped with those handy bars, for those of us getting older than we'd like. The beds were very comfortable (with new matresses!). The staff was really helpful. The maintenance man even gave my family a tour of the suite and made doubly sure everything worked when we checked in. The best thing was that the price was what was quoted, i.e. no add ons such as parking fees, spa fees, internet access, entertainment package fees...only the required bed tax (now 14%). It was very quiet, and unbelieveably close to all the main Hollywood attractions. My kids begged me to stay here everytime we come to Los Angeles. I am only too happy to grant their request. What a great value for my money!

Reviews.Title: “cheap...you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: rnstudychris
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Hollywood Orchid Suites, due to the wonderful reviews we read here on Trip Advisor. It was as the reviewer below me explained, a converted apartment building. The beds, as stated were awful, one of them even had ripped up sheets on the bed! The tubs...same as the other person said...dirty and the skid strips looked nasty..I am wondering if we had the same room, or if they are all like this! There is a kitchen, dont look around too much..you might see the roach motel that is in the bottom cupboard! I hated it here, I hated Hollywood period, but this hotel sure didnt help! They said that there is a roof top garden..there is...but nothing to write home about. I think the cleanest thing here was all the clothes in my bags, that never went into any of those drawers! This place, is convenient, cheap and very accesible to all the Hollywood things, but if you can pick somewhere clean, and with more comfortable beds and sans the roach motel...I would do that instead.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: traveler20062006
Reviews.Content: Yes it is cheap. Yes it is in a good location. But I wish I had paid more at a clean hotel and not felt like I had to wear shoes in the room because I did not want to step on the carpet with my bare feet. The widow in the bathroom was caked in dirt and what appeared to be mold. The bed was like laying on concrete. Absolutely horible sleeping conditions. I put a towel down in the tub when I took a shower because I didn't want to step on the non skid strips in the tub because they had filth on the side of them. Yuk. Fortunately I was only there two nights and could not wait to get out of there. My advise.... save up your money to stay at a real hotel not some converted apartment building. It was a miserable stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Orchid can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: RWHITE3
Reviews.Content: I have to concur with all the other reviews on here. This is the best hotel to stay in in Hollywood, bar none. The price is great, the rooms are clean and amazingly big, and the location is better than anything Hollywood has to offer. One block to Hollywood Boulevard and all the attractions there - a locked underground parking lot with pass-key and you can access the garage without leaving the hotel. My wife and I are going on vacation in two weeks and this will be our second stay here and after trying several different hotels, we plan on using the Orchid exclusively from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Location and value, plus spacious!”
Reviews.Author: beckymucha
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in one of the king deluxe suites here on a Wednesday night, it was only $99! There was enough room for 4 to stay comfortably. The kitchen was totally stocked with whatever you wanted for cooking, and we couldnt believe the extra bedroom. It was like staying in an apartment. You walk right through this corrider and just like that your in Hollywood and Highland mall. You are literally on the same block as all the happenings in Hollywood, there was a Robin Williams premier that night, and we just walked in the door of the Jimmy Kimmel Live show and got seats. We had a blast with so much to do, and the location and price of this hotel was key. The staff was very friendly, and though the rooms were older, it was also clean. We will definately be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelieveably Great Value”
Reviews.Author: kybusguy
Reviews.Content: The Hollywood Orchid is LITERALLY a 4 minute walk to Grauman's Chinese, Hollywood Walk of Fame, and where the tours of Hollywood originate, and a 2 minute walk to Kodak Theater Center (plenty of restaurants, shops, etc ). You could not ask for a better location for first-time Hollywood visitors. But, what makes the Orchid such a value is that despite it's location, it offers SPACIOUS suites (and, I DO MEAN spacious) right in the heart of Hollywood with extremely affordable prices. Highly recommended! Ohhhh, and thanks Trip Advisor reveiwers for turning me onto this place! I'll be back!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great value ,great location”
Reviews.Author: pami.eire
Reviews.Content: The location is brilliant litererally 2 minute walk from the walk of fame,very reasonable rate I think only paid 80 dollars a night , it was clean and comfortable and so spacious ,the bed was the biggest bed I have ever slept in! It wasnt really warm enough to use the pool but it looked nice, the lift was a bit small but still ok.

Reviews.Title: “An island of calm in a sea of madness”
Reviews.Author: ARL34
Reviews.Content: Imagine the madness of Hollywood & Highland, the mall, the Kodak Theatre, the Chinese Theatre, the throngs of tourists and crazy characters...then imagine walking through the mall, out the back exit and into a quiet leafy street, where your hotel is 20 yards away. That hotel is the Hollywood Orchid Suites - an island of calm in a sea of madness. You don't just get a room, you get a complete kitchen, and I mean complete...fridge, cooker, microwave, toaster oven, sink, all the cutlery, crockery and pots and pans you will need. Thus you can make your own meals if you don't like the stodgy fare of Mel's, Denny's etc. You get a pool that seems barely used, so you can probably have it to yourself if you want it. All this for only $99 + tax per night. Of course there are catches - the peaceful calm of Orchid Avenue is broken in the early hours by the delivery trucks to the mall, if you're on that side of the hotel. The rooms are clean and fully functional, but not modern. There aren't many channels on the TV. Between the tall buildings, the pool gets about 2 hours of sunshine a day. But these are minor niggles. If you have a car, there is free secure underground parking, if you don't, you have easy access to the Metro Red Line and a host of bus routes. Either way you have the world's greatest city on your doorstep. I recently spent 11 nights here and didn't want to go home. However, if sparkling luxury is what you're after, the Renaissance is across the road for three times the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a one week stay at the Hollywood Orchid Suites and I have nothing but good things to say about the experience. We had an executive suite for $99--a large bedroom with a sofa and seating area, a full kitchen and bathroom. I requested and received a non-smoking room. The room was old but it was spacious and clean. We were at the front of the building so there was noise from service vehicles at the Renaissance Hotel across the way but we had our a/c on most of the time so it didn't bother us at all. LA is a noisy city and on our first visit we stayed at the Holiday Inn Express on LaBrea--a much noisier location and a much smaller room. The use of the complimentary computer was great for checking bus schedules and e-mail. Our room also had a safe which I appreciate so I can put my passport away and not worry about it. The young man at the front desk was pleasant and helpful--something that's not always true in budget hotels in LA. And, of course, as everyone says, the location can't be beat. We relied on public transit the whole week. This hotel is not for everyone because it is a little tired around the edges but I loved it and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No Better Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kielyjw
Reviews.Content: From start to finish we had a great stay at this hotel! Even before we arrived, having emailed the hotel directly with questions - the staff responded straight away & were very helpful. Arriving from Australia & being too early to check in (but we could have if the room hadn't have had someone else staying in it the previous night), the staff were happy to hold our suitcases in a secure room while we went out & started exploring the Walk of Fame. The location is FANTASTIC - perfect for weary travellers who have spent their days out & about. So close to the subway (jump on it & travel 3 mins to Universal Studios), or straight through the mall across the road & you're at the historic & very fabulous El Capitan theatre. Ask at reception about their discounted tickets for Universal Studios - they saved us $13 per entry. While the suite is a little old - it was clean & very large & it's nice to have room to spread out. Having the free internet access was also a bonus. I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND this hotel - it's great value for money & you'll love the location. Thanks again to the fabulous staff for being so helpful & friendly during our stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great and close to everything!!”
Reviews.Author: brownie10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from August 8th-August 13th. The stay was great. We didn't LOVE the room, but the location of the hotel and the free parking made it that much better. The rooms are older, yet are clean and spacious. We stayed in an Executive Suite, which was great as it had a full kitchen, which is great if you like to make your own meals. We didn't, but atleast we had the option. The hotel is literally a two minute walk to a shopping mall (hollywood and highland complex) which has everything, including dining. And it is another two minutes from there down to Hollywood Boulevard. Very good value. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: Kezzab
Reviews.Content: this place was fantastic...great value for money, and so close to Hollywood boulevard..the staff were great....it is a little older, but clean and spacious and it was fantastic to have a kitchen..l would recommend this to anyone and personally are glad to have stayed there...AAAAAA++++

Reviews.Title: “Okay, great location”
Reviews.Author: winodino84
Reviews.Content: After a bad experience with Best Western we chose this hotel because our tourist guide recommended it. The hotel is located in downtown Hollywood, right behind the Kodak Theatre. They have their own parking garage, which you can open with your room key. They have a laundry service too, and an elevator. We had a Junior suite (smallest room) on the third floor. The room was very spacious, because it used to be an appartment building. We had a kitchenette too. Wireless internet didnÂ´t work properly, we had to sit on the floor right next to the door to have access (but that didnÂ´t work all the time). Staff was okay, but not very friendly. The worst thing was the connecting door, our neighbours had some kind of party the whole night, they had loud music first and then talked so loud and screamed and did some other things I wonÂ´t mention here. Best thing about the hotel is the location. Walking distance to Hollywood boulevard is about 2 minutes, there is a shopping centre nearby which has restaurants too and live music.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: gza222
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May. Location could not be better! Generally friendly service, clean rooms, free internet and value for money. Highly recommended if you're looking for a midrange hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just the best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family, 2 adults and 2 children aged 9 and 11 stayed 3 nights at the Orchid Suites as our first stopping point in a US trip. The confidence in my entirely web based selection was boosted when the Taxi driver from LAX knew the hotel well and commented postively about it. It certainly lived up to all descriptions and expectations. Not the newest or most recently refurbished establishment around, but incredibly spacious rooms (we had a ground floor room opening directly from the lobby) with a full size, fully equipped kitchen (not just a microwave and bar fridge only here). The staff were helpful, the room was ready early on our arrival. The location is in a quiet dead-end street, super convenient to Hollywood attractions and a short walk to the subway station that is the key to easy and effecient travel around most of LA. If you want to stay in the Hollywood area (keeping in mind if you are a first time visitor that Hollywood and Beverly Hills do not share the same glamour!!), like to prepare your own meals and are not looking for multiple star luxury then this is absolutely the place for you. The clientele are perfectly OK, just everday holiday makers from all over the world.

Reviews.Title: “Next time I will not look anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I chaperoned a small group of high school students visiting colleges in the LA area. The main reason we stayed at the Orchid Suites was because of the price, but now I cannot imagine having been happier anywhere else. While the facility is not top of the line, the rooms in our block were all clean, spacious and met our needs. One of the best experiences our group had was visiting the nearby grocery store to gather items to stock in our kitchens for the week we were there. The location was very nice - right in the heart of Hollywood. Although we used the nearby subway a time or two, we had rental cars which were very secure in the free parking garage under the hotel. While one should be cautious in any major metropolitan area, we felt safe walking through the area. I recommend the Orchid Suites to anyone looking for a great location and a good deal. What you get for your money here is one of the best values in the country.

Reviews.Title: “Good Sized Rooms”
Reviews.Author: tabz_0000
Reviews.Content: Located behind the Kodak Theatre in Hollywood, this is a charming little hotel. It is nothing flash, hard beds, uncomfortable pillows, but you get what you paid for. I wouldn't have a problem staying here again if I wanted to stay in Hollywood (but after seeing Hollywood I didn't like the area). Staff were friendly and the free undercover parking only sweetens the deal. This is a great value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Value, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel1704
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe suite from 11th to 14th April 2006. It's an amazing find. The rates are great. The location is unbelievable. It's located in a cul de sac behind Highland and Hollywood Shopping Centre (there's a back door so it only takes a minute to get there) with a good range of shops and restaurants and also contains the Kodak Theatre where the Oscars are held and the subway is very near by, (which was very easy to use and one stop to Universal Studios). It's on the same block as the Chinese Theatre with the Walk of Fame running along it. It's also quite close the freeway which made it easy to find and despite the traffic straight forward to get to Disney to in just over an hour. The area felt very safe and the accomodation had a good level of security. There was free, underground, locked parking and always free spaces. The staff were extreamley helpful and let us keep are car there after check out. The property is very well maintained and very clean. Our apartment was very spacious and clean. The furniture is very comfortable and well maintained although it might be a bit dated for some peoples' tastes . We had a large open plan lounge with sofa bed, armchairs, dinning table and four chairs, kitchen including microwave and a breakfast bar area. We had a seperate bedroom with king bed and there was three large wardrobes. The bathroom had a shower. There were two televisions and a safe in the room. There's a laundrette and an outdoor swimming pool. We would not hesitate to recommend this to others and certainly would be willing to return ourselves as we were very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: dalemeken
Reviews.Content: What a lucky find! An incredible location (right behind Graumann's Chinese Theatre but on a quiet cul-de-sac), only a block from the Red Line subway. I had what can best be described as an apartment-type unit for only $89 a night. The staff was friendly and helpful. Will definitely stay there again if I ever go back to LA.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel met our needs perfectly. I was traveling with my husband and two adult daughters. We have them the bedroom and we had the bed in the front room. Even though our room was on the first floor, right by the pool there was never any noise. Also it's on a safe street and seconds away from the Hollywood tourist scene, which thought was a benefit. Free parking and I always felt very safe there. My ONLY complaint is that the room reeked of cigarette smoke. Other than that it was clean and you could not find a better price for a two bedroom room. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed- Did we stay at the same place?????????”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews I expcated a lot more from this place. I actually wondered if we were staying in the same place. I agee with eveyone the location is wonderful- could't ask for a better location. In addition it also offered free parking and internet access. The room was dated, carpet was worn and it smelled of stale smoke. I did not feel it was clean. As a matter of fact, the shower curtain had black mildew all over the back, the windowsill in the bathroom was just filled with dirt and the placemat on the kitchen table had dried ketchup stuck on it. We had a double queen suite. On the back bed the, there was a hole in the bottom sheet large enough my husbands foot kept getting stuck in it. Finally the pillows were just awful. I was very disappointed and will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: kathy1749
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Orchid Suites and were pleased. The staff was very friendly. My husband got the flu the day we checked in and the woman at the front desk was so concerned and helpful. She also made sure we know about special happenings around town. The place is not beautiful but very clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected and Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: DavePortland
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive given the extremely reasonable rate of $79 per night, but our suite ended up being clean, had lots of room to store things, and had a full kitchen with range, refrigerator, microwave, toaster oven, and dishes as well as a small balcony. Our king size bed was comfortable. The location was perfect--only a very short walk to the Red Line station, shopping, restaurants, etc. I was concerned that it would be noisy, given that the property is located adjacent to a large loading dock, but I don't recall hearing any trucks at night or early in the morning. The management provided a great map and list of restaurants, stores, and attractions in the area as well as up-to-date movie listings at nearby cinemas. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TheNewsGuy
Reviews.Content: Well equiped suites right in the middle of Hollywood. Steps to Graumanns and Kodak Theater. We had lots of room, comfortable unit but showing its age. Great price (about $70/night) Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Love it, so comfy and roomy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had mixed feelings going into this hotel with the reviews I had read on here, but I was very happily surprised. I have junior room, $69/night and it is HUGE. There are two double beds, two huge closets, a big bathroom (that you can heat up!!) and a small kitchen. The kitchen has 1 burner, a coffee maker, a teapot, a sink and small fridge. Cooking utensiles, dishes, cups, silverware...everything you need is included. Including the kitchen table!! The beds are comfortable and while it is not 2006-modern it is still pretty up-to-date. The tv is a little old but it still works fine. I would DEFINATELY reccommend this hotel to anyone and everyone. It is very close to everything and it is very, very safe. Everything has a lock, or 3 (which the doors in the actual rooms have) the parking lot, the front door, it was all locked. I will be here for the next week and I am completely confident that I will be fully satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but Nice”
Reviews.Author: mrsean
Reviews.Content: Hotel is essentially an old apartment complex, therefore rooms are spacious and 'homely' if somewhat aging. Unfortunately, the walls are rice-paper thin. Was woken many mornings by cleaning staff singing, laughing, and cleaning in adjacent rooms. I'm pleased they are happy in their job, but they can't realize how noisy they are being. Also, I could easily hear conversations of other guests through the walls! The location is superb, parking fantastic, staff were great. Unfortunately, being behind the Kodak theatre has one drawback...noise. Was woken more than once by the sound of rubbish truck contractors working at the rear of the theatre (See photo). All in all, if noise isn't an issue, then go for it!

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: HitTheRoad2000
Reviews.Content: Since reading the reveiws here prompted me to stay at the hotel, I feel I should contribute! I will just be repeating what many others have said: - price is great - location behind the Kodak Theatre & close to everything you need - room was very big and very clean - staff was really very, very friendly and helpful - property is very secure - parking is free - free wireless access to the internet & use of a PC in the lobby if you don't have a laptop this hotel is a great value!

Reviews.Title: “This is the place I'd stay”
Reviews.Author: Sharad2011
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid ($89 /day), what we got was way aboove expectation. People are friendly. Lady at reception spent almost 30 minutes, giving us various options where we can go (as we had one spare day). And spent 20-25 minutes, trying to arrange some tourist bus to go around places. This is the hotel I'd stay if I go to Hollywood again!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected for that price.Beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We did not expect to find such a wonderful hotel for the price of 89$ per night just right in the heart of Hollywood: behind the Kodak Theatre, close to everything you need. The room was excellent - very big and clean, with a nice kitchen. The staff was really very, very friendly and helpful in providing us with information of any kind. The hotel is very secure: though there is a safe in the room, you don't really need it since getting into the hotel is quite impossible without the key. Parking is for free - which saved us a lot of money. And you have a free wireless access to the internet. All in all, we highly recommend this hotel for everybody, since it was really great! We would stay there again any time!

Reviews.Title: “Bargain in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: wind006
Reviews.Content: YES the Orchid Suites is a bargain in Hollywood! Our family of 6 stayed in a 2 bedroom unit for 2 nites. The location is ideal for visiting Hollywood and Universal Studios. Keep in mind the hotel is old and we did not like the smell-- kind of old cigarette smell. The swimming pool is tiny and not heated while we were there. The pool was too cold to swim in. We had to wait 20 minutes for our room to be ready at check-in even though I called two hours before arrival and we arrived in the early evening. The staff are for the most part very helpful. Parking was in the underground garage was great with easy access to 101.

Reviews.Title: “This is THE place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: ragjunk
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in this hotel for a night in Dec. 2005. What a gem it is! We stayed in many different places in and around Hollywood area before, but none was this good. As other reviewers mentioned, it is at walking distance to Hollywood walk of fame. The area felt very safe. The parking was free and secured in an underground facility. The hotel looks more like an "old" apartment. We stayed in their 2 bedroom suite, which was very spacious. The kitchen was very spacious and functional. Everything was clean and just perfect. The staff was very friendly. They even let us keep our car parked there for a few hours after the check-out, so we could take a walk to the Hollywood walf of fame. The facility has one swimming pool, but since it was Dec. we didn't use it. The carpet in the room is ready for a replacement, I guess. While it is clean, you could feel the old carpet and its smell. This is exactly where I stay in my next visit to Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay, amazing location/ price”
Reviews.Author: Traveller071
Reviews.Content: Honestly this place is great. The price is amazing compared to many other places in L.A and the location is great as well. This was the only part of Hollywood that I felt comfortable in. Plus the free parking made it easier to have a car - because you need a car if you want to see everything in L.A. Its much faster, easier, cheaper, and safer if you just rent a car.- Even though the rooms are outdated style wise, they are still clean and large. The staff was helpful and friendly. One thing you have to remember is that this is a budget hotel, probably like a 2 star. So there are no extras and nothing is fancy. But it is still great value and I would definetly recommend it everyone.
